1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
Eventually, after several long hours of traversing from Gotham City to New York City by Greyhound Bus, Dr. Pamela Isley, better known as the alluring human-plant hybrid Poison Ivy, had finally reached her intended destination: The apartment complex on Coney Island. She stepped off the bus, wearing a beige overcoat over her black and green unitard outfit. Of course, knowing Poison Ivy, she blew a seductive kiss towards the bus driver, who happened to have been seduced due to the pheromones her body secretes.

From there, the bus driver subconsciously slammed down on the gas pedal, quickly accelerating the Greyhound Bus past the usual speed limit around Coney Island. Ivy, of course, casually but calmly sashayed her way toward the main entrance to the building, where a familiar individual stood by the door taking a smoke from a cigarette. In appearance, he was about half the height of Ivy herself, but he was built like an athlete, wearing a black leather jacket, brown shirt, pair of jeans, and a solid pair of rugged leather boots, as his black hair dangled just around the nape of his neck. This was none other than "Big Tony", one of the residents on Coney Island, as well as the owner of a... "unique" business, per say.

"Tony." Ivy quipped, greeting the dwarf of a man with a gentle smirk on her ruby red lips. Of course, Tony easily noticed the red-haired botanist, smirking as well as he retorted, "Well, if it isn't the landlady's favorite gal! Ivy, right?" "Good to see that you remember me, Tony. I take it that Harley is still inside?" Ivy queried, asking him if Harley was still in the apartment building or not. Obviously, Big Tony firmly nodded in confirmation towards the human-plant hybrid, where he then spoke toward her and explained, "Oh yeah, the boss lady is still up there with (Name). Though if you ask me, they're certainly enjoying each other's company."

"*giggle* Of course they are. Anyway, tell Goat-Boy and the others I said hello." Ivy retorted, where she then promptly walked inside the apartment building, just as Tony briefly waved his right hand as he quipped, "Can do, Red." From there, Ivy proceeded to climb up several flights of stairs towards the lofty apartment where you and the corpulent Harley Quinn were residing in. Of course, upon reaching the double doors that led inside the apartment condo, Ivy could easily hear the distinct chatter between you and the substantially larger Harley Quinn, along with hearing what sounded like gunfire and explosions.

Thinking that there was another group of contract killers after that bounty on Harley's head, Ivy instinctively pulled out a few plant seeds, growing them at a rapid pace, using the enhanced vines to pry open the door with ease. Of course, both you and Harley easily heard and noticed what was going on at the door, just as Ivy came rushing in as she exclaimed, "HOW DARE YOU LAY Your... Wait, what's going on?"

"Red, you're 'ere!" Harley excitedly chirped, blitzing her botanist friend with surprising speed and agility despite her current size and girth, causing Ivy to be swiftly pinned to the floor by the heftier Harley Quinn. Of course, Ivy couldn't exactly say no to being greeted by her favorite Gotham City Siren in such a provocative yet erotic manner, just as Harley planted an excited kiss upon Ivy's ruby red lips, then spoke toward the female human-plant hybrid and gleefullyquipped, "So... How was da ride over 'ere, Red?" "...A little dull for my tastes, darling. Now, if you don't mind, would you please be a dear and get off me?" Ivy politely answered, asking if Harley could get off of the human-plant hybrid, especially since the clown girl was now considerably bigger than she was when she met you.

"Oops! My bad, Red!" Harley retorted, quickly performing a perfect backflip despite her increased weight and girth, as she easily dismounted hersrrlf off of Ivy with little to no effort. From there, Ivy quickly stood back up onto her own two feet, courtesy of some minor assistance from her plants. In appearance, her physique was still the same as it was in the comics, which was a complete contrast to the substantially larger Harley Quinn, where you then proceeded to greet Ivy as you said, "Hey, Ivy! It's been a while since we last saw one another."

"Yes, I suppose you're correct on that, (Name)." Ivy replied, where she then turned her head and noticed what was displayed on the Flatscreen TV, her mind putting two and two together as she asked, "So... I assume all of that noise I've just heard was YOUR doing, (Name)?" "...Yeah, sorry about that, Ivy. Turns out Harley really wanted me to play Far Cry 5 with her on my PlayStation 4." You answered, scratching the back of your head out of mild embarrassment for Ivy's understandable reaction. After all, Harley still has that bounty on her head, so of course Ivy's reaction was understandable considering.

From there, Ivy then calmly spoke toward the corpulent Harley Quinn and queried, "So, Harley... What do you have in mind for us today?" Of course, Harley already had something in mind, as she sported an obviously gleeful grin upon her plump pink lips and somewhat cherubic unnaturally pale face, where she then spoke toward you and Ivy as she gleefully chirped...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Ivy's Arrival

choices: It's a real twig of a girl, but damn can she skate.
It's a girl as big as Harley, though she doesn't look as agile.
It's a medium-built girl, but she's hard to read. No telling what her skill is.
It's...someone Harley knows?
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
"Der's this new joint downtown called da Skate Club," Harley said, already waddling towards the closet to get her things. "I've heard they've got some class act entertainment."

You shrug. "A roller derby? Sure, going to watch that kind of thing could be fun. And yeah, it does get pretty rough."

Harley giggles and kisses your cheek. "No, silly. I'm thinkin' of us actually competin'. Well, me and Ivy anyways. I know you ain't the most graceful on your feet, puddin'."

She's already got a pair of extra wide roller blades slung over her shoulders, and she starts gathering more stuff. She tosses a few things at Ivy, who holds her pair of skates out before her as if it were a disgusting bug. "You can't be serious," Ivy says. "Darling, I love spending time with you, but a roller derby? How...quaint."

Harley's ample rear shakes a little as she finishes grabbing the last of her things. "Well, you don't have ta if you don't wanna. You can just watch. I know how you like to watch," she says with a seductive wink. "But it's more than just skatin'. It's a real fight, to the death! Anyways, ya skate, you find weapons in the rink, and you beat each other to a pulp. Fun, right? Da best part: no rules!"

You gulp, not wanting to spoil her fun, but also not wanting to get into more danger than you need to. "You, uh, sure about that?" you ask. "I mean, should you be doing that kind of stuff, you know, in your condition?"

To be honest, despite the fact that she has displayed her agility time and time again, you still find it hard to believe that she'd even be up to such a feat at her size. That, and the fact that you've just been hit with the revelation of being a father has you kind of on edge about the idea. You still need to ask her about that, without seeming like too much of an idiot.

"Oh, don't you worry about dat, puddin'. Those fruit's Ivy's been givin' me do the trick, and you know no one's faster than me."

Ivy rolls her eyes. "Well, like you just said, it isn't really about speed. I'm going to have to agree with (Y/N); are you really sure we should just go jumping headlong into danger?"

"Where's your sense of adventure, Red?"

"Left it back at Arkham, darling. All I'm saying is can't we just go to watch the entertainment, and not be a part of the act?"

Harley huffs and places her hands on her soft hips. "Well, I'm goin', and the rest of ya pussies can stay here for all I care."

You intervene before she can get too mad. After all, you hate to see her when she's angry with you. "No, I'll go, and I'll support you, babe," you say, rubbing small circles on her belly to sooth her. "I'm just worried is all. I care about you."

This seems to ease her and she giggles, kissing you. "Aw, thanks, puddin'. But you don't got nothin' to worry about. This is me we're talkin' about."

The two of you look to Ivy. She crosses her arms, and sighs. "Alright, I'll go. Someone's got to babysit the two of you, it seems."

* * *


You arrive at what at first seemed like such a hole-in-the-wall place. It was a rather run-down building that wasn't much to look at on the inside. Of course, you realize, that kind of was the purpose. After all, no one wants the wrong people sniffing around a place like this. Harley seemed to know guy at the door, and you wonder how often she's been coming to this place before suggesting it to you. The doorman easily lets the three of you in, and you're hit with a barrage of sensory experiences.

It's somewhat dark, to create an intense mood as colored lights swirl around the rink. People are everywhere, all jockeying for a good place to watch all the main action. You push your way through the crowd, and finally get a spot near the edge of the rink, just in time to see two girls duking it out. One's swinging some kind of blade at the other, who's nimbly skating around the attacks, swinging what looks like some kind of mace over her head. This doesn't last long before second girl pummels the other with the mace, knocking her out in a bloody mess. You wince a little, worrying what Harley has managed to get herself into this time.

"Amazin', isn't it?" Harley says, nudging you. "I'm goin' to go get ready. Wish me luck, puddin'."

You wish as much luck as humanly possible. This is insane, you keep telling yourself. Not that everything else up to this point hasn't been a little off to you, but this has you worried. Ivy doesn't look to pleased to be here either. "Because I wanted to spend my evening crowded up against a bunch of manhandlers with such...'wonderful' odors."

You chuckle. "Yeah, not exactly smelling like a rose here is it?"

She shoots you a look. "You get one plant pun, lover boy, just one."

You stiffen. "You know, you can trust me with her. I love Harley more than anything. I would never do anything wrong to her."

"That remains to be seen. Look, you seem like a nice kid, but...Harley's my friend, perhaps my only friend. I'm always going to be looking out for her."

You nod. "I get that, but you know, ease up a little. She's a big girl now. I mean, uh..." You didn't mean to say it like that.

"I know," she says. "Although, you are going to have to explain to me what happened there." She was referring to Harley's increased size.

A few memories start to flood back to you, and you're about to begin telling her, when the announcer's voice booms out. "Alright, ladies and gentlemen. Have we got a show for you! Tonight, we've got the one, the only, Harley Quinn here tonight to face off in the arena. And, her opponent's going to be..."
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Skate Club

choices: Harley wins. You never should have doubted her.
Gonzales has speed on her side. She beats Harley easily.
An unexpected trap allows Harley to just barely win.
Harley wins in a most unorthodox way.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
"Guadalupe Gonzales, the fastest girl on the rink, earning herself the name Speedy Gonzales."

Entering the ring is this short, skinny, Hispanic girl who clearly knows how to cater to the crowds. She's already taking what looks like a victory lap before the match, waving to the crowds, and throwing a few flirtatious winks to the men in the audience. Her dark hair falls to her shoulders and whips around with the slightest turn of her head. But the one thing you notice above all others is that the announcer is right: she is fast.

She's incredibly quick on her feet, easily turning and maneuvering around on her skates. She's definitely going to have the jump on speed over Harley, which does worry you a little. For as agile as your girlfriend is at her size, she's nowhere close to how fast this girl can move. You just hope that Harley knows what she's doing.

The announcer continues. "Alright, you two know how this works. We're giving you ten minutes in the rink. You can find and grab any weapons you see on the rink, but also watch out for a few traps of our own. And finally, there are no rules. You come out of the rink alive, you win."

You gulp at that thought. "C'mon, Harley," you mutter to yourself. "You'd better make it out alive."

You look over at Ivy, who has a look of worry of her own. Harley may have changed her ways, and she may have decided to settle down, but that didn't change her erratic choices to live a life of danger when she could. You just wish she wasn't killing you one grey hair at a time with it.

Both girls roll up to the starting line, waiting for the timer to start. Harley has a big grin on her face. No matter what she puts herself through, she always makes it her first priority to have fun. Gonzales has only a look of determination. This is going to be one for the books, you think.

The buzzer goes off and both girls take off around the rink, Gonzales already halfway around before Harley can really get going. In the grand scheme of things, this isn't a race, so that's not a problem. Harley just have to be more skilled with a weapon. You just hope Gonzales doesn't get the jump on her with a weapon of her own. You scan your eyes around the rink to see what's out there. There's really a little bit of everything, no shortage of weapons.

Harley's already got her eye on a big sledge hammer. It's not her usual mallet, but it's big, heavy, and unorthodox, like her. Once she has her mind set to something, that's what she's going to do. She starts picking up the pace, her enormous form swaying and jiggling as she gathers speed. Her pudgy arm is already outstretched for the large hammer when she jumps. A small series of blades had popped out of the floor, nearly knocking her off balance. Thankfully, she saw it coming. That must be one of the traps the announcer mentioned. Still, that means she missed her opportunity to grab the sledge hammer. She'll have to get it on her next go around.

Meanwhile, Speedy Gonzales has already grabbed a couple of blades of her own, and she was skating even faster to get close to Harley. You hold your breath, hoping she's got a plan for this.

Gonzales comes up from behind and tries to take a swing at Harley. She only nicks the side of her wide shorts before Harley turns around on her. "Damn it! You ruined my outfit!" she cries. "Oh, you're gonna pay."

She gets ahead of her for a little, getting ready to make her second pass for the hammer. She's able to grab it. Good, you think, at least she's armed and she has a chance. You look up at the clock. Only two minutes have passed. According to Harley, things really get going only in the last few minutes of the round. "Come on, babe! You got this!" you shout.

Harley maneuver's herself around, already getting ready for Gonzales to come at her again. She parries the swing of her blades again, and tries to get a few blows in herself, but the hammer is too slow moving of a weapon, and someone like Gonzales moves too fast for her to get any attacks in.

For a while, Harley just resorts to trying to push the smaller girl over, hoping that will give her an advantage. Gonzales isn't just fast: she's strong too. She's able to withstand your titanic girlfriend's force, and even tries to push her back. You can see that something's about to give in Harley's ankles as her bottom shakes and quivers from the force. "Get out of there!" you holler. "Get around her."

Ivy touches your shoulder. "Calm down, lover boy. She's got this." You can tell that her voice is quivering. She's not so sure herself.

Harley breaks away from the stalemate, and tries to circle around to come up from behind, and have a little inertia of her own to fight back. But, Gonzales is hot on her tail, and you're not sure if she'll able to get ahead of her. However, a little hope comes your way. Another of the rink's traps, a swinging club, comes within inches of hitting Gonzales in the head. She dodges it, but it definitely slows her down. The two are now on opposite sides of the rink. You look at the clock. It's halfway through the round.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Size vs. Speed

choices: Harley wins more than the match. She wins the grand prize!
The crowd may approve, but Harley did cause a lot of trouble.
You go and help Harley clean up before she can get into more trouble.
Turns out, this is only the first round in a tournament.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
It doesn't take long for Gonzales to catch up to Harley, and of course, what you feared is about to happen. Harley is a much bigger target than her opponent. She manages to take a few more swings, forcing your girlfriend to really work at it to maneuver away from her, and it's starting to really slow her down. So far, it looks like a game of cat and mouse, where Harley is, in this case, and incredibly big mouse.

Still, she gets in a few blocks with her hammer, which at least keeps the smaller girl at bay. But, it's only doing so much. After all, Harley can't have much of an offensive game with this girl coming at her every five seconds. At least, she's still in this, and more importantly, still alive. But with the clock ticking, something's got to give.

And it was something incredibly unexpected...

Harley pushes Gonzales back a few feet with her momentum, giving her a slight break to plan her next move. But, as time gets closer, the girl's gotten more brazen. She goes into a full-speed throttle attack. Harley braces and is able to block the brunt of the attack, but she is pushed backwards, and Gonzales is able to nick the skin on the side of your girlfriend's pale belly. You're about ready to go climbing over the railing to go rescue her, but you know you have to trust that she knows what she's doing.

And it seems that she does, or at least she had a plan before luck helped her out. She turns around and starts skating with as much speed as she can muster. Even for her athletic abilities, this is starting to wear her down. But you can tell what she's trying to do. Harley may sometimes be a little off, but she's smarter than people give her credit for. She's timed how the rink's traps work and when they go off. She's purposefully trying to lure Gonzales into one of those.

It just might be crazy enough to work. The smaller girl continues to skate at full speed, trying to ram Harley with everything she has, and by the look in her eyes, it looks like she intends for it to be a bloodbath. But all the while, she's not paying attention to the rest of the rink: only Harley. And you notice that your girlfriend skates over the row of blades before they rise, and for the briefest second, it does trip Gonzales up. She's not as injured as the audience would have hoped, but she certainly takes a spill, and tumbles over.

She's lying in a heap, which gives Harley the perfect opportunity to strike, but just as she can get her mass turned around, the girl is up and racing towards her again, fire in her eyes.

It looks like Harley is hoping to pull the same trick again. Maybe she didn't notice that it was done on purpose. You cross your fingers, hoping for the best.

However, that's not even remotely close to what happens. Harley's still trying to get her speed going, and the girl's already gaining on her, blade drawn, ready to go for an outright plunge into Harley's back. You can't watch, yet at the same time, you can't look away either. Harley sees this attack coming, and tries to do her best. She swings down the hammer near Gonzales' feet, and sure enough, that does knock her down yet again. But this time, when she falls, she knocks Harley's feet out from under her.

This proves to be the fatal error, in more ways than one. For one, you're worried about Harley. A fall is one thing, but in her condition, you're concerned. Second, there's still the matter of weapons that each girl has in their hands. This could get ugly. Thankfully, none of these things become the problem: it's the fact that Gonzales, in her fall, slides right underneath the falling Harley.

What follows is a bloody, spectacular mess. All five-hundred-plus pounds of Harley come falling down upon Gonzales' head as your girlfriend lands on her cushy rump. At her size and momentum, this is almost as if Harley had swung her sledgehammer down upon the girl's head. You hear a sickening crack, followed by a pop. Bloody, mushy residue is spread all over that rink floor, and unfortunately, you just happened to be in the area of the audience that was the splash zone. A few bits of brain pelt your cheek.

At first, everyone is silent. Yeah, death happens in the arena, according to Harley, but this is certainly something unprecedented. It's certainly a lot gorier than they had expected. This really doesn't matter to you as you slide under the guard rail to go help Harley to her feet. But, as she stands up, the crowd roars in approval. Not only did she win, she gave them one of the best shows of the night. Harley smiles and takes a little bow, twirling her hair, and giving a good show, not really noticing the bloody remnants of her opponents on the seat of her pants. You roll your eyes. Never a dull moment with this one.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Crushed

choices: Something strange happens. There's a strange man waiting outside.
Something strange happens. A shootout starts.
Something strange happens. Someone stole your stuff.
Nothing out of the ordinary. You and Harley go to the bedroom.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
"You are really lucky, you know that?" you say as you help Harley clean up in the locker rooms.

You're busy trying to help her wash off as much of the human remains that are still on her ample rear, though you know that it's going to take some seriously discreet laundry skills to get the blood stains out of her shorts.

She waves you off. "It was nothin', puddin'," she says. "That was like my backup plan anyways. Pipsqueak didn't stand a chance."

You roll your eyes and continue helping her clean up. "Yeah, well, you certainly know how to try and kill me one grey hair at a time. You had me worried there for a second."

She turns around and wraps you up in a huge, squishy hug. "Aw, you worried about me, puddin'? That's so sweet of ya. But you know you never have to worry. I know how to take care of myself."

"I know," you say, trying to get a breath of air in, "but sometimes we live a really dangerous life. It's hard not to worry."

"As long as we got each other, we'll make it through whatever is thrown at us."

You can't help but love her hope and enthusiasm. True, you guys have been through a lot, but somehow, you do come out okay, you know. You can't imagine facing these kinds of dangers and this life with anyone else. "Of course," you say.

Ivy walks in to check on you two. She mockingly has her hands over her eyes. "I'm not disturbing you two am I?" she asks. "I don't think I need vulgar images burned into my mind."

Harley laughs. "No, nothin' steamy yet." Then she leans close to your ear and murmurs. "That's for when we get home."

"Speaking of," you say. "We really ought to get back home before we cause more collateral damage around here."

Ivy makes a disgusted face. "Given the intelligence level of the crowds here, I don't think they would mind. You're rather a fan favorite with them tonight."

Harley giggles. "What can I say? I always know how to entertain a crowd."

"Alright, one more wave to your adoring fans," you say, "and then we're out of here."

She pouts. "Aw, we can't stick around for one more round?"

You kiss her cheek. "Maybe next week."

She beams. "You mean it? We can come back? You're not gonna be a worry-wort are you?"

"I promise. And yes, we can come back. It's scary, to be sure, but fun."

The three of you leave without much fuss, though the crowds are still singing Harley's praises for her amazing win. Some things never cease to surprise you. Going back out into the crisp night air, you're glad to finally have enough quiet to actually hear your thoughts again.

However, not long after getting outside, you hear a familiar sound. Harley's stomach starts to growl. "Well, Skate Club certainly works up an appetite. I'm starvin'."

You laugh. "Well, that can easily be fixed." You point over across the street. "There's some food trucks over there. I could use a little something myself."

This gets Harley excited and she eagerly waddles over. You and Ivy follow close behind. Ivy seems to have resigned herself to this idea with a mildly grudging look. Harley easily spots a burger truck and sets to ordering as many delicious things as she can think of. She leaves the stand with about four burgers, two foot-long hotdogs, a large order of fries, and a steaming pile of onion rings. That's your Harley, you think. She's never been afraid to get what she wants.

You remember that that was exactly how she was when you two first met. You had just arrived in New York to visit an old friend. You got off the bus in a rather unsavory neighborhood. Not more than five minutes into walking towards your destination, you're blindsided by a mugger who pushed you into an alley. You knew he had messed with the wrong guy, and you were about to pull your own knife out of your coat when the guy is knocked flat to the ground by an oversized hammer. You looked up, and there she was: lithe and beautiful as ever. You knew who she was from the moment you saw her, so you were definitely surprised.

She took a few more swings at the mugger, and he eventually ran off. You could only sit there, staring at her. "Don't get used to it," she said in her Brooklyn accent. "I ain't no hero or nothin'."

"Can I buy you a drink?" you asked before she can say anything else.

She smiled. "Why do you think I saved your sorry ass? I'm a girl who knows what she wants."

You think fondly on those memories as you sit on a bench with her, enjoying your food. You wonder how you got so lucky. And it's even better now, especially since there's more of her to love, and more of a view for you.

You know better, but to Ivy's surprise, Harley manages to finish the small mountain of food, patting her stuffed gut. "That hit the spot," she says. "But, now I want to get back to the apartment. You and I still have some unfinished business to do." She throws an arm around your shoulder with a wink.

With the prospect of more time for fooling around, you eagerly help her to her feet and the three of you make it back to the apartment. However, upon arrival...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Get Out of Dodge

choices: We just gotta prepare for next time.
We gotta find some way to call off the hit.
I'm gonna call in a favor.
Let's get 'em where it hurts.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
Silence is broken the minute you open the door to the apartment. You hear the rapid fire of guns, at least three you think, one of them semi-automatic. You grab Harley's wrist and dive down for cover behind the couch. Ivy crouches behind the partially opened door.

You're still trying to discern the source of the sounds to know where they're at. You're almost inclined to say that they're waiting in the next building over, but Harley knows better. "Two in the kitchen and one in the bedroom," she says. "These guys are chumps if they think three was gonna be enough."

"Harley, wait," you say. "You don't even have any of your weapons."

"I gotta do somethin'," she says with a pleading look. "They messed with the wrong girl this time. This time, they're on my turf. I gots homefield advantage, puddin'."

Before you can raise any objections, she kisses you on the cheek and stands up. "Alright, ya bunch of under-bellied worms!" she shouts. "You asked for it. Here comes the mayhem."

It's something you haven't seen since the early days when you two were dating. Harley had been known to go through bouts of psychotic break-infused bursts of strength back when she was a villain...back when she used to date the Joker. This was the stuff of legends, and you knew a few former thugs who still had nightmares after having been on the receiving end of one of these attacks. However, ever since she had started dating you, those situations had become less and less frequent. Still, that hadn't changed the fact that you had seen them before, and they still did happen. It was probably some sort of residual effect from some of the weird shit Joker used to do to her. But now, you have to admit, it did come in handy.

Whatever happened during these things, Harley reached levels of speed, strength, and acrobatic skill you didn't think was possible for a human being. In a series of several cartwheels, she bounces into the bedroom and snaps the neck of the shooter in there with almost no effort. That's the most chilling part of these experiences: she can kill so effortlessly, and sometimes without even knowing she had done it. When you've asked her what these experiences are like, she describes it as some kind of high; senses heightened, and all that stuff. At the same time, she describes it like being in a dream, and she doesn't always have a grasp on reality during those sorts of things. When she comes out of it, she would tell you, it's like waking up in the wrong bed. She has no memory of where she was or what she had done for several minutes after. That's what scares you the most.

Now in the bedroom, she's able to get a hold of her famous baseball bat. She comes tearing out of the room, blood-lust in her eyes. She runs for the first attacker in the kitchen. She throws her legs around his neck and pulls herself over his head. Before she can even get a swing in, her immense body weight causes his body to collapse, and you can hear several sickening snaps where his back breaks in several places. She gets a creepy gleam in her eye as she looks at her last opponent.

All the while, she had been dodging bullets like they were just part of the air around her. And the last shooter is in the middle of reloading his magazine when she sets her sights on him. You can read that look. That's the look of a cornered animal. He frantically tries to finish reloading, his hands shaking, but he's no match. She already lays into him with the baseball bat, striking his skull over and over again. You can hear each bloody crack.

He drops to the floor as Harley keeps swinging at him, and at last, her rage dissipates. She falls to her knees on the floor, gasping for breath. These episodes usually leave her pretty winded. You run to her and cradle her head in your arms, whispering words of comfort and telling her it's alright. She doesn't say anything, but you know those words will register with her eventually, and she'll be back to her old self.

"So, I guess the hit's still on," you say to no one in particular. "God, these guys just never give up." You had just gotten the place cleaned up after their last attempt.

The third shooter suddenly stirs and starts crawling across the kitchen floor. He's easily stopped as a stray vine, courtesy of Ivy wraps around his throat and strangles the last bit of life out of him. "Knowing a group like this, they probably won't stop until they finish the job," she says, sitting beside the two of you.

How long do you two think you can keep this game of cat and mouse up, you wonder. This certainly isn't something you want to face for the rest of your lives. True, you know you and Harley can handle it, but what about the children? You look to Harley, who seems to be somewhat recovering. "So, what are we going to do about this?" you ask her.

She's still sitting there, rocking while holding her knees. You aren't sure if she's fully aware yet. These bouts take their time on her. Still, she's able to murmur one thing.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: The Hit is On

choices: While you were scrambling across the rooftops, you began to reminisce...
Almiist an hour later, you reached the Gang of Harkeys tenant building.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
"Let's get 'em where it hurts!" Harley growled, still feeling a residual sliver of her dissipating rahe she aptly named her "Mayhem Mode".

However, just as you and Ivy helped the rotund clown girl back up onto her feet, Harley lost her footing for a brief moment or two, which made you very concerned, as you spoke toward her and said, "Harley, as much as I know better than to stop you... I'm afraid you're gonna have to sit this one out."

Of course, Harley managed to register your words, which made her reasonably upset as she protested, "...What!?! What are ya talkin' 'bout, puddin?! I'm as fit as a fiddle!"

"Harley... I'm afraid your boy-toy here makes a very valid argument." Ivy retorted, obviously but surprisingly agreeing with you on what you said. However, Harley wasn't having none of it, as she exclaimed, " Aww! C'mon, Red! Not you too!"

"Harleen... You're pregnant with kids. Our kids! I know all too well that you can handle yourself in a fight, but look at yourself: You're still recovering from the Skate Club fight with that Speedy Gonzales bitch. So please, just sit this one out for now. Let me handle these assassins." You said, calling Harley by her real name to emphasize how serious you were in your decision, especially since you didn't want to see Harley try and get herself killed.

Of course, despite her reasonable protests, Harley reluctantly had to agree with you and Ivy, where Harley exhaled a deep frustrated sigh in response, just as you and Ivy gently sat her fattened rump down upon the large leathery couch, with Ivy sitting alongside the rotund clown girl, as Harley then spoke toward you and replied, "*long sigh* ...Alright fine, puddin'. As much as I friggin' hate ta be sidelined, I'll sit out on this one."

"But I'm not goin' ta ignore what just happen'd. Those Brooklyn Assassins Guild bastards aren't gettin' away with this." Harley growled, obviously wanting to make those assassins pay for coming after her, despite "convincing" them not to come after her anymore for that bounty on her head.

"I know, Harl... Which is why I'm going over to their hideout and give them a few reasons not to take up that bounty on your head." You said, where you walked over toward the Pilot outfit from Titanfall, which was propped up by a mannequin, just as Ivy curiously queried, "...And just how do you plan on doing that, (Name)?"

From there, you carefully pulled the jumpsuit, jetpack, helmet, and other essentials of the outfit off of the mannequin, slowly putting on the outfit in the process. First the gray jumpsuit, then the armored greaves, then the gauntlets, and the titanium tri-weave vest, which had Harley Quinn's trademark four red diamonds displayed front and center. However, it was also where the body armor was the strongest and the most reinforced, allowing you to shrug off small caliber bullets and even shotgun rounds with relative ease. Finally, there was the helmet. The helmet was made from titanium, with the visor made from plexiglass, laced with the most advanced communication and surveillance technology, complete with infrared, night-vision, and blacklight visions respectively.

"I'm not going to them as (Name), Ivy..." You quipped, as you then firmly placed the helmet upon your head, then turned on the voice modifier within your helmet, causing your voice to sound deeper and gravelly, as you then spoke back and continued, "...I am going after the Brooklyn Assassins Guild as the vigilante Crosshairs."

"Hmm... Looks good on you, puddin'." Harley retorted, complimenting you in your new ensemble, just as you strapped on the handgun holsters to your thighs, then holstered an M92F handgun in each holster, then holstered a semi-automatic SCAR-H assault rifle along the left side of your back, adjacent to the compact yet highly versatile jetpack.

The SCAR-H assault rifle was highly customized with an ACOG scope, tri-laser sight, hair trigger, and vertical foregrip. Overall, it was your preferred weapon of choice back when you were in the Navy SEALs.

From there, just as you were about to leave toward the apartment building rooftop, Harley picked up her cell phone, dialing in a certain phone number as she spoke to you and said, "I might be apartment-bound, puddin', but I'm not lettin' ya go there alone."

"Coach? Yeah, it's me. Listen, we've got problems. Turns out dat hit on me is still in effect. Apparently, those Brooklyn Assassin whackjobs still want my head on a silva platta fer hella lotta cash. Fortunately fer us, that vigilante Crosshairs wants ta help get rid a' these meatheads fer us. Any a' da Harleys available?"

A few seconds later, Harley heard what Coach had said over the phone, where she then said, "...Mm-Hmm. Alright... Okay. Yeah, that'll do nicely, Coach. Make sure Bolly Quinn and Harvey Quinn're lock'd an' load'd when he gets there. Me? I'm still sore from fightin' at Skate Club t'night. Give the others my regards."

From there, Harley ended the call between her and Coach, who oversees the tenant building where the Gang of Harleys currently live in. Then, you heard Harley speak toward you and answered, "Coach managed ta get some of da Harleys ta help ya out. You'll be workin' with Bolly Quinn an' Harvey Quinn this time."

"Thanks, Harley." You replied, with the voice modifier distorting your real voice some. From there, you exited the apartment condo that you and Harley live in, rushing up the stairs and onto the roof with ease. From there, upon reaching the rooftop of the apartment building, you sprinted toward the edge of the building, then leaped off the edge, getting as much momentum as you possibly could.

Now normally, this would be a definitive way to get someone injured or killed. However, you were given a compact but powerful state of the art jetpack, which gave you increased momentum to reach the next building from across the street with relative ease, where you then diverolled onto the other rooftop to lessen the impact of the landing. Seconds later, you continued sprinting across the rooftops, using a mixture of parkour free-running and the jetpack for easier traversal.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: This Is Gonna Hurt, And Not In A Fun Way

choices: Coach, the female paraplegic overseer of the Gang of Harleys.
Bolly Quinn and Harvey Quinn.
Actually, you were greeted by someone else instead...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
But whilst you swiftly traversed from rooftop to rooftop towards the apartment building where the Gang of Harleys reside, you subconsciously began to reminisce about how you first became the vigilante known as Crosshairs. And it all started with a certain Dark Knight...

-- Gotham General Hospital, Gotham City --
-- Six Months Ago --

Shortly after Commissioner Gordon had calmly left the hospital room you were currently residing in, you slowly began to gently stroke the sleeping Harley Quinn's red and black hair, obviously out of comfort toward the clown girl. However, moments later, you suddenly heard your smartphone ringing, which stirred you from your current activity.

From there, in an attempt to silence the smartphone to allow Harley to get some rest, you slowly grabbed the smartphone, where you looked at the Caller ID to see who was calling you, only for it to come up as "Caller ID: Unknown", which made you even more suspicious over who was calling you at this time of night.

Left with little to no alternative, you pressed the "Accept Call" button, then placed the smartphone against your right ear, spoke into it and cautiously said, "...Hello? Who is this?"

"...Who do think it is, Lieutenant Commander (First Name and Last Name)?" A voice rang out on the phone. Judging from the voice's sound and tone, it was undeniably deep and masculine in texture, obviously to disguise the real identity of the person you were speaking to.

Out of suspicion, you made an estimated guess as to who it could be, as you calmly retorted, "...Judging from your voice, I'm guessing that I am talking to the one and only Batman."

A brief moment or two of silence passed by, where you then spoke toward him on your smartphone and asked, "So... Why are you talking to me, Dark Knight? Are you here for me, or for Harley?"

"Both. I've already been informed of your relationship with Dr. Quinzel over the past 2 months, ever since she left Gotham to live in Brooklyn." He bluntly answered, being rather straightforward with you on such information, confirming that he has secretly been keeping tabs on Harley ever since she left Gotham City, especially since Harley was a known accomplice of the Joker.

Of course, this undoubtedly made you suspicious of who you were speaking to, your brow furrowed in a cautious manner, as you then carefully spoke toward Batman and queried, "So where are you now?"

"...It doesn't matter. What's important now is the status quo regarding Dr. Quinzel, Lieutenant Commander." Batman flatly answered, his semi-gravelly voice not changing a single octave in tone.

Of course, you obviously knew what he meant regarding what to do with Harley, as you then spoke toward him and retorted, "So, what? You plan to lock up Harley in Arkham Asylum or Blackgate? Even after she went through all that trouble just to rescue me from her psychotic ex-boyfriend?"

"...Normally, yes, considering her affiliation with the Joker and her past crimes as Harley Quinn. However, against my better judgement... I am considering letting her walk. For now." He bluntly explained, which easily surprised you, consider from the stuff you've heard about Batman being a stern but stubborn individual when it came to delivering justice upon the criminals of Gotham.

"I'm guessing there's a catch, isn't there?" You queried, figuring that Batman wasn't going to let Harley walk free without a price, where he then promptly answered, "...In a manner of speaking."

"*sigh* Alright, so what can I do for you?" You queried, wondering what exactly did Batman had in mind. However, you soon found out what he had in mind, as he then bluntly explained, "...I plan on creating a network of vigilantes that can operate outside of Gotham, and I want you to become one of this network's first wave of vigilantes."

"Wait, you want me to work for you?! I thought you had those other crime-fighters in your supposed "Bat Family", like Robin and that Nightwing guy in Blüdhaven, or even Batwoman and Batgirl. Why me?" You asked, obviously taken aback some by such a bold proposal coming from the World's Greatest Detective.

However, despite your surprised tone, the Batman wasn't so easily wavered by such doubts, as he then spoke toward you and flatly explained, "...You were awarded a Purple Heart for your services in Iraq and Afghanistan, as well as a Silver Star in Operation: Neptune Spear during your time with Navy SEALs Team Six. That, and you managed to keep Quinn in line."

Upon hearing such reasons from the Caped Crusader, you began to contemplate on your decision. At first, you wanted to decline Batman's offer. However, every now and then, you'd often miss the adrenaline-induced excitement that came from fighting against multiple enemies. Eventually, you inevitably came to a final decision as you then answered, "...Fine. I accept your offer, Dark Knight."

-- Brooklyn District --
-- New York, New York --
-- Present Day --

Eventually, after reminiscing about you ended up becoming a part of Batman's network of vigilantes, you inevitably made it to the Gand of Harleys apartment building, using the compact yet highly versatile jetpack to catapult up the side of the building until you landed on the rooftop with relative ease. From there, you were greeted by...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Recruited By A Dark Knight

choices: A rundown bar in Hell's Kitchen called "The Knife's Twist".
An old supply warehouse near the Brooklyn Bridge.
Actually, it was at an entirely different location...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
Once you firmly landed upon the rooftop of the apartment building, you were soon greeted by a familiar individual, where she spoke toward you and remarked, "For a guy who's new here, you certainly know how to make an entrance."

From there, in response to the voice you've just heard, you calmly stood upright from your dramatic superhero landing pose, where you soon gazed upon who spoke to you.

In appearance, she was a young red-haired woman in her mid 20s, complete with a petite body type. She wore a yellow T-shirt, olive drab green shorts, and a pair of gray tennis shoes, along with a pair of black sunglasses adorned upon her face. However, unlike you and Harley, the woman was undoubtedly paraplegic, as she calmly approached you in her wheelchair. Overall, this was none other than Holly Hamden, better known as "Coach", Harley Quinn's personally appointed overseer of the Gang of Harleys.

In response, you calmly approached the paraplegic Coach, speaking toward her with a somewhat distorted voice due to the helmet's voice modifier as you queried, "Are Bolly Quinn and Harvey Quinn ready?"

"...Pretty much. They're itchin' for a fight, that's for damn sure." Coach answered, as you calmly followed her inside the apartment building, passing by some of the other Gang of Harleys members, just as Coach then asked, "How's the boss doin'?"

"...She's holding up, considering that she just killed her would-be assassins." You explained, just as both you and Coach had inevitably arrived at the Locker Room, where you saw both Bolly Quinn and Harvey Quinn gearing up with a few firearms and some melee weapons, such as a bloodied baseball bat for Bolly Quinn, and a pair of spiky brass knuckles for Harvey Quinn.

In appearance, Bolly Quinn was a woman of Asian Indian descent, while Harvey Quinn was a Caucasian man. Both individuals wore mostly similar attire to your beloved Harley Quinn, only instead of their outfit colors being the same as their boss, Bolly Quinn's outfit was colored orange and black, while Harvey Quinn's outfit was green and black.

Of course, both Bolly and Harvey soon took notice of you, as Bolly Quinn looked at you, propping her bloodied baseball bat against her right shoulder, where she approached both you and Coach as she quipped, "Yo, Coach! Who's the tin man in the military getup?"

"This "Tin Man" just so happened to be sent here by your boss." You retorted, getting right in Bolly's face in a passive-aggressive manner, obviously not amused by Bolly Quinn's questionable remark. However, just as the tension was about to boil over, Harvey Quinn soon stepped in and quickly retorted, "Easy, Bolly Quinn! That's that vigilante dude, Crosshairs. Y'know, the guy who took out Blockbuster's gun smugglin' operation here in Brooklyn?"

From there, Bolly Quinn's eyes sifted up and down to get a better look at you, where she then spoke toward you and sarcastically retorted, "Hmph. And here I thought you'd look...scarier. For a badass."

"I get that a lot. So, Coach tell you what we're gonna be doing tonight?" You said, where Harvey Quinn then quickly replied, "Yeah. The boss has some problems with these Brooklyn Assassins Guild mooks, and we're supposed to take 'em out fer good."

"...Exactly. C'mon, we've got work to do." You retorted, where you then headed back up toward the apartment building rooftop, where you then dove off the rooftop, using the compact jetpack to slow down your descent and glide toward one of the nearby rooftops with ease. Of course, both Bolly Quinn and Harvey Quinn had to go the opposite route, using the newly acquired Harley Van to traverse the urban streets of Brooklyn, despite easily violating the city speed limits.

Fortunately, you managed to keep up with the Harley Van, where you subconsciously thought to yourself as you thought, "Okay... Note to self: Need to get myself my own set of wheels." Eventually, after traversing across twenty blocks of rooftops, you, Bolly, and Harvey managed to rendezvous at the new hideout for the Brooklyn Assassins Guild, which happened to be...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Meeting Up With Coach

choices: Eavesdrop on their conversation. You might learn something important.

1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
The Knife's Twist.

For the public, it was merely a rundown bar in the middle of Hell's Kitchen.

But to those who make a career out of putting people six feet under by putting a cap in their skulls, it was one of New York's more prominent places of business and luxury for hired guns and professional hitmen, especially if you happen to be a member of the Brooklyn Assassins Guild.

Currently, as the vigilante Crosshairs, you stood there perched high up upon a nearby rooftop overlooking the front entrance to the Knife's Twist, keenly watching who entered and exited the place. Meanwhile, on the streets below, Bolly Quinn and Harvey Quinn were currently inside the Harley Van, waiting for the right time to storm inside the building, hoping to avenge the rotund Harley Quinn for the failed assassination attempt on her life.

A few moments later, after seeing two biker thugs enter inside the Knife's Twist, you placed your left index and middle finger against the Comms button on your helmet, which was wirelessly connected to the two-way radio inside the Harley Van, where you then spoke toward both Bolly Quinn and Harvey Quinn and said, "It looks like the Knife's Twist got itself a full house tonight. I'll go in from the back. Bolly, Harvey, you two take the front door."

"Got it. We'll wait fer yer signal." Harvey retorted, where you then used your compact jetpack to swiftly traverse onto the rooftop of the Knife's Twist bar, where you landed as silently as possible to avert arousing suspicion. Of course, the rooftop was guarded by a sniper, so you cautiously snuck up behind the sniper, where you swiftly pulled him back and quickly snapped his neck like a twig, killing him instantly.

From there, you stealthily entered the building via doorway on the roof, where you slowly made your way down the stairs, easily sticking to the shadows to avoid detection. Eventually, you made your way near a balcony overlooking the main lobby of the Knife's Twist, staying behind an alcove due to noticing how many Brooklyn Assassins Guild members that were currently present in the bar.

If you had to make an estimated guess, there would have to be at least 60 individuals before you. Of course, you had a few options to deal with these mooks. First, you could stay hidden and eavesdrop on their conversation, since this looks like they're here for some sort of meeting. On the other hand, you could just launch a preemptive strike against the Brooklyn Assassins Guild, getting the jump on them. Inevitably, you had to make a decision...and soon.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: The Knife's Twist

choices: Penguin plans on expanding his business to here in New York City.
Penguin still holds a grudge on Harley for what happened at the Iceberg Lounge.
Actually, it was a bit of both aforementioned answers...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
Weighing your options, you inevitably decided to eavesdrop on the meeting. After all, it might potentially lead you to whoever took up that bounty on Harley's head.

From there, you tapped the Comms button on your helmet, contacting Harley as you said, "Crosshairs to Harley. Do you copy?"

--- Harley Quinn's Apartment ---
-- Coney Island, New York City --
-- 10 Seconds Earlier --

Meanwhile, back at the apartment, Harley and Ivy were currently painting each other's fingernails, with Ivy having her nails painted a rich shade of green, while Harley's nails were painted a combination of red and black. Of course, since you were out going after whoever placed that hit on her, Harley might as well have some downtime with her favorite gal-pal, Pamela Isley.

"...Crosshairs to Harley. Do you copy?" A voice rang up on her tablet, as she instantly recognized that it was you. From there, Ivy promptly picked up the tablet due to the fingernail polish on Harley's nails were still drying, placing it in front of the substantially larger clown girl, where Harley then spoke into the tablet and replied, "Yeah, I can 'ear ya, (Name). Did ya find those bastards?"

"I'm currently inside that rundown bar, The Knife's Twist. It looks like a bunch of these Brooklyn Assassins Guild punks are waiting for someone important." You calmly whispered, attempting to stay inconspicuous and incognito from a little over two dozen professional killers.

However, just as Harley was about to answer back, you soon witnessed someone distinct approach the rundown patched up stage. You quickly switched the Comms function in your helmet from auditory to visual, as you carefully poked your head out from behind cover, all focused upon the distinguished individual.

In appearance, the individual was undoubtedly male, who wore a black ski mask to cover up his identity. He wore a white sweatshirt hoodie underneath a puffy blue vest. Also, he wore military boots and grey cargo pants. Suffice to say, the man certainly had acquired tastes when it came to fashion.

Meanwhile, Harley and Ivy saw this new individual upon the tablet screen, both becoming surprised, instantly recognizing who this guy was with, as you heard Ivy then said, "Say, that man looks like he's a member of -" "Blubberpot's crew? *hmph* I figur'd as much, Red." Harley huffed, obviously sounding rather pissed off from such an unwanted revelation.

Of course, you soon realize who the rotund Harley Quinn was referring to: Oswald Chesterfield Cobblepot, better known throughout the rest of the Gotham City underworld...as "The Penguin". The reason why he was called by such a name was due to the man's short stature and bulbous physique, along with a prominent hooked nose, which merely imitated the look of a Penguin's beak. However, from what Harley had previously told you about him during some of those long dating sessions with her, Cobblepot was much more threatening than his nickname would have you and many others would believe.

Aside from his eccentric love for birds and umbrellas, the Penguin was anything but a joke. Cobblepot was an eccentric criminal mastermind, using his popular Iceberg Lounge nightclub as a front for numerous illegal activities, such as supplying Gotham's criminals with illegal firearms, as well as gathering information in the criminal underworld. A real bonafide "Gentleman of Crime".

Of course, from what Harley had told you on several occasions when she mentioned the Penguin, Cobblepot wasn't exactly on good terms with both her and her now ex-boyfriend, The Joker. In fact, Penguin had a deep hatred toward both of them.

Why?

From what your memories of you and Harley had shown (Back when Harley was halfway to weighing 500 pounds), this whole hatred thing began on the opening night for the Iceberg Lounge. Oswald felt proud to have finally gained respect, so he invited the Joker and Harley Quinn and offered them a free drink. However, when a waitress arrived, she tripped and accidentally spilled the drink on the Joker. In response, this led to Joker spraying acid on the woman's face with his flower, which then led to Joker and Harley trashing the club and fleeing into the night. Enraged at Joker for ruining his party, killing his waitress, and tarnishing his reputation, Penguin developed a deep hatred of both Joker and Harley Quinn, and the rest was history.

Of course, Harley called Penguin "Blubberpot" just to insult him, even though she's now sporting some blubber of her own.

"But still... Why would Penguin send one of his men all the way out to New York?" You queried, where Harley soon quipped, "I...don't know, sweetie. But I got a feelin' dat he ain't 'ere fer the scenery."

Of course, you continued eavesdropping on the meeting, only to soon find out that...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: A Thickening Plot

1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
Of course, you continued eavesdropping on the meeting, only to soon find out that Penguin's plans were two-fold, as the Penguin thug then began to speak toward the three dozen Brooklyn Assassins Guild members and said, "Thank you all for coming. You are gathered here today because my boss, Mr. Cobblepot, is generous enough to allow you to retain control of your businesses, and he wants to extend you an offer."

"Heh. What kind of offer?" One of the Brooklyn Assassins queried, his appearance akin to that of a stereotypical biker gang member. Obviously, you could see that there were some who seem skeptical of the Penguin's intentions. However, the Penguin thug soon retorted, "...The kind of offer you simply can't refuse. Any more stupid questions?"

The room went silent for a brief moment, with the Penguin thug then began to speak as he explained, "Now then, Mr. Cobblepot's plans for this city are two-fold. First, we will be expanding his operations from Gotham to New York City. And second..."

"There is the bounty on Harley Quinn. And the reward, whether she's brought in dead or alive, will be approximately 5 million dollars. However, there's a bonus of nine hundred thousand dollars if she's brought to Mr. Cobblepot alive, as well as a discount on any weapons bought within 2 years." The Penguin thug elaborated, which seemed to sit very nicely with the various Brooklyn Assassins Guild members, each of them nodding to each other in agreement.

From the sounds of things, this was not good at all whatsoever for you and the substantially larger Harley Quinn, as it sounded like the Penguin was keen on expanding his operations, as well as getting revenge on Harley for what she and the Joker had done many moons ago.

In your mind, you knew you had to do something quick, right here, right now. Inevitably...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Of Enterprising Expansion & Personal Grudges

choices: Eventually, you returned to the apartment building unhindered.
Soon, you returned to the apartment building, where Harley was waiting for you.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
From the sounds of things, this was not good at all whatsoever for you and the substantially larger Harley Quinn, as it sounded like the Penguin was keen on expanding his operations, as well as getting revenge on Harley for what she and the Joker had done many moons ago.

In your mind, you knew you had to do something quick, right here, right now. Inevitably, after a brief contemplation, you decided to go with the loud approach, as you then radioed in to Harvey and Bolly Quinn and said, "...You get all that?"

"Yeah. Sounds like the boss is in deep shit if we don't do something fast." Bolly Quinn replied, as Harvey Quinn then butted in and retorted, "So... Got any ideas?"

Of course, you soon said, "...Ram the van through the front door. We're going in loud."

"With pleasure." Bolly Quinn answered, as you then heard the muffled sounds of the Gang of Harleys van blitzing into the front of the building, causing brick and mortar to blast apart in an explosive manner as the van plowed it's way through the front door.

Of course, this soon got the attention of both the Penguin thug and the several dozen Brooklyn Assassins Guild members, who were caught by surprise, with several of them exclaiming, "WHAT THE HELL!?"

"Sorry to interrupt your party, boys! But our boss sends her regards." Bolly Quinn quipped, where she laid in on the nearest assassin with a spiked baseball bat, with Harvey Quinn following in suit, armed with a SPAS-12 shotgun. In turn, the Penguin thug then shouted, "Don't just stand there! Kill them!"

Of course, as the Brooklyn Assassins Guild members began to open fire upon the two Gang of Harleys members, you unholstered your dual handguns and remarked, "Time I got myself involved." From there, you corkscrew flipped from your hiding spot, firing some well-placed shots upon several assassins before landing to continuing the fight.

"Oh shit!! It's Crosshairs!! SHOOT HIM!!!" A Brooklyn Assassins Guild member shouted, where you then quickly stood up, pointing your pistols at two Assassins Guild members, speaking to the through your augmented voice and remarked, "Sorry, boys. Party's over! Put down the guns, or things will get ugly."

"Screw this asshole! Get him!!" Another Brooklyn Assassins Guild member exclaimed, rallying his comrades to attack you. But of course, you instinctively bobbed and weaved through their attacks with several flips and spins, much to your subconscious's surprise, firing off several vital shots at some of the assailants, with Bolly and Harvey Quinn joining you in the assault.

Suffice to say, this was gonna be a long fight...

-- 8 Minutes Later... --

Some time later, you, Bolly, and Harvey Quinn managed to incapacitate and restrain most of the Brooklyn Assassins Guild members, except for those who were dealt with fatal injuries. Of course, you were in the middle of interrogating the Penguin thug, where you then said, "...Then give the Penguin a message for me: Tell him if he attempts to take the lives of Harley Quinn and any of the denizens of Coney Island, losing some business partners will be the least of his worries."

And with that, you violently knocked the Penguin thug unconscious with a nasty pistol whip to the right temple. "*sigh* ...Well, that could've gotten worse." You said, holstering your handguns in the side holsters, as Bolly Quinn wiped the sweat from her brow and retorted, "I'll say. Who were they even talking about, anyway?"

"Sounds to me like the Brooklyn Assassins Guild was in a partnership with none other than Oswald Cobblepot." You answered, which seemed to confuse the two members of the Gang of Harleys, as Harvey Quinn cocked an eyebrow and asked, "...Who the hell is Oswald Cobblepot?"

"Oswald Cobblepot is one of Gotham City's most prolific crime lords. Though, he is commonly referred to as "The Penguin", due to his physical appearance. Judging from the bounty he has on your boss's head, it sounds like he and Harley Quinn have some bad blood between each other." You explained, which made Bolly and Harvey Quinn realize that Penguin might be making a move against their rotund boss.

But of course, before you could divulge any further, the three of you soon heard the distant sounds of police sirens, which seemed to be approaching the Knife's Twist. With little to no choice, the three of you escaped the area, with Bolly and Harvey Quinn escaping in the van, whilst you quickly jettisoned onto the nearby rooftops.

From there, after getting some distance from the Knife's Twist bar, you decided to call Harley, just to see if she was alright while you were away, as you tapped the Comm button on the side of your helmet and said, "...Everything alright on your end, Harley?"

"*relieved sigh* It's 'bout time! Ya had me worried, puddin'." Harley quipped, her voice having a subtle concerned tone, in which you replied, "I know. But still, at least we now know who is taking up that bounty on your life."

"Well, get yer sexy ass back over 'ere, puddin. I think ye deserve a break." Harley retorted, which you mildly chuckled in response and replied, "On my way, honey." And with that, you resumed your way across the rooftops towards the apartment complex on Coney Island, back to Harley.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: Ramming Through The Front Door

choices: Before you can finish, Harley knocks you onto the bed.
Only partway through, the two of you do get interrupted.
In the morning, you and Harley discuss what comes next.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.content:
A thin sheet of rain started to fall as you continued your rooftop run, making your footing a bit more treacherous. The sound of sirens was soon lost behind you in the cacophony of the still bustling city streets. Before long, your destination was in sight, the bright lights of the rides and attractions acting like a beacon in the night. That – as well as the thought of Harley’s smiling cherubic face – spurred you on and you made the last series of jumps to land on the apartment building’s roof.

Some commotion from down below made you pause and look back over the edge. You could hear loud voices coming from down below, but couldn’t make out the words. You were starting to get a bit concerned, but then a woman came dashing out into the rain. Even from your vantage point, you could tell that her jaw was set and her fists were balled. Following in her wake, you saw Mason run after her. The woman wasn’t willing to listen to him though, and shoved him back and yelled for him to leave her alone. She took off and soon vanished around a corner, leaving Mason standing in the rain. You felt for the ex-con, but you had another matter to deal with, namely a girlfriend that tended to have a short temper and even short patience. A short jaunt down the elevator and you stepped back into your apartment, water dripping from your armor as you slid the helmet off.

“Harley, I’m back,” you called, looking around the room.

There was no sign of your girthy girlfriend though. As quietly as you could, you sat your helmet down and slid one of the pistols free. There was no further sign of combat; in fact some of what had happened before had been cleaned up while you were gone. You weren’t taking a chance though.

Making your way through the room, you tried to keep your head on a swivel. The muted creak of a floorboard was all you heard. Before you could react, a weight slammed into your back almost knocking you to the floor. You tried to bring your pistol to bear but a familiar laugh made you stop. Twisting around in her grasp, you came face to face with Harley. She had a wide grin on her face even as she looked down at the handgun in your grip.

“I didn’t scare ya too much, did I, puddin’?” she asked as she nuzzled your nose.

With a sigh, you admitted that with the goons you had fought off here and then taking the fight to them, you were just being cautious when you didn’t see her right away. This brought a more satisfied smile to her rounded face and she gave you a quick peck before stepping back. Now with a bit of space, you saw that she had changed into a silky sheer babydoll that would have been a small tent for almost anyone else. On her fleshy form though, it could barely wrap around her and exposed a large crescent of her gut below the hem.

You couldn’t tear your eyes off of her, but a thought still wormed into your head, “Where’s Ivy?”

“Aw, ain’t I ‘nuff for ya, baby?” she asked putting on puppy dog eyes and a pout.

You felt a grimace cross your face for a moment till you saw the twinkle in Harley’s eyes as well. Rather than say anything in response though, you instead stepped closer to her and pulled her into a lip crushing kiss. You could feel her heartbeat pounding against you even through your armor, as well as the heat washing off of her body.

When you finally stepped back, panting for breath, you said huskily, “I just didn’t want to get interrupted.”

“Ooh, so that’s your game?” Harley asked, batting her eyelashes. “Well, ya don’t have worry ta about that, Red said somethin’ about needing ta make a quick trip ta the park uptown. She said she’d give a call before dropping in again.”

In response, you dropped your weapons to the ground and started to tear sections of the armor off, while Harley looked on with her smile back in place.
1553322223322223232223222222133121112111.title: A reward for a job well done

choices: But when you went into the Kitchen, Ivy had already returned.
But when you went into the Kitchen, you heard your cell phone ringing.
