1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
“Jesus…” you heard Barbara mutter over the line. You could hear the shock and awe in her voice.

After several moments passed and no explanation came, Frankie asked, “What is it, did you find something?” with an obvious impatient tone.

“Well…you could say that,” she responded a bit hesitantly. “It’s probably best if you just see it yourself though.”

Both you and Frankie looked at each other with a quizzical slant to your eyebrows. Then you turned your attentions back to the screens as an image came through. It took several seconds for you to make sense of what you were seeing, but once you did, your jaw dropped to your chin. You thought Denise had been big before, but the image showed that she was even more immense.

You thought you could make out the couch she seemed to be resting on, but her hips flowed so far in either direction, it was hard to be sure. Her stomach drooped down in several massive rolls to brush the floor in front of her despite oozing out and over her legs. Her breasts had flattened under their own weight and oozed so far down the uppermost curve of her stomach that the nipples were almost certain to be beyond her reach. Speaking of, her nipples – as well what seemed like acres of flesh – were on full display. You managed to make out the tattered remains of the outfit from earlier on the ground around her and tucked into some of her numerous folds and rolls. It looked like she had exploded out of it as she inexplicably grew even fatter within the span of a matter of hours. Signs of what had apparently caused her stupendous growth lay all around her: piles upon piles of candy wrappers.

“I think…the two of you…may have left out…some things,” Frankie mumbled, giving you a fright. You had almost forgotten she was there beside you, so stunned at seeing what had happened to Denise.

You started to sputter a response but Barbara cut you off by snapping, “Save it! I just saw something outside the window; it was clinging to the wall. It jumped off and took off heading north once it saw me looking at it. Try to get eyes on it.”

“Yeah, yeah, I can do that. We’re going to circle back to Denise after this though,” turning an accusatory glance at you. Frankie then pulled out a keyboard and went to work, her fingers flying across the keys.

You watched in awe as lines of code went flying past on the screen. In a flash, several of the monitors swapped their normal feeds to show grainy and dark videos.

You started to open your mouth but Frankie answered you unspoken question, “Managed to use a backdoor we left in the traffic camera system. If whoever or whatever kept heading the same way, we should…”

“There!” you said, jabbing your finger at one of the images. It was brief, but you saw something jumping across the street at the top of the camera’s view.

“I see it, I see it,” Frankie responded, batting your hand out of the way. You swore you could hear her muttering about a fingerprint on the screen.

With the location a bit more pinned down, she started shifting the views to try and get ahead of it. Now and again, the two of you could see something moving very fast and jumping incredible distances to clear whole streets in a single bound.

“Come on, come on, where are you going?” Frankie said to herself, chewing on her lip as her fingers continued to fire off at breakneck pace.

You couldn’t tear your eyes away from the screens, searching for any sign of this mystery thing tearing across the city. Suddenly, there was no more sign of it.

“Where did it go? Did you lose it?” you asked, your eyes darting across the videos.

“It was right here,” Frankie responded, motioning towards one of them. “I don’t…wait, there it is.”

She brought one of the videos of the fore, showing a leg creeping up over the top of a wall. The other cameras in the area showed no further sign of the fleeing target, hinting that it had gone to ground in that building.

“Shit, do you know where it hid at?” You couldn’t make heads or tails of the metadata that was tied to that specific camera, and there wasn’t anything distinctive about the wall it had climbed up, so you shook your head. “That is the rear wall of Ms. Rosenthal's Whacky Candy Boutique. Whoever or whatever that thing is,” pointing at a frozen image showing the thing mid jump, “It just went right to that freaky candy shop.”

You stared at the image. It was horrible quality, dark and very pixilated. Something about it looked oddly familiar and chilling at the same time though.

“Did I hear that right?” Barbara said, reminding the two of you that she was still at Denise’s. You gave confirmation and Frankie backed you up.“Damn it…All right, that thing seemed to be keeping an eye on Denise, and now it knows that Batgirl is involved in some way. We’re going to have to act fast.

"Gotta admit; This place is even giving me the creeps." She thought to herself, whilst she searched through several different areas of the shop. But then, as if the plot had thickened, Batgirl soon inevitably noticed that...

1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
She was coming round one of the displays when she saw the candy elf statue in the middle of the store. Barbara frowned as her eyes fell on it. She understood how her girlfriend was creeped out by the freaky thing. She started to move past the statue, but froze and looked back up at it. A frown crossed her face as she realized it had somehow changed during the time that she was in the store. Before it’s face had been twisted in a disturbing smile. Now though, it was more of a toothy snarl frozen in place.

A chittering noise behind her made her whip around, casting the light about to try to find the source. Nothing was in sight though, so she turned back to resume her search. Her heart leapt in her throat as she saw that the statue had moved again. Rather than a new expression though, the statue itself had taken off, leaving no sign behind except the empty stand. Barbara turned her flashlight to and fro, half hoping that the statue had just fallen over, even though she knew that wasn’t possible.

Her eyes caught as a shadow moved between two of the stands. Darting over as quick as her blubber allowed, she still wasn’t able to catch any sign of what she saw moving.

A sinister sounding hissing laugh came from right behind her. She was starting to turn when something went leaping past her, knocking into the side of her head and almost knocking her to the floor. She was almost able to make it back to her feet when something slammed into her front, bouncing off of her stomach and vanishing back into the shadows. As she fumbled and tried to keep her footing, Barbara was puzzled by how much the thing that attacked her looked like the candy elf statue.

That same odd laughter came from behind her, but she didn’t have time to turn. Something pounced on her back, upsetting her already unsteady balance. The costumed redhead slammed belly first into a candy display, sending a wave of jawbreakers to bounce and roll across the floor.

As she braced herself against the broken plastic, listening to the cacophony of dozens of jawbreakers moving across the floor, she forced her eyes closed. Breathing deep and letting it out helped focus her mind. Whatever was attacking her was probably used to using fear to assist them. Barbara had trained with a real master of fear though, and had fought a lot worse than them though. She had just gotten a little rusty at it though.

With her mind focused, she opened her senses to take in the environment around her. Beneath the sound of the jawbreakers and broken plastic, she could hear a collection of steady and rhythmic footstep sounds. Wait…one had sped up, and…There it was, the rustle of fabric…She would still need to be precise in her timing to do…THIS.

Barbara spun as fast as she could, lifting one meaty leg and sweeping it across her loop. She caught the freaky thing right in the face, sending it flying across the room to smash into a display stand. Boxes went flying and tumbled to the floor as the candy elf collapsed to the ground.

That same laugh came from behind her yet again. This time, she ducked and lunged to the side so that the elf that would have hit her from behind against instead went flying past her without a hit. In a flash, she pulled out her grapple gun and fired. The cable entwined the elf’s leg and she pulled, snapping the line taut. She next turned the trapped elf’s momentum against itself, swinging it around her head. Hitting the release at just the right time, she created a midair collision with a third.

A fourth elf came scuttling across the ceiling, leaping and twisting in midair. It’s teeth were bared and Barbara had little doubt that the creature intended to put them to good use. It never got the chance though and instead took a pair of swift punches that put it flat out on the ground like the others.

The rotund redhead gave a slight chuckle. She was panting from the exertion, and she could feel a bit of pain in her knees, but she wouldn’t have traded it for the world. She missed having a good fight like that, not just chasing down a purse snatcher or whatever.

Crouching down, she furrowed her brow under her mask, trying to figure out what in the world were these candy elf things. They were even creepier when they were moving around than they were posing as a statue.

Too lost in her examination, she missed the rustle of fabric till it was too late. A fifth elf leapt past her. A lance of pain erupted from her arm. She managed to lash out on instinct, her fist connecting with the elf’s midsection and sending it flying. It smashed into one of the candy displays along the wall, bringing boxes of sweets down atop it.

Hissing, Barbara took a look at her arm. Her costume was split open, and there was a red line in her skin beneath. A bead of blood was already starting to well up. Looking up, she made sure that her last attacker was staying down. She paused when she saw that the force of the impact had moved the case away from the wall. A sliver of even deeper darkness peaked from beyond. It looked like a hidden opening to an eye experienced in such things.

I mean, we live in a city where there's a giant crocodile man, a creature made of clay who can shapeshift into anyone, and a man-sized bat monster flying about at night. So yeah, not much surprises here, Red." Frankie retorted, making not-so-subtle references to Killer Croc, Clayface, and Man-Bat.

But whilst you were going over Barbara's diagnostics to make sure she has a clean bill of health after taking that nasty scratch earlier, Frankie was meticulously sifting through all that data Batgirl had acquired. And boy, there was a lot to decrypt and analyze.

Out of a puzzling and mildly impatient demeanor, you placed your olive-skinned hands upon your chubby self, with your right hand pressed upon your rounder hips, whilst your left hand traced itself along the outermost curve of your chubby belly. Sure Barbara was substantially fatter than you, but you were definitely in the range between "Chubby" and "BBW" proportions, due to your addictive sweet tooth as a child and teenager.

But then, your white laptop beeped twice to confirm the completion of it's diagnosis, which showed the usual medical and physiological statistics but with a few minor notices, as it read:

======
-- Diagnosis: Complete
-- Status: 56% Body Fat, 44% Muscle
-- Neural Chip Status: Intact
-- Neural Chip Connection: Strong
-- WARNING: Minor wound on right bicep. Recommend Minor Medical Treatment Immediately.
======

"There we go. Clean bill of health. Aside from that scratch you received, I don't see any signs of toxins in your systems." You quipped, exhaling a sigh of relief that Barbara's wound wasn't as worse as you thought it would be.

"See? What did I tell you, sweetie?" Barbara chuckled, reassuring you with a quick but tender peck on the cheek, which made you blush a bashful crimson hue in response to such an affectionate gesture from the obese redhead.

Even though you had just woken up in this new reality, you were already seeing the benefits of being the girlfriend to a rotund Batgirl. After all, even though you were bisexual, you were strangely somewhat more into larger women than guys.

However, just as you were about to makeout with Barbara right here, Frankie soon interrupted the two of you as she explained, "Hate to interrupt your little love session, ladies, but it looks like I found something you need to see."

"Well, what is it Frankie?" Barbara asked, as she pulled off the Electrodes on her stomach, then casually dismounted from the gurney and leisurely yet mildly waddled over towards where Frankie was sitting in the Batgirl Bunker, with you following behind her in tow.

From there, when you and Babs stood beside Frankie overlooking the three lit monitors, the three of you saw that the acquired data showed...
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: A Thickening Mystery

choices: You let her go; she’s a woman on a mission.
You put a stop to that foolishness, she’s running herself ragged.
An alarm starts blaring, there’s a virus in the system.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
The main screen showed what appeared to be from a camera mounted high up inside a greenhouse. It was plain to see the target of the camera was Pamela Isley, otherwise known as the eco-terrorist Poison Ivy. There was one rather glaring difference that set her apart from how you had seen her before though: the green hued woman shown on the screen was much, much fatter than any you had seen before. Really though, in hindsight, you should have been expecting something like this with how everything else had been going.

Pulling your attention back to the screen, you heard Ivy speaking, “Ooh, look at you darlings, you’re all doing so well.” She reached out and ran her hands through the flowering plants before her, their leaves reaching back towards her. Then her voice took on a much darker tone, “Even cooped up like I am.”

You heard Barbara gasp beside you. Glancing over, you saw her biting her thumb. She was intent on the screen and didn’t even seem to notice you looking at her. Frowning, you turned back to the video. You saw that Ivy had moved along further down the row of plants, the camera tracking her progress. Watching her walking along, you were shocked to see her moving. She was so massive you didn’t think she should be able to stand, let alone walk along. She was even bigger than Denise had been before her latest candy binge.

A sudden wave of motion hit Ivy as she jumped after being startled by the sound of a door opening somewhere out of view of the camera. Even with the angle and limited resolution of the camera, you could see how she clenched her jaw and glared at whoever was coming in.

“Good morning, Pamela, I trust you had a restful night,” a feminine voice called. There was something odd about the voice, but you couldn’t quite place it.

Ivy all but snarled back, “You know I did no such thing. You’ve got enough cameras watching me all the time to know that!” She threw her arm in the direction of the camera you were watching a clip from, sending a ripple that passed through her entire body and kept it moving for almost a minute.

If Ivy’s comment had any effect on the other, she didn’t let any of it appear in her voice. “I’m sorry to hear that, but we do have a schedule to keep.”

“And what if I don’t want to keep getting hooked up to your machines?”

“Then we would have to fall back on our previously discussed method to…persuade you.”

There was no hint of malice that you could hear, but it was clear to see that there was something to that implied threat. Ivy’s face paled, an impressive feat considering her standard coloring. “No! No, that won’t be necessary.” She kept her eyes on the floor after that.

“Well go on, get on with it. Like I said, we have a schedule.” At first, you thought the other was talking to Ivy, but Ivy continued to wait nevertheless. After a few moments, a pair of those creepy candy elf things scurried into view. Seeing them in motion made your skin crawl even worse than seeing them pretend to be a statue, Barbara wasn’t lying about that at all.

The elves loped up to Ivy and she turned to waddle off. Then the screen went dark.

“And that’s it. Now correct me if I’m wrong, but wasn’t that the super villain Poison Ivy?”

Barbara seemed quite distracted, still biting her thumb and her gaze locked on the screen despite there only being computer code displayed there now.

Filling the gap while you kept an eye on the rotund redhead, “Sure looked that way to me, but I don’t think she’s ever been that big.”

“True, but with everything else going on in the area recently, it doesn’t seem too surprising.”

You had to admit that Frankie wasn’t wrong there.

“Is there anything about a location for where she’s being kept?” Barbara suddenly blurted out.

“Eh…nothing so far,” Frankie said, her fingers tapping away at the keyboard again, “But there’s more data you pulled off that computer that I haven’t been able to access yet. Why?”

“I have to rescue her,” Barbara blurted out. She then clapped a hand over her mouth.

“Wait, run that by us again: you have to rescue the crazed super villainess that regularly wants to turn people into a bunch of crazy plants or something?” Frankie snapped back.

“She’s…! She’s not like that, not anymore,” Barbara retorted, seeming almost bashful in your opinion.

“And you would know that how?” you asked.

“I…I can’t tell you, not yet. But please believe me, you two, it would be for the best if we rescue her, especially if she is involved in this thing going on with the candy shop like it seems.”

Frankie huffed and spun back to face the computer screen muttering to herself. You were more torn, wanting to believe Barbara but also unsure of why she was being so secretive. Your train of thought was derailed as you realized that Barbara was starting to suit herself back up.

“Wait, where are you going?”

Without even slowing down or looking up at you, she responded, “I’ve got to get back out there. I’ve wasted enough time already.”
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: More layers of secrets

choices: You soon saw Barbara in the kitchen, going to town on a large cocoa sundae.
You heard Barbara on her phone. She's probably talking to her dad.
Actually, you decided to head to bed anyway. It's been an eventful night.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
However, as you saw the rotund redhead re-zip her armored purple purple Batgirl jacket back up, you felt an odd instinctive twinge in the back of your mind, which caused you to quickly put a hand on Barbara's plump left shoulder and unconsciously quipped, "Sorry, Babs. I can't let you go back out there tonight."

Barbara looked at you with a mildly confused yet quizzical expression on her round face, raising a crimson eyebrow in response to your words as she retorted, "...Sweetie, this isn't the time for one of your "You're overworking yourself" lectures. Ivy is in serious trouble!"

"-And I get what you're saying, Babs. But you need to slow down a little and think for a minute. Besides, you're now just experiencing that trademark Tunnel Vision of yours." You replied, moving your hand from Babs' plump shoulder to her chubby left hand, squeezing it a little to reassure her and confirm your decision. After all, despite only being in this world for roughly a full two days, you felt like you already had a deep connection with the corpulent Batgirl, looking at her with a set of reasonable concern in your eyes.

"...Look...Right noiw, I don't care about your reasons for wanting to rescue Poison Ivy, Red, but I am more concerned about you running yourself ragged and overexerting yourself to complete exhaustion. I mean, what if you head out right now and suddenly collapse from exhaustion while fighting a couple of thugs in an alleyway?" You automatically explained, putting your profound concerns on full display, as Frankie turned the chair around to look at both of you and said, "She's got a point there, Babs. Look, we can save Poison Ivy at a later date. But right now, we're more worried about you."

Upon hearing the legitimate concerns from her own support team, Barbara first looked at the computer monitor of the now corpulent Poison Ivy displayed upon the screen, then back toward Frankie, and finally toward you. In response, after hearing you and Frankie's reasonable pleas for her not to overexert herself, Barbara exhaled a deep sigh in mild reluctance and reluctantly said, "*sigh*...Alright, alright. You girls won me over. But what would you have me do until then? Whoever has imprisoned Ivy might be doing something terrible to her or worse."

In response to her question, as you slowly unzipped the purple Batgirl jacket from Barbara's person, then calmly stripping it from her voluminous form, you spoke to her in a reassuring tone and answered, "...Well, as your personal in-house doctor, I'd recommend a temporary recess from your nightly escapades for tonight, and focus on recuperating for the time being. That is, until you fully recover your strength. Don't you agree?"

But as you fully stripped the Batgirl jacket from Barbara's rotund form, which left her upper body in her pink laced bra and yellow cuffed Batgirl gloves, Barbara exhaled another sigh, knowing that you weren't going to be swayed so easily into letting her go back out into Burnside tonight. From there, she then spoke to you and coyly replied, "*sigh*...I suppose you're right, (Name). I really can't say no to you, can I?" She gently pressed a gloved hand against the outermost curve of her belly and continued, "...And I guess a little bit of R&R will do me some good, especially with my current size and all."

Shortly after dismounting herself from the reinforced hospital gurney, Barbara casually uncuffed her yellow Batgirl gloves from her her plump hands and wrists, setting them upon the gurney alongside her smartphone. From there, after she did so, Barbara looked back at the dark-skinned computer wiz and pragmatically asked, "Frankie, do you think you can decrypt the rest of that intel I gathered while I recuperate for the rest of the night?"

In response to such a question, Frankie soon displayed a confident grin toward her chubbier compatriots, nodding in confirmation then replied, "Already on it, Babs! You just focus on getting some rest."

And with that, before you calmly stripped the purple and black Batgirl pants from Babs' person, you lifted up her apron belly a bit to undo her yellow utility belt and leg pouch, carefully discarding them upon the hospital gurney, which now left the rotund Barbara Gordon in nothing but her pink laced bra and equally large pink laced panties. From there, Barbara placed her chubby hands upon her wide burgeoning hips in brief contemplation and huffed, "*exhakke* Well, if I'm going to be having the night off, I might as well get myself a midnight snack before going to bed as a personal reward."

And with that, as she swiftly grabbed her smartphone, Barbara calmly but lightly waddled her way out of the Batgirl Bunker, with her hips and equally fat buttocks lightly sashaying to and fro like waves on a beach shoreline. But as you began to put the Batgirl costume back onto the obese mannequin in the display case, Barbara looked back at you with a coyly flirtatious twinkle in her jade green eyes and quipped, "...Care to join me, sweetie?"

"Oh I will, babe. Just let me finish up with getting your costume back in place first, and then I'll join you." You instinctively retorted, bearing a bashful look on your slightly chubby face, as the olive skin on your cheeks flushed a crimson red in response. Of course, the rotund redhead soon concurred and replied, "Fair enough, I suppose. But in the meantime, I'll see if I can get myself into some PJs. Don't wanna catch a cold on your watch~"

And with that, Barbara took off, almost having a jovial skip in her chubby step, as you soon returned to the task of putting the Batgirl costume back onto the obese mannequin, while Frankie began to work on decrypting the rest of the data that was acquired. First, you started with the pants, then you inserted the yellow boots onto the mannequin's feet. From there, you put the large purple jacket onto the mannequin, zipping up the jacket, and then came the yellow utility belt and leg pouch. And finally, you cuffed on the yellow cuffed gloves and inserted the bat cowl upon the mannequin's head, thus completing the ensemble.

Moments later, you soon tapped a button or two on a console upon the display case, which caused a plexiglass door to shut before you. From there, a mechanical female voice rang out as it flatly stated:

"Activating Decontamination Protocols. Deploying Sanitation Countermeasures."

"...Well, that certainlytakes care of things for tonight. G'night, Frankie. Good luck on those decryptions." You said, wishing the dark-skinned brunette a good night, as she then casually replied, "Oh don't worry 'bout me Nurse Ratchet. You just take care of that Chubby Caped Crusader of ours, alright?"

"*chuckle* Don't have to tell me twice." You jokingly quipped, bidding Frankie a good nightleaving her in the Batgirl Bunker for the rest iif the night. Although you had only been in this world not too long ago, you certainly weren't regretting it by being here. From there, as you left Frankie to her devices for the night...
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Nurse's Orders

choices: …the dockyard warehouse.
…the Burnside fire station.
…the Gotham factory.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
Stepping out of the hidden door, you waited for a moment as it sealed behind you. Around the corner, you heard Barbara in the kitchen. Peeking around, you saw that she was hard at work digging into a sundae that wasn’t quite a match for the size of the smoothie the two of you had split earlier, but it was still a rather impressive amount. Even more impressive was the evidence of how much she had already eaten in the short time since she had left the secret room.

Wandering over you thought about asking her about whatever her connection to Ivy was, but decided against it. She would tell you in her own time.

“So how’s that pajama thing coming along?” you asked, letting your gaze trail down over her still mostly bared skin.

“A little slow in fact,” she responded with a sly grin crossing her face as she brought another heaping spoonful to her mouth.

The ice cream’s journey faltered a bit, before she turned it around and shoved it into your mouth instead. Soon after, the two of you finished off the ice cream. The cold mass settled in your stomach, leaving you a more than a little full after everything earlier. It also left you with a bit of a sugar rush.

When you made an offhand comment about this, Barbara remarked with a coy grin. “I think I can help with that.”

You next found yourself pinned to the bed by her bulk. Barbara seemed even passionate than she had the night before. She also was the one in charge, no matter your preference in the matter. The skill and dexterity she showed despite her size left you unconcerned with this though. You lost track of time and what happened as you passed into a pleasure filled haze.

After what felt like an entirety of heaven later, you became conscious that you were snuggled up against her warm and yielding bulk. Peeking an eye over the curve of her body, you saw that she was flicking through her phone with a slight smile on her lips and her eyes half open.

“What’s up?” you muttered.

“Oh, just checking out some of the posts that sprang up about my jaunt tonight. There’s a number of posts about seeing an enormous woman sprinting across rooftops and flying through the air. There are also quite a few people calling it an insane promotion for a weight loss product among other things.”

“Why are you on your phone right now, shouldn’t you be getting some sleep? What time is it anyways?”

“I…” She stopped as she winced. “I…couldn’t get to sleep. I was thinking about…you know.”

“Ivy?” you prompted.

Letting out a sigh and closing her eyes for a moment. “Yes. And no, I’m not ready to talk about it. Tell you what, the phone is being put away, and we can try to get some sleep.”

After tucking the phone in a drawer, Barbara closed her eyes. Even still, you remained awake for a while longer, keeping an eye on her even after her breathing had turned low and slow. Only then did you let yourself slip back to sleep.

Come the morning, Barbara seemed more reserved and distracted than she had the day before. Even the small talk over breakfast seemed almost forced. She only perked up when an alert from Frankie came through.

“Please tell me you have something,” Barbara said.

“Well, maybe,” Frankie responded. There was the sound of furious keyboard typing coming across the line as well. “Whoever set up that video feed was doing a fantastic job of covering up their tracks—“

“Shit,” came Barbara’s dejected response.

“Really, Babs, you think so little of my skills. I said they were doing a fantastic job of covering their tracks, not that it was enough to beat me.” Barbara regained some of her fire at that. “But that being said, I wasn’t able to pin it down completely. They bounced the signal across more than a dozen relays, must have been running at least three different encryption protocols, and…”

“Yes, yes, you’re a technological wizard Frankie, we get it,” you said with a bit of a laugh.

“Oh, right, sorry. I think I’ve managed to pin the signal source coming from one of three locations: a warehouse on the Burnside docks, the old fire station, or an abandoned factory over in Gotham. I could maybe try to pin it down further than that, but it will take a while longer.”

“See what you can do, but in the meantime, we’ll have to see about checking each of them out.”

Even without seeing her, you knew for sure that Frankie was certain to be making a face and wondering just why Barbara was so intent on this. You were trying your damnedest to not let a similar expression cross your face.

Fortunately, Frankie provided a welcome distraction. “Any idea which one you’re going to hit first?”

Barbara looked deep in thought for a moment before responding and saying she was going to…
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: A Bat gone viral

choices: Moments later, Babs soon came back out, all dressed up in street clothes.
Sometime later, the three of you met up with Alysia and Jo at Papa Joe's.
Suddenly, the computer was receiving a call from...Harley Quinn?!
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
With her eidetic mind transitioning into Hyperfocus once more, Barbara weighed the available options before her and her partners.

First, there was the abandoned factory within main Gotham City. It was once a regular toy factory until the Joker decided to turn it into a not-so-whimsical deathtrap for Batman, Robin, and Batgirl prior to her relocating to Burnside. As for it's location, it was easily located on the outer rims of the Bowery District, which was undoubtedly in Penguin's territory.

Then, there was the old Burnside fire station, which was once in use before City Hall funded the construction of a new, cleaner fire station for the Burnside Branch of the GCFD. And who knows? It might be in use by whomever was holding Ivy captive.

And last but certainly not least, was a warehouse at the Burnside Dockyards, located approximately seven blocks southwest of Burnside Bridge. Some of the warehouses there were still in use today, but there was a small margin of these storage facilities that were completely derelict, perfect for whomever was holding Ivy prisoner.

Contemplating her decision, the rotund redhead weighed her options, putting a plump hand on her equally chubby chin and double chin as she spoke aloud and said, "Hmm... The abandoned toy factory in the Bowery seems like an obvious choice. However, I still think they wouldn't put Ivy in there due to some of Joker's "toys" most likely still laying about in that God awful place."

Obviously understanding where she's coming from, you empathized with the rotund Barbara Gordon and complied, "Fair enough, I suppose."

"...Then there is the old Burnside fire station on Jefferson Avenue. It hasn't been used since April of last year. But honestly, it's way too exposed and out in the open for anything these people are doing with Ivy not to be noticed by the locals." Barbara continued, pacing briefly from left to right, her wide hips and burgeoning buttocks sashaying in rhythm with her mildly waddling steps.

"Yeah. Wouldn't make sense for whoever has Ivy to have her imprisoned in an area with high pedestrian traffic." Frankie agreed, her arms crossed whilst she looked at you and Babs in her swiveling chair.

"--Which means there's only one place that isn't just easily accessible, but also private enough not to be noticed by the public, and close enough to distribute whatever they are concocting from Ivy: The Burnside Dockyards." Barbara flatly confirmed, with her answer making the most logical sense in terms of discretion and accessibility.

After hearing what she had elaborated on, you and Frankie soon agreed with the rotund redhead, as you then spoke up and retorted, "Well, guess we now know which one we're investigating first, Babs."

"You and me both, sweetie. You and me both." Barbara quipped, putting on a soft agreed curve on her lips. However, just as she was about to approach the plexiglass casing that held her purple and yellow Batgirl costume, Barbara's stomach soon began to gurgle audibly, which caused an unbiased yet noticeable blush upon her chubby face, especially with such an unexpected interruption.

"*chuckle* Well, it sounds like a certain redheaded crime fighter I know needs a bit more sustenance than what she ate for breakfast~" Frankie chuckled, easily knowing how Barbara's stomach seemingly had a mind of it's own on occasion.

And yet, you couldn't help but agree with Frankie, as you seemed to feel a smidgen bit famished yourself, where you chuckled a little whilst placing a hand on your chubby hips and retorted, "Yeah. I think we can all afford a short reprieve before getting back to finding Poison Ivy."

Although, despite feeling as if finding the now corpulent Poison Ivy was an utmost priority, Barbara reluctantly had to agree with you and Frankie, letting out a reluctant *huff* in response. "*sigh* Alright, alright, you girls win. Stupid greedy stomach of mine." Barbara huffed, grabbing a good amount of belly flesh with a plump hand, shaking it aggressively in annoyance towards her expanded organ for an inopportune interruption.

"Aww! But it's my favorite part of you, Babs." You instinctively chirped, putting a teasing yet affectionate hand upon Barbara's substantially attentive apron belly, which the redhead couldn't help but display a doting curve on her lips, dimpling her round cheeks some as she replied, "I can't stay mad at you can I, my little medic?"

"*giggle* What? I'm not little!" You teasingly yelped, where Babs soon turned herself to press her substantially larger abdomen against your own, easily emphasizing her point, while she smugly placed her plump hands on her wider hips and quipped, "*chuckle* Well, you are when compared to me, sweetie."

"*chuckle* Alrighty then. While you two are busy showing off, I'll see if I can get a hold of Alysia and Jo, see if they're available for a get-together. After all, it's been a while since we've seen them, y'know?" Frankie chirped, as she then casually picked up her smartphone and dialed up Alysia's phone number.

"...Well, since we're going to be taking a break from searching for Ivy, I'm gonna get myself spruced up some if we're planning on seeing Alysia and Jo." Barbara stated, as she calmly waddled off towards the bedroom to get herself properly dressed in some street clothes, with her voluminous buttcheeks lightly bobbing up and down with each step and gait in the redhead's movement.

Meanwhile, you decided to momentarily check what's happening on social media, pulling out your smartphone and opening the Twitter app as you did so. From there, you were soon given a small load of notifications from Twitter, which seemed to be mostly related to the now fatter Batgirl, which seemingly now had it's own hashtag, "#FatBat".

Fitting, considering how big Barbara Gordon and Batgirl were now. And yet, you're still questioning how nobody seemed to have connected that Barbara Gordon and Batgirl were one and the same yet if they're so big now.

But anyway, your curiosity soon but briefly took hold, as you tapped on one of the notifications, which revealed a tweet posted on there that read:

"Was about to get robbed by some jerks in Biker threads until #FatBat showed up and kicked their asses. Thanks, #FatBat!"

The comment was about a day or two old, as you then scrolled down to look at another tweet, which seemed to be praising Batgirl as well, only it was briefly discussing about her sending a metaphorical message about body positivity, which read:

"Man, you never see that many plus-sized superheroines out there, huh? But boy is #FatBat sticking it to the stereotypes. OMG!! She looks so confident with her size! #FatBatRules!"

You were initially yet honestly surprised at how much of a following the now fatter Batgirl had, especially with some of the posted comments correlating to how she wasn't just helping the hipster community, but also showing that anyone can be their own superhero, no matter their size and body type. From looking at the profile page, you can easily see that Batgirl has a whopping total of 240,000 followers!

And of course, with such fame, there would always be a few haters and trolls out there. But one tweet stood out the most, which came from the notorious hacker and blackmailed, Riot Black, who posted a rather insulting yet immature tweet that said:

"#FatBat? More like #LardAss! I've been a #Fad before she was #FatBat. #FatBatSucks #KissMyAss #DumbLosers"

Fortunately, that post was a week or two old, as the tweet by Riot Black was absolutely DESTROYED with over 200,000 Dislikes and almost 300 nasty comments aimed squarely at the deadlocked hacker douchebag.

Suffice to say, it definitely brought a smug smile upon your olive-skinned face.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: A Breakfast Reprieve & Socializing Media

choices: The three of you ran into Alysia & Jo, who look as normal as they were.
The three of you came across Alysia & Jo, only...one of them was fatter?
Actually, when you three entered, Alysia & Jo... THEY WERE HUGE!!
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
Sometime later after the morning respite at the apartment, you, Barbara, and Frankie were now currently traversing the streets of Burnside, intent on a rendezvous with Alysia and Jo at the one place that was most familiar to them:

The restaurant establishment known as "Papa Joe's".

Currently, you were sporting a pair of denim shorts over a pair of diamond patterned leggings, as well as a pair of red and white converse sneakers on your lower half. Meanwhile, your upper half wore a shirt that bore the logo of the band, Ashes on Sunday, who once had Batgirl's ally and Birds of Prey member Black Canary as their lead singer, as you had your semi-baggy purse holstered upon your right shoulders.

However, looking at Frankie, you could see that she was sporting a black skirt that reached to just above her knees, bearing these peach-colored polka dots on the fabric, whilst she wore a light pink loose shirt with puffy short sleeves, along with wearing a crescent moon necklace around her lithe chocolate colored neck, yet her hair was put into a blooming wavy ponytail.

And finally, as you looked at the rotund Barbara Gordon, you could easily see her chosen ensemble, consisting of a stretchy pair of purple sport shorts, which overlapped a pair of colorful leggings, while she wore a set of yellow and white Converse sneakers on her bulky lower half, as her burgeoning paunch of a belly could easily be seen, as the lower hem of her belly was contained underneath the stretchy fabric of the sport shorts. And to top it all off, she had a long-sleeved plaid shirt tied around her waist, as the shirt seemed almost strained in wrapping around the redhead's bulbous girth.

Meanwhile, on her upper half, Barbara was wearing a simple yet massive white T-Shirt, which only outlined her established enormity, especially when it came to her bountiful bosom. Overall, Babs' ensemble did little to no effort in concealing her rotund size and bulk, as she had a spacious purse holstered around her plumped up left shoulder.

Suffice to say, Barbara was undoubtedly excited to see Alysia and Jo once again, bearing an excited curve upon her lips, despite the occasional onlooker gawking at the redhead's substantially heftier physique, which didn't seem to bother Barbara whatsoever.

"I honestly can't wait to see those two lovebirds again. I mean, we haven't seen them often in my opinion." Barbara gleefully quipped, in which Frankie nodded in agreement then replied, "*chuckle* Agreed. After all, those girls are inseparable these days, y'know?"

But then, whilst Frankie and Babs were reminiscing, your mind seemed to be giving you a recap on who Alysia and Jo were. Alysia's full name was Alysia Yeoh (no relation to actress Michelle Yeoh, of course!), and was Barbara's roommate before Babs moved into her current abode. Alysia was of Singaporean descent, and surprisingly, transgender. At times when she wasn't working as a bartender or painting, she would occasionally get herself involved in activism, alongside her girlfriend and now wife, Jo. Still don't know Jo's full name, though, but you think it is most likely short for Joanna or Joan.

Overall, outside of their activist work, they were actually rather nice people. Soon, your mind pulled you back into the physical world, as the three of you had just arrived at Papa Joe's. From there, upon entering the establishment...
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: A Reunion of Friends

choices: After lunch, you, Barbara, and Frankie return to the apartment.
Long after the luncheon, Batgirl investigates the dockyard warehouse.
Sometime later, the three of you investigate Denise's apartment again.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
“Geeze Barbara, you still packing on the pounds, huh?” Alysia called as your group neared the table.

The short haired young woman looked almost unchanged from the picture of her that Barbara had shown you. Her wife, Jo, on the other hand was looking more than a little chunky. She was still rather skinny compared to Barbara, and some of the other women you had encountered as of late, but the change from the same picture was striking nevertheless.

“Well, you know all about my sweet tooth, Lyssa,” Barbara responded with a twinkle in her eyes, drawing your attention away from the curvier Jo. Your surprised staring seemed to have gone unnoticed. “Plus, she doesn’t seem to mind me having a bit of extra weight,” giving you a playful hip bump that still almost sent you stumbling into a nearby table.

“So, you’re the one that big red here used to replace me,” Alysia said, narrowing her eyes as she looked you straight in the eye.

The sudden and rather jarring switch left you reeling, till the raven haired woman’s straight face broke and she burst out laughing.

“Man, you’re so serious, I’m just messing around with you,” she said motioning for the three of you to take a seat.

“She only does that with people she likes,” Barbara whispered in your ear.

You mumbled back, “Good to know,” as you took the seat in the middle to save Frankie from the encroaching weight of Barbara; all the better to enjoy it yourself as well.

“So what have you two been up to? We haven’t talked much for a while,” Barbara said, diving right in after your trio placed their orders.

“I’ve managed to sell a few more paintings. Nothing major, just a couple of private sales. I do have a piece in a gallery close by though. It’s strange seeing it surrounded by some of my idols though,” Alysia said after a sip of her drink.

“Don’t get all misty eyed now,” Jo chided her wife with a smile.

Alysia grumbled something before continuing, “I’ve managed to get a chef’s job as well–“

“You did!? Oh, I know how much you wanted that,” Barbara gushed.

The dark haired woman waved her hand, “It’s just in a food truck, but it’s nice to be able to do more than just sling drinks.” Pulling her wife close, “Jo’s been helping me taste test a few new offers as well…which might be why she’s putting on a bit of weight recently.” She added a grin at the end.

“Oh, stop that. You know you like me a bit curvier. Anyways, there’s all that taste testing, plus the baby weight might be–“ Jo’s mouth snapped shut so fast and so hard that people a few tables away must have been able to hear it.

“What!?” Barbara all but shouted. “I’m so happy for the two of you! But why didn’t you tell me!?” It looked like she would have jumped up and hugged them if it wasn’t for the table in the way.

Jo looked down at the table, her mouth compressed till her lips were a white line.

Alysia sighed and rubbed her forehead. “Well, we were trying to keep a secret for now, just to make sure that there weren’t any…” waving her finger around a bit “complications, you know? The doc says things look good so far, but wanted to keep an eye on everything just in case.”

Various bits of excitement and cheer went around the table. You even got into it. From there, things devolved into small talk that you paid only half attention to. The food arrived and saved you from passing out. It took a second waitress just to carry Barbara’s massive order. Alysia and Jo looked aside at each other with their mouths kept shut, not saying a word.

Things were going well – everyone was eating with gusto, interspersed with smaller bits of small talk – till Jo’s phone gave a buzz that shivered across the table. Alysia paused wide eyed, with a forkful of her salad almost at her lips. Jo gulped loud enough that you could hear it across the table as she starred down at the phone as it continued to buzz. She picked it up with a slight tremor to her fingers, flicking through.

She screwed her eyes shut before muttering “Shit” under her breath.

“What’s wrong?” Barbara said, diving right into her caring friend role.

“You remember Denise, right?” Jo responded.

“Yeah, we ran into her yesterday. She was…bigger than I remember,” Barbara said, her voice and face kept surprisingly casual.

Understatement of the year there you thought while trying to keep your face unchanged.

Jo gave a little snort before continuing, “Well, according to Richard, that’s her boyfriend if you didn’t know, she came back home last night. He’s sure of that. But she wasn’t there this morning, he can’t reach her at all, and he has no idea where she is. The police aren’t taking it too serious either, the whole ‘gone for 24 hours thing’ you know?”

Throughout Jo’s recounting, you watched out the corner of your eye as Barbara’s face paled further and further. You thought she was going to pass out or something if it continued. You were almost certain that it was because of some guilt that perhaps she could have done something if she hadn’t gotten distracted tracking down the elf across town.

Alysia couldn’t help but notice Barbara’s reaction. “Hey, Red, you all right?”

Frankie dove in and helped cover for the larger woman. “She’s been hearing about some of those other disappearances in the area, and she’s just as worried as we are. More so, in fact.”

“Yeah, I suppose it’s bad enough hearing about that happening. Even worse when it’s someone you know,” Alysia said, nodding her head.

Barbara recovered shortly thereafter. She set into talking with Alysia and Jo about Denise’s disappearance to give the appearance of not knowing what was going on. You could tell that she was still haunted by her inability to save Denise though, the way her voice was tighter than usual and she had a white knuckle grip on the side of the table.

Under the cover of the distraction, Frankie leaned in and whispered, “Think it was those elf things, coming back for her or something?”

You gave a quick nod. There was little doubt that they had done something while the rest of you were distracted at the candy shop.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Shadows looming

1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
Meanwhile, long after the luncheon get-together, Barbara had re-donned her Batgirl costume, as she made her way over to the Burnside Dockyards. With some luck, she might find Denise and the other missing girls.

And yet, whilst she parkoured her way across the Burnside rooftops via robust acrobatics and a reinforced Grapnel Gun, the rotund redhead's mind wandered a bit, thus letting her muscle memory do the work for her. Her thoughts contemplated on what Alysia and Jo said about Denise.

"You remember Denise, right?"

"Yeah, we ran into her yesterday. She was...bigger than I remember."

"Well, according to Richard, that's her boyfriend if you didn't know, she came back home last night. He's sure of that. But she wasn't there this morning, he can't reach her at all, and he has no idea where she is. The police aren't taking it too serious either, the whole 'gone for 24 hours thing' you know?"

"--Batgirl?" Your voice rang out, thus snapping the rotund Batgirl back into reality, as she nimbly landed upon an apartment building rooftop with ease, despite her obvious weight and girth.

"...Are you alright? You've been radio silent for a little while now." You asked, noting how Barbara has been rather quiet after the luncheon,which undoubtedly raised some reasonable concern in you. However, Batgirl soon responded back, perching upon the corner of the rooftop facing the Burnside Dockyards whilst she replied, "Sorry about that, sweetie. I've been...thinking a lot lately."

"You've been thinking about what happened to Denise last night, haven't you Babs?" Frankie interjected, obviously noticing Barbara's current disposition, despite being a good distance away from the apartment lair.

"...It's my fault, Frankie. If I had just focused more on keeping Denise safe, she wouldn't have been kidnapped." Batgirl retorted, feeling more than a twinge of guilt, exhibiting certain symptoms of what the superhero community has dubbed "Vigilante's Guilt", which is when a hero or heroine feels as if they failed to defend the people they've sworn to protect due to circumstances.

Of course, being someone with a medical profession, you could see that she needed a bit of moral support, as you then spoke back toward the rotund Batgirl and answered, "Look, Bats; Getting Denise kidnapped wasn't your fault, it was those damned Elf things and their master to be blamed for this. We'll find Denise and get her back home, we just have to play it smart and fast is all."

"*sigh*...You're right. We need to double our efforts in stopping this madness." Barbara firmly stated, her mood feeling more bolstered, as she soon leapt off the rooftop in a rotund swan dive, firing off her Grapnel Gun at the nearest rooftop, thus using her enlarged body like a pendulum to swing forward and launch herself onto a nearby warehouse rooftop.

Shortly after arriving at the designated point, Batgirl perched herself on a nearby warehouse rooftop edge, overlooking the designated warehouse, where it seems that the WayneTech satellite she "borrowed" from Lucius Fox had previously picked up a lot of thermal heat coming from this specific warehouse, Warehouse A-34.

Sticking to the shadows as her cape blew wildly in the windy evening breeze, Batgirl pulled out a pair of binoculars attached with a live camera feed heads-up display, zooming in on the front entrance of the warehouse. From there, she can undoubtedly see a pair of those wretched Candy Elf things standing by the metallic sliding doors.

And yet, even though there was definitive proof that these creatures exist, it was still bone-chilling to see these wretched abominations in action.

"Gotta admit, girls; It still sends shivers up my spine just looking at them." Frankie quipped, with you and the rotund Batgirl unanimously agreeing with the ebony-skinned hacker, as you and Frankie watched from the camera feed, keenly observing every jitter and quiver these Candy Elves made, despite their short statures.

"Hold on, I can see a truck coming. A Moving Truck, from the looks of it." Batgirl interjected, as she aimed the electronic binoculars at an oncoming moving truck approaching Warehouse A-34, which was rather shady considering the timetable for these specific vehicles.

And as if expected, the vehicle went straight toward Warehouse A-34, as the metallic doors automatically slid open, thus letting the storage vehicle proceed through. The size of the vehicle was certainly an indication that they were indeed transporting something rather massive...or someone.

1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
From her perch on the nearby rooftop, Barbara had a good view as the truck pulled inside. The loading dock door started to close, but before it did so, the back door on the truck opened and a platform started to slide out. Beneath her mask, Barbara’s eyebrows furrowed as she tried to figure out what that shapeless blob was…and then it clicked. That was a human, Denise to be exact, and far fatter than she had been before. Movement was almost certain to be an impossibility, reducing her to an immobile blob of blubber.

The door sealed with a muted clatter and yet Barbara didn’t move. She didn’t react at all till your voice came through her earpiece.

“Barbara, what’s wrong? Your heart rate shot up.”

“I–I think I…saw Denise.”

“You did?” Frankie asked, her fingers already flying across the keyboard again to get whatever data she could.

“Well, at least we know that those elf things really did take her,” you chimed in.

Barbara mumbled agreement. “Looks like they did quite a number on her too.”

“How so?” you asked, dreading that you knew the answer.

“She’s enormous.”

You gave a muted curse. That was what you were expecting. Didn’t make it any better to hear that it was true though.

“I’ve got to get in there before it gets any worse. You see a way in, Frankie?” Barbara asked, adding her eyes to the search as well.

“Looks like there’s a service door on the roof. There’s security…huh.”

“‘Huh’? What’s up?” you asked turning your attention to her main screen.

“Well, it’s just after everything they did to cover up this place. The security on the door seems kinda light.”

“Maybe they got overconfident with how well they hid this place. Doesn’t matter, I’ll take it,” the redheaded crime fighter said as she fired her grapple and swung up onto the roof.

The door was right where it was supposed to be, and opened with only a slight creaking noise. The skies seemed to open up at that instant, dumping a wall of water down on the city. Ducking down, Barbara moved in, her suit already shedding the little water that had landed on her. There was a muffled pop in her earpiece, but she didn’t think anything of it. She was too intent on rescuing Denise and anyone else caught up in this situation.

She was unaware that miles away within her apartment, you and Frankie were trying anything to get Barbara’s signal back. Frankie hadn’t encountered this type of jammer before and couldn’t figure out a way to counter it.

Back within the bowels of the targeted warehouse, Barbara prowled through the shadows. The rain hammering above and the claps of thunder meant that there was a lot of noise to fill her ears. The matching bursts of lightning left her blinded whenever they struck, as well as filling her gaze with shifting shadows and false movements all around her. Despite the trouble, Barbara continued moving along, careful for a surprise attack that never came.

After sneaking down through the building, she came to the main floor. A large open space greeted her, as did a huge indoor greenhouse, lights above blazing bright. The walls were frosted glass that prevented her from seeing inside, but there was little doubt in her mind that Ivy was inside. What better spot to keep the botanically inclined woman.

Reaching up, she pressed against the side of her cowl, triggering the earpiece. “Guys, I think I’ve found where they’re keeping Ivy,” she whispered. Static was her only response. “Hey, you reading me?”

She started to curse how obvious a trap this was when her voice died in her throat. That same noise that those elves made in the candy shop came from behind her. Gritting her teeth, she prepared herself for the attack. Barbara didn’t have to wait long, a couple of the elves lunging from their hiding places and trying to slice her open. Her experience from the previous fight meant it was easy for her to dodge and counter. Before long, the elves were scattered about in varying stages of unconsciousness and she was none the worse for wear.

Reaching up to try her earpiece again, she froze. Another bolt of lightning briefly illuminated the dim surroundings. Dozens if not hundreds of pairs of eyes gleamed in the burst of light, all of the locked on her. Now that she had seen them, she could make out the vague shapes of them moving around her. She was completely surrounded with elves scrambling across the ceiling and walls. At some trigger, they all dropped to the floor forming a veritable carpet of vicious candy creatures. They all paused, apparently taking delight in their prey’s reaction to the sheer numbers.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Trouble at the docks

1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
But then, just as Barbara stood her ground in a combative stance, bracing herself for the imminent horde of twisted Candy Elves to lunge at her, both she and the Elves heard a set of slow yet audible claps, along with a matriarchally feminine voice that said, "My, my, my! It is uncommon for us to receive such reputable guests."

Upon hearing the voice of this unknown individual, Barbara aptly noticed how..."obedient" the creepy elves were, just from hearing this woman's voice alone.

Barbara also noted that this woman must have some credible influence over them, as she witnessed the owner of such a voice walk out of the shadows and into the light, giving her a full view of who she assumed to be the true ringleader of this operation.

In appearance, the woman wore a hybridized violet Qipao dress with an equally violet puffy short-sleeved overcoat, which clearly displayed a physique that was equally as rotund as Batgirl's, only the woman's adipose was more allocated to her voluminous breasts, hips, and butt, thus shaping her body into a curvaceous hourglass shape.

Her right leg was visibly exposed, which easily showed off the woman's ornate footwear, appearing as some sort of footwear only found in ancient Feudal Japan. Edo Period, to be precise. While on her left forearm, she wore some sort of black Shinobi vambrace, which bore a pair of fingernails painted a magenta hue.

On her head, her hair was groomed into a formal and regal top knot, kept together with a metallic gold hairband and a pair of jade ornamental sticks, along with the remains of her fiery red hair put into a pair of small braided twin-tails. And to top it off, the bangs of her hair were dyed a fluorescent pink, and spiked off to the side similar to some anime protagonists.

However, Barbara had also noticed that this strange woman had some distinct tattoos on her right arm and leg. Going through her eidetic memory, she could easily tell that the tattoos symbolized Japanese Kanji. More specifically, the symbols on her arm translated to "Sleep" and "Fat", while the tattoo adorned on her right upper thigh stood for "Sweets".

https://www.deviantart.com/vocalrvbplaye...

Suffice to say, Batgirl has seen a few notable weirdos during her tenure as Burnside's own caped crusader, but this curvaceous yet very unusual woman certainly ranked as one of the weirdest in her personal opinion.

Overall, this shady yet off-colored individual certainly ranked high enough in Barbara's Weirdos List. Still in a combative fighting stance, Barbara metaphorically pulled a fast one out of Nightwing's Book of Quips and smugly replied, "Heh! And who are you supposed to be? An otaku wannabe?"

"*giggle* Cute. Now then, what would the illustrious Batgirl of Burnside want with this excellent establishment of mine?" She chirped, as if she seemed unphased by Barbara's stealthy intrusion. Then again, Babs wasn't at all that this woman obviously knew who she was, considering Batgirl's increased influx in popularity on social media.

However, Barbara knew that despite the woman's friendly demeanor, she couldn't let her guard down for a single second, where she furrowed her brow underneath her bat cowl then firmly stated, "...Judging from your creepy little friends, I'm guessing you're the ringleader of this operation."

"Oh, pardon me! Where are my manners?" The woman coyly retorted, as if this was a minute inconvenience. From there, as the perched Candy Elves keenly watched Batgirl's movements, the voluptuous woman gave her a formal curtsy, then promptly stood back up and continued, "I am Ms. Himiko Rosenthal. And you, my dear...are trespassing."

Upon introducing herself, the Candy Elves gave off these ecstatically menacing fanged grins on their caramel-colored faces, as well as making these chattering clicking and hissing noises. It was at this moment that Batgirl now realized that Rosenthal was not only complicit in these kidnappings, but the actual ringleader of this shady business.

"So you're the one responsible for all those missing girls, huh?" Barbara firmly accused, in which Ms. Rosenthal then expressed an almost sadistic grin upon her rounded face, which was unbecoming for someone of her status.

"*chuckle* Well, I guess it seems that my invested operations aren't so classified anymore, now is it?" Rosenthal smugly chirped, obviously playing coy with the redhead vigilante. And with such confirmation, Batgirl soon questioned, "Where are you keeping Denise and the other kidnapped girls?"

"...I'm afraid that's classified intel, Batgirl. Intel you won't have the privilege of viewing." Rosenthal answered, flat-out denying any access to what the fates of Denise and the other girls were. And with that, as she turned around to head towards the exit, Ms. Rosenthal gestured to the Candy Elves and chirped, "...She's all yours, my spry little friends. Don't rough her up too much, for I have special plans for this one."

And with their mistress giving them the go-ahead, two Candy Elves lunged from the wall and towards Batgirl. However, due to her extensive training, she saw this coming a mile away, unleashing a meaty roundhouse kick upon two of the Elves, sending them flying into a stack of oil drums.

In turn, this caused more of them to attack her at varying intervals and numbers, as the rotund Batgirl did her absolute best to fend them off, and even that wasn't enough. Despite knowing fully that she had walked into an obvious trap, she was completely cut off from you and Frankie, which obviously contributed to some sort of portable signal jammer hidden somewhere in the warehouse.

But like a horde of zombies, the diminutive Candy Elves weren't relenting their assault, and it would take a seemingly small miracle to survive in this situation. But still, she knew she had to keep fighting. To survive. To rescue Denise and the others.

After all, she learned from the best.

And fortunately for her, said miracle in the form of...

1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
Clenching her fists and rolling her neck, she was ready to fight. She was not ready for the screech that made it feel like her teeth were going to vibrate out of her head. The elves were unprepared as well; dozens of them shattering like fine glass due to the onslaught.

With their attention divided and their numbers slashed, it was just the chance Barbara needed. She dove in. Fists found weak points and batarangs picked off more distant targets. The elves hissed and retaliated, but it was too late. Another sonic scream came from the shadows, blasting another crowd of the elves into shards. The stragglers ran off, seemingly thinking whatever punishment they would receive for retreating must be better than continuing a losing fight.

One elf seemed to not care. It rushed towards where the sonic screams seemed to be coming from. Barbara drew another batarang and was ready to send it whirling through the air. She paused as the elf instead fell to a crushing axe kick that put it down in an instant. Slipping the batarang away again, Barbara turned her attention back to her earpiece, trying to get a signal through.

Behind her, a leggy blonde stepped from the shadows. She spared a quick glance around the room, making sure that no other elves or other tricks were lying in wait before stepping up to Barbara.

Without turning around, Barbara said, “Hey, Dinah,” while continuing to work on her earpiece.

Black Canary gave a chuckle before saying, “Nice to see you too, Babs.”

“You getting jammed too?”

“Yep, something in here cut my signal as soon as I came in,” Dinah said, holding up a phone to prove her point.

Barbara was about to respond when Rosenthal chimed in again. “Oh dear me, that didn’t go to plan. Though I wasn’t expecting you have a friend backing you up Batgirl, you always struck me as more of the…loner type, like the big Bat after all.” She turned much more chipper as she said, “Ah well, it’s no matter. I’ll get what I want anyways.” Hope the two of you have fun, especially you, you lovely blonde bombshell.”

Looking around, Barbara found a camera tucked away. The mechanics whirred softly as the lens refocused. A snap of her wrist and a batarang buried itself in the camera, a few sparks dropping before the camera drooped and shutdown.

“She’s a real weird one,” Barbara commented.

Dinah shrugged her shoulders and responded, “Eh, we’ve dealt with a lot that were plenty crazier than her.

Barbara cocked her head a bit, she wasn’t wrong there.

“You’re…looking good,” Barbara commented.

“Thanks, red, you too. Though I think you’ve put on a bit of weight,” Dinah said with a sly grin.

Barbara gave a little huff but grinned as well, “You’re one to talk. I think you’re bigger than I am.”

“I have no idea what you’re talking about,” Dinah replied as she tugged the sleeves of her jacket down around arms thicker than most tree trunks. She then propped her arms on hips that were each wider than her very considerable waist. “Enough of your tomfoolery though, we should probably get moving. You rescuing someone too?”

Barbara nodded and quick stepped up to walk beside Dinah. The pair moved off deeper into the warehouse, careful to avoid any further traps as well as Rosenthal’s cameras. Around the next corner, they found the wall of a greenhouse; the walls were fogged over so they couldn’t see inside. Both of the women tensed upon seeing it.

“Wait, you’re here for Ivy too?” Dinah asked as she saw the reaction in the other woman.

Barbara rocked her head, “Kind of, I was following a trail of her that lead here, and then I saw one of my friends being brought in here as well. But come on, we should get moving before Rosenthal decides to deal with us again.”

With that, Barbara slunk up to the door. The lock easily fell to her lockpick and the door swung open. Keeping a wary eye out, Barbara slipped inside, with Dinah following.

However, upon entering the greenhouse, the two rotund heroines became aware of Ivy's matronly care of her supposed "children", as they soon noted how they appeared to be...guiding them to where Ivy was currently located, which was made all the more obvious by the sounds of a gluttonous mouth chomping down on various delicacies.

In appearance, Ivy appeared to have doubled in weight and girth, according to Barbs' mental estimations. Her breasts had tripled in size, trying to keep up with her now enormous buttocks and monstrous abdomen in both size and volume. Still a little in shock, Batgirl soon stammered, "B-But how did--"

Ivy elaborated, explaining between exasperated huffs and puffs. Suffice to say, she was undoubtedly WAY too out of shape to get up under her own volition.

"...Can you get up on your own?" Batgirl asked, easily noticing Ivy's heft, as Ivy then slowly shook her head in response and said, "I'm afraid *huff* not. *huff* I've been *huff* stripped *huff* of my ability *huff* *huff* to walk for *huff* a few days *huff* now."

"Shit. How are we gonna move her out of here now?" Dinah queried, putting her fingerless gloved hands upon her bulbous fishnet-covered hips. They were definitely in quite a pickle.

However, upon quickly looking around the greenhouse and anything nearby, Batgirl soon displayed a cathartic grin on her plump face, where she discovered...
