1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
However, upon quickly looking around the greenhouse and anything nearby, Batgirl soon displayed a cathartic grin on her plump face, where she discovered a heavy duty forklift, and parked alongside was a transport truck. The smile was short lived though, as she saw a few glittering eyes peaking around the vehicles. The chittering sound bounced around the space as well, even from above and behind her.

She stifled a curse; this wasn’t the time to be losing her head. Then looking back over her shoulder, she called, “Hey, Dinah, come over here.” Once the blonde started over, Barbara said softly, “Our ‘friends’ are back. Looks like not all of them got the message.”

“Are they doing anything?” Dinah asked, peeking out the door as well.

Barbara shook her head. “No, nothing yet. They’re just hanging around out there, keeping an eye on us.” And then she added with a bit of agitation, “Doesn’t mean that won’t change though.”

Dinah nodded and rubbed her chubby chin. “You’re not wrong there. Got a plan, Red?”

Barbara scowled. She could feel it slipping away. Her original plan hadn’t counted on Denise and who knows who else being here. Nor had she been counting on the sheer numbers of foes standing in her way. There seemed to be no end to them and often kept throwing themselves at their targets with no self concern.

“I…think we’re going to need to split up,” she responded after a bit with more than a little hesitation and doubt evident.

Dinah arched her brow. “Sure that’s a good idea?”

“No, but I don’t think we’ve got a choice. Rosenthal might already be ready to pull out. She probably even sent those little freaks to keep us busy while she works on something else, and I have to see if I can find Denise. Might find someone else that needs to be rescued as well.”

“I don’t like the idea, but you’re not wrong either.”

“I know you can take care of the elves, but think you can get Ivy loaded up?” Barbara asked, pointing to the truck and forklift.

“How hard could it be?” Dinah responded with a grin.

Barbara did her best to return the grin, hoping her doubts and worry weren’t showing through. They shared quick thumbs up and the blonde gave her a friendly pat on the shoulder before Barbara ran off. She dodged past several of the elves and smashed several others around. Behind her, a sonic cry ripped through some of the encroaching elves. The shockwave shook the lighting above and knocked dust loose. Barbara couldn’t help but let a grin cross her face as she heard a number of the elves shatter like yet more glass.

More elves tried to stop her, but they weren’t successful in even slowing her down. Her steps did falter as her earpiece gave a static filled screech.

“–amn it, keep trying! Try something else!” she heard your voice at last. Covered in part by static, another familiar voice was welcome in any case.

“Hey, you guys got it, a bit at least. I can hear you,” she said as she resumed her run.

“Yes! Score another win for the tech-wizard!” Frankie shouted.

“How have things been going since we lost contact?” you asked.

“Busy,” Barbara replied with a grunt as she slammed one elf into another. “Some weirdo named Rosenthal knew I was coming and set up a trap.” Before you could express any concern over that, she continued, “Black Canary happened to show up though and get me out. We found Ivy. She’s even bigger than Denise was though, so that’s an issue. Dinah’s trying to take care of that…” Almost as if on cue another sonic cry reverberated through the metal structure. “…and I’ve split off to try to find Denise. You got anything to help with that, Frankie?”

“Uh…hold one,” Frankie said as she returned to furiously tapping on her keyboards.

“Yeah, no rush,” Barbara said with sarcasm dripping.

“Check out the North end of the warehouse, I think there’s a lot of activity going on there.”

“Thanks, heading there now,” her mind whirling with what layout of the warehouse she had been able to figure out, and her course adjusting to suit. A few more turns, and Barbara ended up in an enclosed walkway overlooking a loading dock. More elves were scurrying about, loading up several waiting trucks. Barbara let out a growl as she saw Rosenthal overseeing the work. A smile spread across the strange woman’s face suddenly, and then she looked up at the walkway and Barbara. Rosenthal gave a little wave before shouting something to the elves and hopping into one of the truck’s cabs.

The bars across the window meant that she couldn’t go out that way. She had to find another way around, and do it now. Before she could though, the trucks started to pull out. Rosenthal stuck her arm out the window and gave another wave, laughing the whole way.

“Frankie! Track the trucks leaving now!” Barbara snapped, running off to find some access down to the lower floor.

“Right, on it!” the tech-head responded. “Uh, wait, what trucks?”

“What do you mean ‘what trucks’? The trucks pulling out of the North end of the warehouse. The elves and their leader loaded up at least three trucks and they’re pulling out.”

“I’m not seeing any trucks here, Barbara. Everything around the warehouse is totally clear.”

“What!?” Barbara shouted as she rounded another corner and bounded down a staircase to the loading dock. The place was empty and there was no sign of any trucks outside the doors. “They were right here…” she said as she ran out the doors to confirm.

“Well, I can see you now or…at least I think that’s you. No, yeah, that’s you. But no trucks…not anywhere around here.”

"We're not seeing anything on the screens, honey," you confirmed.

“H…how…?” was all Barbara could manage.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Losing control

choices: "...Harley Quinn asked me to find Poison Ivy for her."
"...Someone asked me to find Poison Ivy. I'll tell you later."
Actually, before she could elaborate further, something happened...
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
Yet, despite being initially flabbergasted at how a small convoy of civilian transport trucks could have the capabilities to simply evade the now hacked surveillance cameras, Batgirl soon shrugged off such concerns for the time being, her mind finding only a single solution to this conundrum, as she soon grabbed and pulled out her vigilante-only smartphone, dialed up a certain phone number, then promptly said, "Qadir? It's Batgirl. You got my ride ready?"

== 2 Minutes Later... ==

Meanwhile, as she was being transported in the front transport truck, Ms. Rosenthal sat in the passenger seat of the truck cab, whilst three Candy Elves were preoccupied with driving the large vehicle, due to their diminutive size and height. One drove with the steering wheel, the second handled the gear shift, and the third controlled the gas and brake pedals. Eerily enough, Rosenthal chuckled to herself with an almost euphoric grin on her rounded face as she chortled to herself, "Ohohohoho~ I must admit, Batgirl, you certainly are quite the fascinating individual. *sigh* But sadly for moi, I have places to be, business to conduct."

Suffice to say, Rosenthal seemed to have a keen eye on the finer fetish-related things in life. However,it also seemingly blinded her to an obvious truth, as Batgirl stealthily approached behind the small convoy of transport trucks via the Bat-Cycle she was given, courtesy of Qadir. Though, it had to be slightly reinforced to adequately compensate for Barbara's quarter-ton physique.

Despite the fact she was about to break approximately several motorcycle and big rig laws for what she was about to commit, it was not a priority at the moment, as she soon revved up the motorcycle's throttle some to get closer to the rear of the truck. And then, with a flick of the wrist, Batgirl flung a small but powerful magnetic Bat-Tracer towards the bottom of the truck trailer, where the device's magnet soon turned on and clamped itself on the bottom of the trailer with a light metallic *THUNK!* in the process.

"I got you now, pervert." Batgirl smugly thought, a cathartic grin appearing on her plump lips, swiftly pulling off a 180 degree drift, as she then heard Black Canary over her earpiece as the buxom blonde quipped, "Hey, Red! I've already got Ivy in the truck, and we're just out of that weird shithole. Where are you?"

"*sigh* That's good to hear, Dinah. Unfortunately, Rosenthal escaped in three cargo trucks, but I managed to put a Bat-Tracer on one of them before they got away." Batgirl replied, relieved to hear such good news, where Black Canary soon retorted, "Well, shit. *sigh* Still, at least we'll know where that crazy fatass and her Christmas special rejects are heading next."

Obviously, Barbara couldn't help but chuckle a little at such a snide remark from her friend, just as she drifted around the corner of an adjacent intersection, using her rotund girth as a counterweight to make such a sharp turn. However,despite such witty banter between the two, Dinah soon spoke to Batgirl with an ounce of seriousness in her tone and asked, "So...Care to tell me why we just rescued Big Green here, Red?"

And there it was. The big question. Exhaling a deep sigh, Barbara knew that eventually she would have to confess the true reason for rescuing the now immobile Poison Ivy. She just wished it was after the case was closed. So, in response, Barbara soon spoke into her earpiece and explained, "*sigh* I'll explain it to you when we drop off Ivy in a more secure location, Dinah."

"I take it that the supposed "secure location" would be the new Birds of Prey safehouse we just set up here in Burnside, right?" Black Canary questioned, in which Batgirl soon replied, "...Exactly. Think you can get her in the elevator?"

"--Just as long as she doesn't weigh over two and a half tons, then yeah. What will you be doing in the meantime, Bats?" She quipped, where Batgirl soon exhaled another deep sigh and elaborated, "...Let's just say I've got a skeleton in my closet that I've gotta confess to my girlfriend and Frankie. We'll meet you there ASAP."

"Fair enough, I suppose. I'll see you at the rendezvous, Barb." Dinah stated, thus ending the conversation while she drove the truck towards the Birds of Prey safehouse in Burnside.

From there, whilst she made her way toward the safehouse, Batgirl soon called you and Frankie on her comms and said, "Hey, girls."

"Babs! *sigh* Do you have any idea how worried I was?!" You exclaimed, attempting not to sound too angry towards the rotund redhead vigilante. Suffice to say, Babs understood your predicament, bearing a loving curve of her plump lips on her chubby face and replied, "Sorry for making you so worried, sweetie. Turns out they had a jammer in that warehouse. Look, um... Can you and Frankie head over to the Clock Tower for me? There's...something I gotta get off my chest."

"Okay, we'll head over there now. Is...everything alright, Babs?" You asked, becoming reasonably concerned, judging from her tone, as Barbara then exhaled another deep breath and explained, "...I know we promised no more secrets between us when we started dating, sweetie. But...*sigh* The truth is..."
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Tracers And Rendezvous

choices: You pull up outside the clock tower without any trouble.
There’s a loud thump on the roof of your car before the window gets smashed.
You’re startled as you receive an alert: Frankie is being attacked.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
“The truth is Harley Quinn asked me to find Poison Ivy for her." you heard Barbara say.

You stared, slacked jawed, at the speaker. Beside you, Frankie was as stunned, though she wasn’t quite so obvious about it.

“Frankie, can you do something to clean up the feed. There’s no way we just heard that right,” you managed to say after finding your tongue again.

Static still filled the line, even if it wasn’t as bad as it had been before. That had to be why you thought you heard that.

”No, come on, the comms are fine, or at least fine enough. You heard me correctly.” Barbara said, a hint of hurt coming over the line at you not believing her.

“Honey, would you like to explain that…please?” you asked, trying to wrap your head around that.

“That’s the plan. Come meet me and I’ll explain everything, I promise.”

“Fine, fine,” you replied. The line clicked and went silent, not even any static now.

“Damn, didn’t think Barbara was keeping a secret like that,” Frankie muttered, putting words to your thoughts as well.

“Neither did I,” you added. “Guess we should get going…”

Frankie gave a negative hum. “Nope, I’ve got to make sure that that freak and her elves can’t end up jamming us again. You go check up on big red.” She paused for several seconds, the gaze in her eyes hinting that she wasn’t done yet. After a bit she finally said, “Take care of her, yeah? And send me a message ASAP.”

“Of course,” you replied.

You headed for the secret door and it was about to close behind you when she chimed in again, “Be careful out there.”

You waved a hand back towards her before the door shut leaving you in the darkened living room. You tried picking through your memories of the few comics you had read to try to figure out why Barbara was willing to work with someone like Harley, but came up blank. You shook your head; you weren’t going to find out waiting here.

The rain was still battering everything in sight, so you turned around and grabbed a coat before slogging out into the storm. Shaking clinging drops off, you grabbed your phone. You could have asked Frankie for the directions to the clock tower, but that would have gotten you too many questions. Fortunately, a quick internet search and you had it. Flicking the wipers on high, you pulled out, a sense of unease settling in the pit of your stomach.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Another layer of truth

choices: From there, you began to perform a medical diagnosis on Ivy.
But then, Batgirl had just arrived at the Clock Tower.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
"...I still don't understand why Barbara would be so willing to work with Harley Quinn, considering her ties to the Joker. *sigh* I better head over there if I do plan on getting some real answers." You contemplated, as you soon but slowly drove the car out of the apartment parking lot, heading towards the eponymous Clock Tower as the rain continued pouring on the darkened Burnside streets.

Suffice to say, this would certainly count as pulling an all-nighter, that's for sure.

== 15 Minutes Later... ==

And yet, despite the incessant gnawing in the pit of your stomach that was blaring out that something bad would be happening, you were fortunately proven wrong on that account, as you somehow eventually reached a tall singular spire building, which you could only assume to be none other than the aforementioned Clock Tower Babs, Black Canary, and Frankie had previously mentioned earlier.

As you pulled into the back alley parking area, the headlights on your car soon shone upon what you assumed to be the same cargo truck that the rotund Black Canary had used to transport an elephantine yet immobile Poison Ivy. And yet, speaking of the human-plant hybrid, you noticed how Barbara didn't exactly go into detail as to how big Ivy was now, as you mentally contemplated, "...Babs didn't exactly say how big Ivy was now."

"...Though, I've got a feeling that I'll find out soon enough." You noted, calmly closing the driver side door with a gentle yet briefly audible *Clunk!* behind you, quickly fast-walking to the rear entrance of the building, which led to a private service elevator leading up to the main safehouse area where Black Canary, Poison Ivy, Batgirl, Frankie, and yourself would rendezvous.

Judging from your prior knowledge of anything related to a Clock Tower hideout was in the video game, Batman: Arkham Knight, and yet, there were a few key differences, aside from the private industrial-sized service elevator, of course. From there, as if from mere memory, you instinctively entered the elevator, pressing the number five on the elevator keypad, then the number one, the number four, and finally the number three button, as if inputting a numbered passcode.

And with that, the button keypad soon displayed a lit up LED Bat Symbol on the keypad, as it then promptly spoke with an animatronic female voice and said, "Access Granted."

From there, the elevator doors automatically closed themselves, as the elevator then began to slowly but progressively ascended up the elevator shaft. Whilst the elevator ascended, you soon got a text on your smartphone, to which you promptly pulled it out to examine the text message. Fortunately, it was from Barbara, which read:

"Okay, we seem to be in the clear for now. Heading to rendezvous now. Be there in a minute!"

"*sigh* Well... At least things haven't gotten TOO out of hand. Hopefully, we can stop that freaky Rosenthal woman," You thought, feeling rather relieved that your stomach's instinctive pessimism was proven incorrect, as the elevator finally reached the intended floor of the Clock Tower, where it came to a full stop.

From there, the elevator doors opened, then the secret Clock Tower entrance opened, which was hidden behind an extensive bookcase attached to a metal sheet with many moving mechanical components, as the secret door opened in a similar manner to the reinforced doors in Arkham Asylum.

Once the secret doors opened to allow you entrance, you finally got a good long glimpse of the now corpulently immobile Poison Ivy. And much to your surprise, she was MUCH fatter than you thought she'd be. However, your eyes weren't the only ones to notice this, as you soon heard the bulbous Ivy speak to you with a now somewhat husker voice due to the accumulated fat on her neck and face whilst she sarcastically quipped, "...Like what you see?"

"Oh! Um...S-Sorry for that. I just, um...n-never seen someone as big as you, that's all." You stammered, as you slowly walked into the main interior of the safehouse. Shortly after your retort, you soon heard Black Canary's voice, which indicated that she was on Ivy's left side, out of your sight for now, where she chuckled, "*chuckle* You got that right, girl!"

From there, you soon saw Black Canary come into view, whose larger hips wobbled from left to right in a sashaying motion as she approached you. And then, much to your internal surprise, Black Canary wrapped her meaty arms around you in an almost familial hug of sorts, as if you and her had some history, where she then promptly yet jokingly quipped, "Long time no see, Doc! How's Bats been treating you?"

Much to your surprise, you seemed almost at ease with Black Canary, akin to speaking with an old friend from High School, given your "supposed history" with Batgirl in this world, where you automatically eased up a little as Black Canary severed the embrace, placing her fingerless gloved hands upon her burgeoning hips whilst you replied, "...She's been treating me quite well, Canary. I just got a text from her while on the elevator, said she'll be here very soon."

"Glad to hear that, Doc! And speaking of which, I got you an old patient of yours, right here!" Canary chortled, where she gave one of Ivy's now gargantuan buttcheeks a hefty slap, which not just caused the excessively huge buttcheek to jiggle and ripple wildly in physical response, but also elicit a greatly embarrassed expression on Ivy's bulbous fatty cheeks, bearing a pinkish hue to such green skin.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Clock Tower Refuge

choices: Barbara and Ivy both tell their stories.
Fankie interrupts, she has a fix on the tracker.
With a bang, the power shuts down across Burnside.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
“I’m going to go head and give you a medical exam, all right?”

Ivy nodded, even that small motion sending ripples through her immense form. That increasingly familiar twinge came at the back of your head and you moved over to a nearby cabinet on instinct. Inside laid and hung a number of medical devices, both ordinary and extraordinary. Picking up one that looked a bit like an iPad with a rugged case and a much sophisticated camera system, you turned back to the mountainous green woman and the – relatively – smaller blonde beside.

Your mouth moved before you could think. “Just going to take a quick scan first.”

Your fingers danced on the screen before you pointed the camera towards Ivy. A blue light lanced out, painting a large square of crisscrossing lines on her side. You moved around her, waving the pad up and down to cover each portion of her in turn. Data streamed across the screen as you watched, collecting together and building a profile.

Dinah turned to glance at a screen on the wall. You peeked over yourself and saw it showed an interior view, a large bike, and an even larger woman astride it. You couldn’t mistake Barbara sitting there, and even with her helmet, you could tell that she was psyching herself up.

“Doc here will take good care of you, Green, like before. I’ll be back shortly.” Dinah didn’t wait for a response before taking off through another door.

You turned your attention back to the screen in your hand. According to what you saw there, Ivy was in perfect health for a human-plant hybrid. That shouldn’t have been possible at her size and weight, but the fact that she was absolutely still alive and relatively still well was a testament that contradicted that impossibility. You expressed your amazement to Ivy, though with far more tact.

“It did seem that shrew Rosenthal and her annoying little helpers did not want to harm me. When they took me from…” she hesitated before giving a sigh and a shrug that hefted her elephantine shoulders. “They took me from Harley. It seemed more like they needed me for something. I think that’s why they had that greenhouse set up for me: to keep me somewhat happy as they did…this.” Her wands wiggled upon her flanks, a motion hinting at her bulk.

Your brow furrowed a bit. “Harley”, could she be referring to Harleen Quinzel, aka Harley Quinn, the partner to the big clown himself, whenever she hadn’t broken away from him for one reason or another? There had been hints and outright statements that something may have been between Harley and Ivy in their various versions. It seemed that this wrld might have been one where it had been fact.

You wondered, Could that have something to do with—

Your thoughts were sidetracked by Dinah coming back, grumbling “You could have told me…”

With her came Barbara, looking warn out but also pleased with even this partial victory. Upon seeing you standing in the room, she took a quick step towards you. She then held back, folding in on herself a bit. You opening your arms towards her broke her hesitation. She rushed forward, enveloping you in a pillowy hug pickled with the sweat from her recent exertions. You wouldn’t have traded it for anything even still.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Putting things together again

choices: But then, somehow Harley got inside the Clock Tower!
Suddenly, the Clock Tower Batcomputer picked up a signal!
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.content:
"*sigh* (Name), I...I'm sorry for not telling you this sooner. Its been eating me up inside a little after we made that oath to each other." Barbara confessed, returning the embrace as well. Although you felt rather sore about her keeping you in the dark with such an important issue, you voluntarily forgave her as you held her gloved hands in your own and replied, "Bats...It's alright. I forgive you. I mean, it's a small price for what we're doing here and now, y'know?"

"*relieved sigh* That's...That's good to hear. Thank you, sweetie." Barbara answered, planting a brief but loving kiss upon your lips, grateful for your forgiveness, to which Dinah abruptly interrupted the two of you via lightly patting Barbara's ballooned posterior and quipped, "Hate to ruin the moment, lovebirds, but we still have the issue of a Half-Ton Ivy at present."

"Thank you for the obvious, Dinah." Ivy dryly quipped, not exactly amused with the Black Canary's nonchalant jab at her current weight, rolling her green eyes in the process, just as a small burp escaped Ivy's plump lips, causing a greatly embarrassed blush to emerge on her fatter cheeks. Suffice to say, this wasn't what she would call "a shining moment" in her crusade to protect Nature.

Refocused on the current disposition at hand, you swiped at a few buttons on the touch pad, which soon brought up a half-sized digital model of the now elephantine Ivy, to which Barbara looked at you and asked, "So...What are we looking at here?"

"Well, according to the scans I've performed on our guest, she appears to be in a clean bill of health, despite the many contradictions to what we're suspecting of this level of obesity." You automatically explained, to which your thoughts noted, "...Okay, this'll take some getting used to." Of course, as Dinah placed her chubby biker gloved hands upon her burgeoning fishnet-covered hips in an almost quizzical nature, she bluntly questioned, "...Okay, so she's healthy. What's the problem?"

"--I. Can't. Walk. Anymore." Ivy flatly interjected, to which she proved such a claim by attempting to stand up, only for her elephantine girth acting akin to a truck-sized anchor, thus pinning her to the floor in green-skinned adipose, which sent violent ripples across the human-plant hybrid's massively bloated form.

"Okay, Ivy. You made your point." Barbara replied, her tone in an accepting manner to calm the now immobile Poison Ivy. From there, you continued despite the interjections and elaborated, "...Anyway, moving on..."

And with a few more touches on the tablet, a set of numbers appeared alongside the digital model of Ivy, showing her blood pressure, heartbeat, and current weight. Frankie approached the group and immediately noticed the statistics, quickly making a sarcastic jab and jested, "Heh! Wow. One thousand five-hundred and eighty-two pounds. Damn, Red. You REALLY let yourself go!"

"Easy, Frankie." Barbara jeered, quelling Frankie's verbal roasting of Ivy, to which the hybrid huffed and rolled her eyes in response. From there, Dinah turned her hefty self towards the equally rotund Batgirl of Burnside, hands on her wide hips and asked, "So...I take it there's a reason why the Clown Princess of Crime sent you after Red here, Bats?"

"*sigh* I figured that'd come to light sooner or later. Fine, I'll explain this conundrum as promised." Barbara admitted, to which she then exhaled a deep breath and began to explain, "...It all started almost two weeks ago. I just finished up on taking down another one of Riot Black's schemes that night, and was heading back to the apartment until--"

"--Let me guess: Harley tackled you midair?" Dinah interjected, getting a bit of a chuckle out of such a statement, which brought a small blush upon Barbara's plump cheeks as she then answered, "Pretty much, Dinah."

"So...Why would Harley Quinn want your help anyway, Babs? I mean, doesn't she have some friends of her own to do that?" You asked, to which Ivy soon interjected into the conversation and elaborated, "--That's because Harleen has...ended her relationship with the Joker. It was pretty much what every criminal in Gotham was talking about when it happened. In fact, she now lives in Coney Island last time I checked."

"Oh. Well...that explains a lot." You stated, being legitimately surprised that Harley was able to cut ties with the famed Clown Prince of Crime, especially given their history, albeit an abusive relationship. But then, another question popped into your head, as you looked at Ivy and questioned, "...If that's the case, then why did Harley ask for Batgirl's help?"

"*sigh* ...To be honest, human...It's partially my fault. Three weeks ago, I was contacted by Rosenthal due to her interest in my work as a botanist, At first, I thought it was something minute. Oh, how naive I was in such a moment of weakness..." She mused, doing her best to flex her fattened arms, hands, and fingers, which now seemed practically useless at this point.

Putting two and two together, Barbara soon came to the conclusion as to what happened next, as she then answered, "I see now... Rosenthal kidnapped you, didn't she?" In response, the elephantine Ivy nodded once in confirmation, her fattened head and face smooshing against her plumped up collarbone area, then continued, "Unsurprisingly, she wasn't interested in my research, of course. But rather, she was far more intrigued by....something else that I possess."

"--Wait a minute; I think I know what she's referring to!" You calmly exclaimed, to which you quickly sifted through the statistical analytics shown on the touch pad, until you stopped at a single dubious heads-up display. Then, you presented it to Barbara and automatically said, "Take a look at what's in her chlorophyll levels."

At first, Barbara didn't see much, but then her trained eyes instantly caught something that stood out. "Holy... No wonder why Ivy appears so lethargic. These Melatonin levels are too high!" She stated, as she then noticed something else as well and continued, "...There's also something else in her systems as well, some sort of...isotope?"

"--That's...what she has been pumping me full of for the past few weeks, Miss Gordon." Ivy begrudgingly answered, formally calling Barbara by her last name, obviously hinting that she's already aware of Batgirl's real identity. From there, as she then displayed an ashamed expression upon her bloated face, she reluctantly continued, "She calls it her... "Nebutori Filling". *shudders*"

Judging from how Ivy was reacting, you can clearly see she didn't exactly enjoy what Rosenthal had pumped into her systems, as Dinah lumbered over to the immobile Ivy to console her, while you, Barbara, and Frankie looked at one another, as Frankie then spoke up first and queried, "...Any of you got that feeling that Rosenthal is just a big fat weeaboo?"

"You and me both, Frankie. Still, this is going to be troublesome to explain to Harley how Ivy got so...fat." Barbara retorted, to which got you a bit curious, as you interjected, "Yeah... But still, weird how Rosenthal called it her Nebutori Filling, y'know?"

"(Name): A Nebutori is related to an odd superstition in ancient Japan where if a woman goes to sleep after eating, they would become incredibly fat and lethargic. My guess is that Rosenthal based this filling of her's on the Japanese myth of the same name, if the high levels of Melatonin pumping through Ivy's veins are anything to go by." Barbara elaborated, putting a plump contemplative hand against her chin and double chin.

Of course, the more you thought about it, the more it almost made sense. After all, Rosenthal seemed to bear a very strong Japanese motif to her overall appearance when she made herself known, even though she barely looked Asian. Overall, you figured that things were probably gonna get weirder from here on out.
1553322223322223232223222222133333322221.title: Rotund Reconciliation

1553322223322223232223222222133333333123.content:
You gave a through stretch as you entered your home. It had been a late night at the restaurant, but not a bad one. As the sous-chef it was your job to make sure that all the kitchen equipment was in good order. Everything had been in order and no real problems had occurred, so the really only thing to do was give everything a through scrubbing and cleaning. After that, you had made sure that all everyone’s work schedules were in order for the next month. Requests for certain days off, employees swapping shifts, making sure that everyone got suitable hours, etc.

Everything just had to be straight and in line as you would be on vacation for the next month. You wouldn't be on call if something went wrong. But, you had faith in the kitchen staff. They were good and you personally trained each one. There was little to worry about.

You yawned as you removed your jacket and carefully hung it up. Your gaze turned to the clock. 2:54 am. Oh, yes, it was time for bed. Just because you were used to the late nights didn’t mean you liked it. So the moment that you got your clothes off, you dived into your nice bed, ready to let the exhaustion of the day take you.

Just before you drifted off, your eyes popped open. You sat up and turned off your alarm clock with a tired smile. You wouldn’t need that for some time. You let your eyelids droop down and before you knew, you were enjoying blissful slumber.

----------------

When you awoke the next morning, you could feel that something was off, even before you opened your eyes. It wasn’t bad, mind, but it was still different than what you had become accustomed to. You felt warmer, more cozy. That...that wasn’t right. You had a good bed but it certainly didn’t feel like this.

You forced your eyes open rather easily. All the times you had to wake up early to go to work over the years had given you plenty of practice in forcing yourself awake when needed. The small bit of alarm that you felt didn’t help either. Eyes open and your awareness expanding with your waking, you saw the source of the change.

It was...a woman. Not just any woman. An absolute mountain of a woman, easily one the biggest living things you’d had ever seen. She easily dwarfed you in size and mass, many times of over. She was so large that she had easily dominated the bed space. In fact, you weren’t lying on the bed, you were lying on her! Her vast belly acted as your mattress. It was easily larger than you were and it was easy to see how you could have slept on it. Her breasts were the size of exercise balls and one even served as your pillow. Her thighs were monstrous, like literal pillars of soft adipose. Her butt was large enough to be a couch and would have decimated a car is she had sat on it. All of this was topped by a rounded face with a quadruple chin. Her complexion was a healthy shade of pink and she had black hair that just passed her shoulder blades.

You blinked once. Twice. Thrice. Your brain shut down, unable to process the fact that a woman who was several times larger than a wrecking ball was in your home, laying in bed with you. It felt like hours before your brain kick started itself into action. Who was she? What was she doing in your house? In your bed?! She certainly wasn’t there last night when you went to bed.

As these questions assaulted you, a memory jogged. She looked familiar. You had seen her before. In comics. In your favorite, Superman. This...human mountain was Lois Lane! But that was impossible. It didn’t make a lick of sense but then again, none of this made sense. You gently shook your head, as if that would clear it.

What do you do with the crazy situation?

1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
The sun’s rays peeking through the blinds in your apartment stirs you awake. You blink blearily as consciousness slowly comes back to you. As your eyes adjust, you begin to notice that something feels very strange. This isn’t the bed you fell asleep in last night, nor is this even your apartment. You start to wonder what was in those drinks last night. Well, what happened, happened, you admit. Time to face the consequences.

You roll over to get an idea of where you may have ended up, or at the very least, who you just had a regretful night of drunken escapades with. Your eyes widen with surprise as you see the sleeping form lying next to you.

She’s beautiful, to be sure. Her pleasant face has all the soft and attractive features of a goddess, you think. Her golden locks cascade over her eyes as she snoozes softly. It’s her size that takes you by surprise. The gargantuan woman laying beside you has to be at least five-hundred pounds, if not more. Her thighs have to be about as wide as a single, much thinner girl, each. The curve of her rump peaks higher under the covers than you ever thought anyone’s could. You can see the hint of her flabby gut, which spills over her hip-line like rising dough. Most dominating of all is her impressive rack, which looks like it would burst out of her nightshirt if she so much as hiccupped.

Still, she carries the weight well, and despite her size, she still has a curvy, feminine form. You’re not going to lie to yourself: this may not be the kind of girl you’re used to, but she is still pretty hot for a girl her size. Though, you do have to wonder just how mobile she is.

Well, it’s not like you’re going to be hanging around much longer. Your plan is to get up, throw your clothes on as quickly and quietly as possible, and get your walk of shame over with before anyone sees you leave. However, as you stand up, you are curious about the apartment you’re in.

It’s nothing fancy, but it’s certainly no dump either. For someone who looks too big to make a simple walk from the bed to the couch, this girl certainly has kept a tidy place, not at all what you were expecting. You were kind of expecting the place to be littered with to-go boxes and containers, but then you realize what a total slimeball you sound like for assuming that just because the girl’s huge.

You stride over to the window and gasp with surprise. When the fuck did you go to Japan? Gazing at the city skyline, you realize that you’re somehow in Tokyo. It’s starting to occur to you that this isn’t just a matter of having one too many drinks. Something seriously messed up is going on here.

Forgetting about your quick escape, you decide to explore some more, hoping to find some clue as to what happened. Nothing looks familiar, and you still have no clue how you ended up here. You decide to head to the living room, hoping to find more clues.

You find one, but it’s certainly something you’re not expecting. There on one of the end tables by the couch is a photograph, and it’s a picture of you and the girl in the bed. You two look so happy, and so close as if you’ve been dating her for months. In fact, the more you look around the apartment, the more you realize you have been dating her for months. You’ve practically moved in with her…or maybe she moved in with you. It’s hard to tell when you suddenly wake up with a different life.

You’re not sure what kind of Twilight Zone shit this is, but you don’t want to stick around to find out any more. You start heading back to the bedroom to grab your clothes and go look for help. That’s when you notice something off about the bookshelf in the corner, by the kitchen. It looks like there’s a bit of a gap between the wall and the bookshelf, and if you’re not mistaken, it looks like a passageway.

You take a deep breath. This already got weird from the minute you woke up. What’s another surprise? You creep over to the shelf and start to push on the side of it, hoping to move it out of the way to get to the entrance. Of course, that doesn’t work. Thing’s practically bolted to the floor. You’ve read enough comic books and seen enough cheesy horror movies to know there has to be a trigger somewhere.

Looking through the shelf, you start to get an idea of what sort of tastes this girl has. There are all kinds of stuff on aliens, UFO’s, and IT books galore. Great, this one’s a total nutjob, you think. Still, you find what you’re looking for: some gooey romance novel that clearly doesn’t belong with the rest of the collection. You pull it out, and the bookshelf swings back, revealing the passage behind.

Actually, it’s not much of a passage. It’s just a storage room for hidden necessities. It’s what you see inside this storage closet that makes you realize you’re clearly not in Kansas anymore.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: And So it Begins...

choices: You're a young, fit man. What girl wouldn't want you?
You're a tall, muscular man. Bodybuilder much?
You're a trim, small woman. Definitely the exact opposite of Power Girl.
You're a pudgy, young woman. Maybe you two have more in common.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
You feel like your jaw could just drop to the floor. In the secret closet is a white superhero suit. It's practically a one-piece bathing suit with an extremely revealing cut for the bust. A short red cape hangs from the back, and it's completed with blue gloves and boots. Suddenly, you remember where you've seen this before. This is the uniform of Power Girl, cousin of Superman, and all around kick-ass superhero.

But there's something wrong. The suit is clearly made for a woman of a larger size as it is stretched over an overweight mannequin. This certainly makes the bust cut look even more revealing, but it's clearly let out for someone with a larger gut, and the bottom is little more than a glorified thong. Of course, you realize that this is meant to be worn by the girl sleeping back in that bedroom, but she couldn't be Power Girl, not by a long shot. She just has to be one of those overweight fangirls who wears the suit to comic cons or something like that.

Your mind soon changes on that opinion though, as you turn around and see the enormous girl from earlier hovering over towards you, wearing nothing but a lacy red bra and panties that stretch and barely cover her large form, a sleepy smile on her face. Wait...she's hovering! Well, that explains how she's able to still get around at her size, but still...hovering? That means she has to be Power Girl. There's no other explanation for it. No one else would have that Kryptonian ability for flight, or that kind of strength to lift such an incredible bulk.

You watch her enormous gut sway and bob as her body hovers closer to you. It presses against your chest, as she wraps her arms around your shoulders and kisses your cheek. "Morning, sweetie," she says in a sleepy voice. "What are you doing up so early?"

Upon kissing you, a few of your memories start to come back. No, wait. They're not your memories, not really. They're memories that go with this reality you've woken up to. You've been dating Power Girl for a little over a year now. You met when she saved you from a building being destroyed by Reactron. You got a rare opportunity to thank her in person, and thankfully, you hit it off better than could ever have been expected, especially since Power Girl wasn't known for having a major social life.

"Uh...I was..." you stammer.

She looks behind you and notices the super suit. "Oh, god, not that again," she says. "I've already told you, I'm not wearing that one to bed. It's my only suit, and I have to keep it in good condition." Her voice softens to that seductive purr. "I don't think it could take all the stuff we do in bed."

You laugh nervously, not exactly sure what to say. You only just now remembered you were dating. Still, she keeps the conversation going.

"What's for breakfast? I'm starving. You definitely gave me a workout last night."

"Just a sec," you say, rushing into the kitchen.

You're not exactly sure what you're supposed to do. This feels so weird right now, and still not sure how you got here. You try to see if more memories can come back to you, but that's failing. You can only remember the basics. Her secret identity is Karen Star (good information, you suppose for when you two go on dates out and about town in front of citizens), she's Superman's cousin, so she basically has all of his powers, she can be a bit of a cold hard-ass sometimes. But, this is all information any idiot with an interest in comic books could get. You're not getting any information that can tell you more about your relationship with her.

Well, one memory does come back, and you start to realize that memories only come back to you when they're relevant to the situation. You remember what sorts of things she likes to eat, and your mind starts to spin as you realize what an appetite she's got. Though, you're still not sure how she went from a rail-thin, busty superhero to this.

You shrug and start to get to work in the kitchen. Funny, you never were much of a cook back in your old life. Hell, you had a gift for burning water. But, who knows, maybe your relationship with this enormous girl gave you more experience. You whip up an incredible breakfast in a pretty short time: a stack of buttery pancakes drenched in syrup, eggs over-easy, extra crispy bacon, thick, juicy sausages, toast, buttered on both sides with plenty of jelly and jam, and diced potatoes with extra ketchup.

You bring out the meal just as you see her settled down on the couch, tapping away at the computer. "Whatcha doing?" you ask casually.

She grunts, but then eventually replies, "Just answering a few emails. This is probably the best part of getting to work from home: I can work when I want, wearing whatever I want. I'll just be a few minutes."

"Um, yeah, well, I'm just going to pop into the shower while you do that."

You set the food down, and leave her to her work while you sneak off to the bathroom. This is insane, you keep telling yourself, or am I the one who's insane?

You splash some water on your face and look at yourself in the mirror.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Enter Power Girl

choices: and it is. You continue to try building your relationship with Power Girl.
but it isn't. Power Girl hears danger far away.
but it isn't. You're still not sure what you're doing here.
and it is. You try to help Power Girl plan for the new arrivals.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Luckily, you’re still the same old you. You are a relatively tall, though by no means gigantic, man with average features, nothing to write home about. You were almost expecting to have been transformed into some red-eyed superhero yourself after the way this day’s been going. No, you’re still just plain old you, which is a good thing, all things considered. You look carefully at the slight five o’clock shadow on your chin. It’s been a day or so since you’ve shaved, you figure.

After cleaning up, you decide to return out into the living room. It doesn’t look like you’re going to be getting any answers anytime soon about what’s going on. So, it’s probably best if you just play along for now. Maybe some more false memories will come back to you.

You look out into the living room and still see Power Girl…er, Karen, you must keep reminding yourself, still sitting on the couch working. To her, nothing is out of place about this scenario. In her mind, you’ve been dating for several months now. You cautiously approach.

“So, what were you thinking of doing today?” you ask casually.

She looks at you curiously as if you're a complete idiot. "Same as always," she says with a shrug, "just stay here and hang out. You know I don't really like going out, not when I have to do that every day fighting crime."

You laugh nervously. "Oh, yeah, forgot. Probably just want to unwind and all after all that." In your mind, you have a hard time imagining someone her size still being able to fly around beating up bad guys, and unfortunately, you don't really have all that much of a filter. "So, you're still into the superheroing thing?"

"Are you sick or something?" she asks. "What do you mean you forgot? You've always known...oh, I get what this is about." She purses her lips and then tersely responds, "Look, we've been over this. I told you, I'd be working practically up to my due date. Everything's fine. I'm Kryptonian for god's sake. The babies will be fine."

You nod your head, not realizing what she just said. So, she didn't catch on that you really had no clue where you were or what was going on. But then, your mind throws on the brakes. "Babies?" you sputter.

She gives you another look. Karen was never one for beating around the bush or playing stupid games like this. But, she still hasn't caught on. "I thought I told you yesterday after I had my appointment that they found out I'm having twins."

You start to feel light-headed. This is all moving so quickly. Not only are you dating Power Girl; she's having your children! "Um, wait..." you start to say, trying to process it all.

She rolls her eyes, hefts herself up from the couch, and goes to kiss you on the cheek. "You really are a moron sometimes," she says, "but I guess you're my moron. You really don't have to be so worried about this. I mean, yeah, it's two kids instead of just the one like we planned, but I think we can make it work. We'll just have to maybe make a little more space in the nursery, get a few more things..."

"Yeah," you say, "yeah, I'm just...I guess this is starting to become real for me. You're sure you're going to be okay?"

She laughs. "Kryptonians are pretty durable, and plus, these kids are going to be half me. I think they can handle a little strain. Comes with the job."

She waddles back to the couch and sits down. "That was a great breakfast, by the way," she says, "but god, I'm stuffed! Course, I know that's what you like." She gives you a seductive glare. "It didn't take me long after I started dating you to figure out I was going to end up a pretty fat girlfriend."

So, you're the reason that she's this size! That realization hits you like a bag of rocks, but it triggers more of those false memories. You have a strong background in cooking and have always taken pleasure in knowing others like your cooking. It, therefore, came as no surprise that many of your previous girlfriends ended their relationships with you significantly heavier than when you had started dating them. Power Girl was no exception, but she stuck around with you the longest, mostly because she liked your personality.

"So..."

"So, what?" you ask stupidly.

"You gonna come over here and cuddle with your fat, fluffy girlfriend or what?" she asks.

You're suddenly aware that your body is naturally responding to her seductive behavior. It's like the part of you that does exist in this world is growing more attracted to her by the minute. You sidle up next to her on the couch, stroking her corpulent sides while she continues to work. You're both content like this. You converse over a few things. You try to get her to tell a little bit more about the past, without being too obvious about it. Everything seems perfect...
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Average Joe, Average Life

choices: Read a few comic book paperbacks to pass the time.
You turn on the TV, which showed the news coverage of the Kaiju attack.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
However, unfortunately for you, just as things between you and the enlarged Power Girl were about to become more intimately romantic, Karen abruptly ceased with her work, as she swiftly turned her head to the left, her ears subtly perked up.

Of course, you soon realized that she was undoubtedly hearing someone or something with her Super Hearing, which meant only one certainty:

Something big was happening...or It was about to happen.

"...What's wrong?" You asked, clearly displaying a tone of concern in your voice in response.

Of course, you inevitably were about to find out exactly what she was hearing, as both you and Karen then suddenly heard this unnatural yet animalistic sound:

"KSS-KSSS! KSS-KSSS!! SSSSKKRREEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!"

A few brief moments later, Karen hurriedly closed her laptop, where she then swiftly rose from her seating position on the couch via Kryptonian Flight. From there, she quickly hovered toward the overweight mannequin that held her iconic costume, as she quickly stripped the costume from the mannequin's possession.

Obviously, you were still a tad bit shaken up by that beastly shriek from earlier, as you quickly rose up from the couch.

"Karen... What the hell was that!?!" You exclaimed, obviously a little unnerved by whatever made that shriek in the first place, as you saw Karen put each bulbous leg through the legholes of her Power Girl costume.

"That...was a Kaiju, (Name). And judging from all that hissing, it's gotta be that same snake Kaiju Alan Scott and Jay Garrick had warned me about over a week ago." Karen explained, as she managed to pull the remainder of her costume past her round bulbous belly and over her massive mammaries.

Of course, besides the obvious references to Green Lantern Alan Scott, as well as the original Flash, Jay Garrick, two of the founding members of the Justice Society of America, you soon realize what Karen meant by "Kaiju". After all, while you were very much into comic books such as DC Comics and Marvel Comics, you have a cousin who was a huge fan of Kaiju movies. Plus, thanks to said cousin, you knew what the word "Kaiju" meant:

GIANT. MONSTER.

And yet, both you and Power Girl were currently living in a city that was basically a massive hotspot for giant monster attacks!

But as Karen was fully finished with putting on her white leotard and began to strap on her equally large blue gloves and boots, you spoke toward her with a hint of nervousness in your voice as you queried, "Kaiju? As in giant monsters who come ashore and wreck cities like they're made of building blocks? Those same creatures that can easily crush someone like me as if I was an ant underneath their feet?!"

"...Yeah, pretty much. That's why my cousin, his JLA buddies, and my friends in the JSA had us move out here to Tokyo in the first place. *sigh* And here I was hoping we could go a whole week without some giant monster attacking Tokyo." Karen bluntly retorted, huffing out a frustrated sigh in response to the Kaiju rudely interrupting her downtime with you.

However, what Power Girl said did make a bit of sense. And yet, it seemed to have raised a few more questions in your mind, including why there were Kaiju in the first place. After all, the DC Universe didn't exactly had any legitimate giant monsters of its own that you could remember. Although, despite you felt a little bit relieved that Power Girl was here to stop the monster, another feeling began to well up inside you:

Parental Concern.

After all, Power Girl was currently pregnant with Half-Human, Half-Kryptonian twins, which gave you some valid reasons to be greatly concerned for both Karen's and your unborn kids' well-being.

"But...what about you? Are the kids going to be okay if you fight that creature?" You instinctively asked, obviously becoming concerned for the aforementioned well-being of both Power Girl and the unborn twins.

Of course, upon fully suiting up as Power Girl, Karen was fully aware of your concerns. So, in response to such worries from you, Karen casually approached you, her wide burgeoning hips sashaying from left to right as she slightly lumbered toward you. From there, as her soft bulbous belly pressed against your lower torso, Karen placed her gloved hands upon your shoulders in reassurance.

"...Look, I get it. You're concerned about me and the kids, and that I should be on maternity leave from being a superhero. But like I said before, sweetie: They're Half-Kryptonian, meaning they can take a beating." Karen answered, not beating around the bush whatsoever when it came to her current disposition.

But suddenly, Power Girl...er, Karen, then administered a passionate but caring kiss upon your lips, obviously in an attempt to let you know that there wasn't a thing to worry about for the time being. However, such a passionate and tender moment between the two of you had to come to an abrupt end, as you both heard the sounds of the Kaiju coming a little bit closer.

In response to the situation, Karen soon ended the kiss, much to her reluctance to do so, as she then quickly hovered toward the doors leading out onto the balcony.

Instinctively, you quickly spoke toward Karen and said, "Karen! Just...promise me you'll be careful when you're fighting that...thing."

Karen looked back at you with a warm reassured smile upon her plump cherubic face, nodding to promise you on that offer. After all, even though you've just woken up to such a drastic change in your life, you still had these established feelings for Power Girl.

"...Thank you, (Name). Now...if you'll excuse me, this looks like a job for Power Girl!!" She retorted where she then swiftly flew off toward the Kaiju at breakneck speeds, going from zero to Mach 5 in a matter of milliseconds.

But still, somehow in the back of your mind alongside these established false memories, you were never going to get tired of seeing Power Girl rush off faster than a speeding bullet to save the day like she always has in the comics. And yet, you couldn't shake off that gnawing feeling of worry when it came to Power Girl, especially in her current state. So, in a possible attempt to shrug off those feelings, you went back towards the couch and...
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: A Beast of Gigantic Proportions

choices: Things get worse. This fight's about to get ugly.
Things get worse. This fight's about to get messy.
Things get better. Power Girl whoops up on the beast.
Things get better. Power Girl comes up with a new plan.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
The truth is you can never stop worrying about her, so you go turn on the TV to watch the fight for yourself. She's told you a million times not to watch her fight the bad guys because all you'll do is worry and cringe every time she takes a hit, but that hasn't stopped you before. You need to watch just to see to it that she's safe. Plus, in all honesty, you're kind of curious. You've seen her take down plenty of supervillains and baddies, but a giant monster is a horse of another color indeed.

And indeed, this creature is something the likes of which you've never seen before. It certainly lives up to its name of Kaiju, as it practically towers out of the shot the news crew is shooting from a safe distance. It's a colossal king cobra-looking creature with five heads. It's red/gold scales look like some tough armor to crack, and parts of its hood glow a sickly, pulsating green color. It hisses and roars as it causes destruction. At the moment, it's spewing green venom, which melts the nearby buildings like acid.

Ouroboros, the news anchor calls it. Even if this is all happening in Japan, it's certainly a big enough event that it's attracted the attention of the rest of the world, meaning you could find an English channel to tune into.

Out of the corner of the shot, you can just see Power Girl flying onto the scene, and the cameras direct their attention over there. She starts to assess the situation, planning her next move. The news anchors chuckle a bit and make some remarks about her size, noting that she's even bigger than the last time she helped solve a crisis. You let it slide since you know this is just them trying to cope with a very dangerous situation.

The creature doesn't give her a chance to think and just lunges for her with all five heads ready to strike. Despite her size, that hasn't really affected how nimble she can be when flying. She zigzags through the striking heads and hovers just high enough out of its reach. She then dives for its middle, hoping to land a sure strike. She does, and her fist makes contact with the serpent's back, but those scales are hard, even for Kryptonian strength.

Ouroboros whips its head around and goes in to strike again. She just barely misses being hit by those fangs. You cringe just a little clutching onto one of the couch pillows for dear life. You can see it in her eyes that this isn't a challenge she was expecting.

She decides to take a chance and strike for the heads, preferably the main one. If she can injure it, or at least poke its eye out, maybe she'll have better chances. She flies straight for its eye, but it whips its tail around and knocks her away like a pesky fly. You wince, but she seems to be okay as she recovers her hovering balance.

Of course, she hasn't done enough yet to get its attention on her. It goes back to spewing acidic venom. Technically, she could probably withstand an attack from this stuff, but she's not willing to take her chances until she knows more about this creature's abilities. She and you are both on the same wavelength of thought. Maybe those outer scales are tough, but the softer under scales of its belly might be a weak point. Her eyes alight and she shoots a beam of heat at the serpent's belly. It doesn't look like it's doing much, but it is enough to get Ouroboros' attention. It roars and goes straight for Power Girl!

You hold your breath and watch. This is kind of what she was hoping to accomplish, but it isn't going as well as hoped. As she tries to lead it to a more advantageous spot, it's body slithers and knocks about buildings at will, creating more of a mess. You hope she knows what she is doing.

Unable to allow anymore destruction to happen, she comes to a stop and tries to fight the beast once more. It's formidable and fast, just as fast as she is. That's the problem. She can't land a good strike in time because it reacts to her just as quickly as she can react to it.

She begins to take a big breath and you know what this is: her super breath. She lets out a gust of freezing air. Ouroboros goes to block it with its tail, but hisses in pain as the frozen wind freezes its tail. Like her, you now realize that the creature is weak against the cold. Now she's got an advantage! You let out a cheer, even though there's no one around to hear it.

But, it isn't done yet. The creature has been holding back it's best attack yet. It's eyes open wide, and Power Girl freezes in her tracks. At first, you don't know what's going on. You start to panic when she doesn't get out of the way, but then you realize she's powerless to do so. Ouroboros is somehow hypnotizing her to stay still. Its hood starts to fully open, the green pulsating sections glowing even brighter. With a cry a nuclear energy spills from the hood, washing over Power Girl!
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Live, from Downtown Tokyo

choices: Power Girl had returned from the battle with Ouroboros, and boy she's tired!
Power Girl had returned from the battle with Ouroboros, and boy she's hungry!
Fast forward two weeks later, Power Girl was at Starrware Labs as Karen Starr.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Taking the full force of Ouroboros' Nuclear Wave attack, you watched as Power Girl was then knocked back by a surprise attack from the massive five-headed serpent, as Ouroboros swung it's massive tail at Power Girl like a giant, scaly club!

Of course, you cringed a little as you watched as Power Girl was sent flying through several skyscrapers in the process, all whilst the news helicopter still kept it's gaze on Power Girl. Although you weren't exactly sure if Power Girl could hear you at the moment, you thouhhht aloud as you said, "Come on, PG! Think! This overgrown snake has a weakness to cold. You gotta slow it down with your Freeze Breath or something!"

Fortunately for you, Power Girl slowly but surely arose from the rubble and debris that feebly encased her rotund form. Of course, as the helicopter's camera zoomed in on Power Girl, you could clearly see from her facial expression that she was undoubtedly using her brain, to concoct some semblance of a Plan B against the enormous multi-headed serpent.

Fortunately, she soon came to the same conclusion as you: She needed to use cold-based attacks on Ouroboros! And fortunately for her, there was a Tanker truck full of Liquid Nitrogen, which was most likely being transported to Karen Starr's personal company, Starrware Labs, judging from the logo on the side of the Tanker truck trailer.

From there, Power Girl swiftly approached the Tanker truck, and using her Kryptonian strength, she effortlessly tore the Tanker trailer from the truck, where she quickly spoke toward the driver in Japanese as she said, "Mõshiwakearimasenga, watashi wa kore ijõ anata ga hitsuyõdesu! <Sorry, but I need this more than you!>"

Obviously, you could somewhat tell a little that her Japanese was a bit rusty, just as you saw Power Girl quickly flew off toward Ouroboros, still carrying the Tanker trailer full of Liquid Nitrogen, doing her best to avoid being spotted by Ouroboros, especially with how fast the massive creature's reaction time was, despite it's ludicrously sheer size, as Power Girl swiftly flew from building to building, using the skyscrapers as cover. After all, Power Girl now realized that in order to defeat this Kaiju, she had to play it smart instead of her usual plan of rushing in and beating it up with her Kryptonian strength and other abilities.

Of course, still angry towards the corpulent superheroine for attacking it, you watched as Ouroboros relentlessly searched for Power Girl, sniffing the air with it's reptilian nostrils, attempting to detect any changes in the wind.

But then, just as Ouroboros cautiously slithered around one of the skyscrapers, Power Girl then launched her surprise attack, where she quickly flew behind the massive five-headed serpent, throwing the Tanker trailer towards the back of the serpent's main head. Unfortunately for Ouroboros, it was too late to react towards Power Girl's ambush in time, just as Power Girl unleashed a powerful beam of heat from her eyes, aiming it straight at the Tanker trailer.

In turn, this caused the Tanker trailer to explode on impact with Power Girl's Heat Vision, causing Liquid Nitrogen to shower all over Ouroboros' primary head!

"SSKKRREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!! SKREEEEEEEEE!!!!

It shrieked in pain, as Ouroboros felt the stinging cold from the Liquid Nitrogen blasted all over it's serpentine head. It violently thrashed around in agony from the searing cold, causing it's movements to become more sluggish and disoriented in the process, as you saw that Power Girl's sneak attack was very effective. You sprang up from the couch and cheered with glee as you exclaimed, "WHOOOO!!! Go get it, Power Girl!!!"

From there, seeing how it couldn't retaliate much due to being inflicted with negative 364 degrees Fahrenheit of Liquid Nitrogen, Power Girl then took this opportunity to lay a Kryptonian beatdown on Ouroboros, as she swiftly went from zero to Mach 5 in mere milliseconds, flying towards Ouroboros at obliterating speeds until...

CRAAACK!!!

Power Girl unleashed an immensely powerful Haymarket upon Ouroboros' primary head, causing the massive serpent's jaw to break and fracture upon impact! However, it wasn't just it's head that got busted up, as Power Girl then swiftly delivered several left and right hook attacks upon Ouroboros' head, cracking the creature's head, causing it an enormous amount of head trauma, as the durable scales that protected Ouroboros were now rendered as fragile as glass from the Liquid Nitrogen inflicted upon it!

In it's current state, Ouroboros couldn't fight anymore, as it's four secondary heads simultaneously shut down when the primary head was severely damaged! From there, Ouroboros began to slouch over and collapse toward a nearby skyscraper, which unfortunately still had civilians inside it evacuating. Upon seeing this, Power Girl swiftly flew underneath the collapsed Kaiju, using a combination of her Kryptonian Strength and Flight to attempt to slow it's descent to avoid racking up casualties.

Obviously, she seemed to be struggling a little, as Power Girl then diverted the trajectory of Ouroboros' descent, making it land upon the large stretch of Freeway with an audible "THOOM!!!" in the process.

From there, once she laid the massive serpent upon the wide road, Power Girl hovered upwards until she was twenty feet above the enormous creature. She stared longingly at it's lifeless form. Of course, you could surmise that she was using her X-Ray Vision to determine if Ouroboros was still alive or not. Moments later, she displayed a reassured smile upon her plump cherubic face, placing her plump gloved hands upon her burgeoning hips with a sense of pride and accomplishmnent.

However, before she was about to fly off (most likely back to your spacious apartment), Power Girl momentarily stopped upon hearing the applause and cheers from the numerous civilians who witnessed Power Girl's victory over the Kaiju.

Obviously, you could see that Power Girl appreciated their rounds of applause, as bowed forward some in respect to them whilst she was hovering.

"Arigatõ. Anata wa totemo yūkandatta. Sewa o suru! <Thanks. You were all very brave. Take care!>" She said to them in Japanese, briefly waving at them with a plump gloved hand before swiftly flying off into the sky and out of the sights of the news helicopters. And with that, the news reporter then looked back at her camerajan in the helicopter with her as she said, "Sate, anata wa sore o motte imasu, josei to shinshi. Pawāgāru no okage de mõhitotsu no kiki wa yoke raremashita! Watashi wa Sakai Hiromidesu. Anata wa TBN o mite imasu. Sutekina tsuitachi o! <Well, there you have it, ladies and gentlemen. Another crisis averted thanks to Power Girl! I'm Hiromi Sakai, and you're watching TBN. Have a wonderful day!>"

Feeling relieved to see that Power Girl was victorious, you exhaled a sigh of relief, where you then turned off the TV, as...
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: A Chilly Idea! Ouroboros' Weakness!

choices: in another 6 months. Still some time to go.
in another 5 months. Almost halfway there.
In another 4 months. Better start getting preparations done soon.
In another 3 months. You didn't realize she was that far along.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Technically, the Starrware Labs you were familiar with was actually based in New York, but since your girlfriend's move to Japan, she opened up another branch in the middle of Tokyo. And, in all fairness, this was actually a great decision on her part. Karen, business savvy as always picked an excellent location to continue her progressive work in technology. Still, it kept her pretty busy, and when she wasn't off superheroing, she was here.

So, after two weeks since you woke up in this reality, you had adjusted well and got used to her routine. Today, you decided to surprise her by coming to her office with lunch. Actually, you really should have rethought this. Karen's enormous appetite meant that you bit off a little more than you could chew when it came to transporting everything over to the office. You had to make several trips back to your car just to get it all up there. So, exhausted after all the trouble to do it, Karen has already eaten about half of what you brought before you're able to actually sit down and enjoy it with her.

"This was so sweet of you," she says, digging into her third course. "But, I probably should have told you the elevator was out of order before you came down here."

"It's okay," you say, sweat dripping off your forehead. "It was worth it. So, how's your day going?"

"Fine, mostly just administrative stuff. I can't seem to go a day without someone emailing me about a crisis that really only takes a few minutes to solve. But, I guess it makes me look like I'm doing something useful. What about you? I worry that you're getting bored being here with nothing to do but be a house-husband."

You laugh, now having a bit more knowledge about your "past" in this reality. You know you're not actually married to Power Girl...not yet anyway. But, it is something you've been thinking about.

"Yeah, I mean, it was tough giving up my job back in the states, but it's not like that was going to be able to compare with your job here."

She shrugs. "Still, I worry that you feel like you need something to do."

You chuckle. "So, is that a job offer?"

"Well, I don't know about here. You're not really the techie type. I was thinking, you've always wanted to open your own restaurant...maybe you could do that here! I mean, we've got the funds to do that. You just need to find a good location. Plus, it'd be way more fulfilling than what you did back in America."

"Maybe...we'll see. I don't know if I'm ready to commit to all that just yet. I mean, we are having kids here soon. We're going to have to plan for how to handle all that. I don't exactly envision you as the 'stay-at-home' mom type."

"Okay, true. We'll need to work all that out, but I really think it isn't impossible for you to still be able to do something you like. Wow, that was amazing. Thanks for lunch."

Having finally finished everything you brought, Karen is looking even bigger than when she started. Ever since you started dating her, she wasn't one to turn down a meal you made, and perhaps that's what encouraged you to keep making more and more each time. Right now, you're enjoying a good view of her stuffed gut as all of that food settles for her. Chances are, she's going to have to have some new clothes tailored soon. That poor blouse doesn't look like it's going to stand much of a chance any longer.

Unfortunately, Karen's weight is a little bit more of an inconvenience when she's out in her civilian identity. It's kind of hard to go around floating to avoid waddling without having some explaining to do. Thankfully, she works for a tech company, so technology to suit her needs has always been at the forefront of her research. For a while now (roughly after her weight got past 450), she's had an office chair that serves as a scooter for getting around the office. Of course, as she continues to get bigger, she's going to have to find more solutions to other problems, but for now, she's got everything covered.

"So, anyway, I do have a doctor's appointment today," she says. "Would you be able to come too? They'll be able to judge my due date finally, and I think my doctor said something about being able to determine the genders at this point."

"Wouldn't miss it for the world," you say.

So, it is that later that day, you had gone with her, excited to learn more about your future offspring. Much like any parent, you're nervous and curious at the same time. However, in this case, you're even more curious since you really don't know all that much about half-Kryptonian births. To be quite frank...you're pretty sure that hasn't happened before, not unless Superman finally decided to start a family.

Right now, you and Karen are waiting for the doctor to come back after she had just finished the initial blood test. You're pretty sure Karen is slightly hovering over the table where she's supposed to be sitting, probably to avoid accidentally crushing it.

The doctor returns. "Well, let's start with the most important news," she says. "It looks like you're right on schedule. You'll be due..."
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Hard at Work

choices: "Both Female."
"Both Male."
"Actually, one fetus is Male, while the other is Fem akke."
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
The doctor returns. "Well, let's start with the most important news," she says. "It looks like you're right on schedule, Ms. Starr. According to your ultrasound, you'll be due in approximately...4 months from now."

Four months?! ...Well, I guess that did explain a lot regarding Karen's increased appetite as of late, despite her established rotund physique. After all, she is currently in the middle of her second trimester.

Obviously, Karen had to not wear her Power Girl costume underneath her business ensemble due to the fact that she had to take an ultrasound test, as you then spoke toward the female doctor and asked, "...Are they any complications?"

"...None that I can think if, Mr. (Name). Aside from their mother's, um..."Rubenesque" physique, the fetuses are surprisingly healthy." The female doctor answered, taking note of Karen's substantially larger form. Obviously, Karen deliberately bumped you with her plump elbow as she retorted, "See? I told you the kids would be fine, (Name)!"

"Okay, okay! You're right, I shouldn't have been so worried." You replied, rubbing the side where Karen lightly jabbed you with her elbow. Fortunately, it wasn't a powerful jab either, just as Karen chuckled a little, which seemed to lighten things up between the two of you, even though you and Karen have a very stable romantic relationship.

In all honesty, you were honestly looking forward a little to having Half-Human, Half-Kryptonian twins. Sure, it might become quite hectic, especially if they inherit the powers of their mother, such as Heat Vision, X-Ray Vision, Flight, Super Strength, etc. Overall, things were looking rather bright in your future with the obese Power Girl...even if you didn't exactly predict this outcome.

From there, out of curiosity, Karen then spoke toward the female doctor once more while she lightly drummed the side of her bulbous, pudgy, yet pregnant belly and queried, "Doctor Uzumaki, since I'm currently in my second trimester... Were you able to tell us what their genders are?"

Momentarily, the female doctor, Doctor Uzumaki, began to pull out photo copies of the results from Karen's ultrasound, where she then spoke toward both you and Karen as she explained, "...Well, normally we don't tell those who are pregnant what the baby's gender is until the beginning of the third trimester. However, I can make an exception."

From there, Doctor Uzumaki began to flip through the pages until she reached the ultrasound photo of the unborn twins, where she then looked back at both you and Karen as she answered, "...Alright, according to the results from the ultrasound, it appears that the twin fetuses are..."
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Four Months To Go

choices: "Heading to Chiyoda Ward. I heard the Cherry Blossoms are beautiful this year."
"Heading to Harajuku. There's a new Plus-Size store open down there."
"Heading over to the Ebisu Ward. I'm hankering for some sushi."
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
From there, Doctor Uzumaki began to flip through the pages until she reached the ultrasound photo of the unborn twins, where she then looked back at both you and Karen as she answered, "...Alright, according to the results from the ultrasound, it appears that the twin fetuses are...both female. Congratulations! You'll be giving birth to two lovely daughters!"

Well... That was certainly unexpected. After all, you were initially assuming that one twin would be a boy, while the other twin would be a girl. Suffice to say, you felt gratefully relieved to hear that the unborn twins were perfectly healthy, as you saw casually dismount herself from the examination table she was sitting on. After all, even though she had packed on a lot of weight since she started dating you, her Kryptonian strength were still as strong as ever, which made things a little easier when moving around at her current size.

"Thank you so much, Doctor Uzumaki. We appreciate what you're doing for me and (Name) here." Karen confessed, as she then put her fashionable glasses back on her cherubic face, which disguised her from anyone discovering that both Karen Starr and Power Girl were one and the same.

From there, despite her well-established girth and bulk, Karen gave a respectful bow towards the female doctor before returning her posture back into an upright position. Of course, Doctor Uzumaki did the same to Karen, as the female Obstetrician (A doctor with special training in how to care for pregnant women and help in the birth of babies) then proceeded to shake Karen's hand, where the female doctor then retorted, "Not a problem, Ms. Starr. I'm just merely doing my job."
