However, just as both you and Karen were about to exit the Examination Room, Doctor Uzumaki then spoke toward both of you once more and said, "Though, there is one more thing I want to ask you, Ms. Starr."

"...Of course, doctor! What is it that you want to ask?" Karen bluntly retorted, trying to still be polite as ever, despite such an unexpected retort. From there, Doctor Uzumaki then began to go through the results from the ultrasound, while she spoke toward both you and Karen as she queried, "This might sound odd, but...While I was examining the blood sample taken from you, I noticed something...strange, regarding the twin fetuses. Apparently, your unborn twins appear to be Half-Kryptonian."

Upon hearing that, you noticed that Karen looked like she froze in place, as if her biggest secret just got revealed to the entire world. Obviously, Doctor Uzumaki easily noticed Karen's disposition, looking at the rotund woman out of concern as she asked, "Ms. Starr? Ms. Starr?! Are you...feeling alright? You look like you've seen a ghost."

"Oh, that? Um...You see, I uh...happen to be a surrogate mother for Power Girl's children. Yeah, that's right! I became a surrogate mother for her kids. That's why the twins are Half-Kryptonian." Karen hastily confessed, trying to come up with a convincing enough lie for why she's bearing Half-Human, Half-Kryptonian twins. Although, you had to admit, even you were a little nervous yourself regarding this debacle.

Fortunately for the two of you, Doctor Uzumaki seemed to have been convinced by such a blatant lie, as the female Obstetrician then spoke with a hint of surprise in her voice as she replied, "Really?! I honestly didn't know that Power Girl wanted to have children of her own."

"*nervous chuckle* Yeah, you can say that again, doctor. She wanted to keep it on the down low to avoid any supervillains from trying to take her kids when they're born. Just...promise you'll keep quiet about this." You answered, mildly scratching the back of your head out of slight nervousness. Of course, Doctor Uzumaki eventually spoke back and said, "Hmmm....Well, normally I would have to document this information regarding Ms. Starr's surrogacy, Mr. (Name). However, since this IS a superhero's children we are discussing about here... I'll make an exception for this, even though this might cost me my job as an Obstetrician."

"Thank you, Doctor Uzumaki. It means a lot for you to keep quiet about this." Karen answered, just as the female doctor then quipped, "Don't thank me, Ms. Starr. Thank patient confidentiality."

And with that, both you and Karen parted ways with Doctor Uzumaki, as the two of you exited the examination room, casually proceeding out of the hospital and out onto the bustling streets of Tokyo.

From there, once you and Karen were finally out of the hospital building, both you and Karen simultaneously exhaled a sigh of relief, just as Karen then spoke toward you and said, "*relieved sigh* Damn, that was close."

"Yeah, a bit too close for comfort. She almost found out who you really were, Karen." You retorted, where both you and Karen then began to leisurely walk down the wide sidewalk, keeping with the pedestrian traffic. But while the two continued walking, Karen exhaled a deep sigh and replied, "*sigh* I know, sweetie. But still, I think it was worth the risk. I mean, I don't want to waste my time flying all the way back to the States, just to find out if we'll be having a boy and a girl or vice-versa. At least we now know we're going to be having twin daughters. Sure, it wasn't exactly like what we had initially planned, but we can change that."

"I know, Karen." You said, as you voluntarily grabbed Karen's plump left hand with your right hand, which Karen was definitely enjoying.

"...But still, I'm glad nothing seriously bad had happened while Power Girl was fighting against Ouroboros." You remarked, subtly referencing Karen as Power Girl in third person as you briefly winked at your rotund girlfriend, which Karen easily picked up on since you were talking about her. After all, you were both out in public, so you simply couldn't blatantly say that Power Girl and Karen are the same individual.

So, in response, as she gently rubbed up and down her blouse-covered gut with a plump right hand, Karen calmly spoke toward you with a warm reassured smile upon her plump cherubic face as she replied, "I know what you mean by that, sweetie. Thankfully, Starrware Labs and Starrware Industries are assisting the Japanese government in rebuilding the more damaged areas of the city from the battle."

But as you both stopped and waited to safely pass through the intersection, you then spoke toward Karen and asked, "So...Now that we're done at the doctor's office, what do you want to do next, Karen? After all, it's a lovely day. Might as well get some things done while we're out here."

Although, despite not being that much of a social person on her own, Karen seemed to be optimistic about these whilke you were near. So, after much debating with herself on the matter at hand, Karen eventually spoke toward you and answered, "...Now that I think about it, (Name), I was thinking about..."
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Female Half-Kryptonian Twins

choices: However, you then bluntly stated that Karen was pregnant with twins.
Eventually, the chubby female clerk was done taking Karen's measurements.
But then, something unexpected hapooened...
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
So, after much debating with herself on the matter at hand, Karen eventually spoke toward you and answered, "...Now that I think about it, (Name), I was thinking about heading to Harajuku. Apparently, they just opened up a brand new Plus-Size store over at LaForet Harajuku, and I want to see what they have over there."

"I don't mind that at all, Karen." You flirtatiously retorted, planting a tender kiss upon Karen's plump left cheek, which made her blush a little in the process. After all, she doesn't exactly mind you cuddling up to her when you're both at home in the apartment building looking over the Shibuya Ward, but out in public on the other hand...She can be a little hesitant. Fortunately, she's got you to handle herself in these social situations.

Eventually, after progressing through the elongated and intertwining streets and pathways of Tokyo, you and Karen had finally reached LaForet Harajuku. In appearance, LaForet Harajuku was a massive trend setting shopping complex, which consisted of seven floors of fashion boutiques and shops, mainly catered towards a young, female audience. From what you could remember from these "False" memories of yours, this was considered one of Karen's favorite places to shop, especially with the numerous yet various clothing boutiques available in the 7 Story building.

Although she now weighed in at a little over five hundred pounds, Karen still retained a surprisingly healthy physique underneath all that extra blubber she now carried, most likely due to her Kryptonian physiology. Overall, she definitely didn't seemed tired at the slightest, as she casually waddled her way down the stretch of hallway without breaking a sweat, her wide burgeoning hips sashaying from left to right as she trekked down the hall.

Eventually, after wandering through several floors of the shopping complex, you and Karen inevitably found the aforementioned "Plus-Size " Women's Store, dubbed "Biggubondeddoredīsu <Big-Boned Ladies>" in big, puffy, and bloated pink Kanto writing. Of course, it was most undoubtedly a Plus-Size Women's Store, as you noticed some equally rotund Japanese women going through various articles of clothing and trying them on, seeing how they fit their rubenesque yet tubby forms. Obviously, they weren't as big as Karen, especially since she happened to stand at 5 feet 11 inches, which was considerably tall compared to the average Japanese woman in Tokyo.

"Well, this is the place! Let's see what they've got here." Karen bluntly quipped, as she casually waddled her way inside the spacious yet packed department store. But as she stepped inside the store, Karen was then greeted by one of the shop clerks, who was a fairly plump teenage girl, who had her hair tied up into a bun.

You followed Karen inside, just as the clerk spoke to her with an enthusiastic tone, speaking in Japanese as she quipped, "Kon'nichiwa misu! Watashi wa dõsureba anata o tasukete kureru no? <Hello, Miss! How may I help you?>"

Of course, you could tell a little that Karen had initially wished that the clerk would speak English, but to each her own, she supposes. So, shortly after exhaling a mildly frustrated sigh, Karen then spoke toward the chubby female clerk, speaking in Japanese as she answered, "*sigh* Hai, watashi wa ikutsu ka no atarashī bijinesu-fuku dakedenaku, kajuaru-fuku no ikutsu ka no setto o sagashiteimasu. Watashi wa osoraku anata ga miru koto ga dekiru yõ ni, õki-sa matawa 2tsu agatte iru kamo shiremasen. <Yes, I'm looking for some new business clothes, as well as a few sets of casual clothes too. I may have gone up a size or two, as you can probably see.>"

Upon seeing the plump woman thoroughly looking at Karen's substantially larger form, you could easily tell that the chubby female clerk had never assisted a woman of Karen's size and stature before until now, as the plump woman disguised her shock with a cheery smile, where she then spoke toward Karen and replied, "Mochiron! Kono yõ ni shite kudasai. <Of course! Right this way, please.>"

And with that, Karen was gestured to follow the female clerk deeper into the fashion boutique, as you slowly followed behind them, just to see if Karen was feeling emotionally okay. Much to your surprise, Karen was certainly holding her own a little, as she felt the plump female clerk taking numerous measurements of her with a measuring tape, much to Karen's personal feelings of embarrassment, especially since she's more accustomed to having you be the one to get this close to her.

"Watashi wa mitomenakereba narimasen, misu: Anata wa tashika ni koko shusseki shite iru hotondo no josei yori mo rūben-tekidesu. Watashi wa kore o homekotoba to shite itte imasu. <I have to admit, Miss: You're certainly more rubenesque than most women that attend here. And I am saying that as a compliment.>" The female clerk confessed, as if she was impressed by Karen's substantially larger physique, just as the woman then began to measure the circumference of Karen's thick bulbous thighs, much to Karen's reluctance.

"Ē to, arigatõ. <Um, thanks... I guess.>" Karen flatly retorted, currently not in a bit of a talkative mood due to feeling like she's being poked and prodded like a guinea pig with the chubby clerk constantly taking her physical measurements. Of course, you stood there before her, leaning against the wall, your arms crossed and bearing a smug yet reassuring grin upon your slender face.

Obviously, upon seeing you, Karen began to relax a bit more as you said, "Well, at least you don't have to strip down in public, honey." Of course, your response undoubtedly made her blush a little, but in a good way, just as the female clerk then spoke toward you and Karen as she asked, "Itte yaru ga ī. Demo, shinkon no fūfu wa futari imasu ka? <Say, I don't mean to pry, but are you two a newlywed couple by any chance?>"

Obviously, in response to such a blunt question, both you and Karen simultaneously answered, "īe, watashitachiha kekkon shite imasen! <No, we're not married!>"

"... Sukunakutomo, mada. <...At least, not yet.>" You swiftly answered, which earned you Karen's signature "Watch it, buddy!" expression upon her plump cherubic face, which quickly faded away, since she couldn't stay mad at you for long.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: A Harajuku Shopping Trip

choices: But then, Karen suddenly got a call from her cousin, Superman.
But then, Karen suddenly received a call from the Justice Society of America.
But then, a news broadcast popped up, showing off another Kaiju attack!
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Eventually, after taking numerous measurements of her current customer, the chubby female clerk was finally done taking Karen's physical measurements, as the clerk then promptly stood up with a jovial mannerism in her movements, as she happily chirped, "Soko ni iku yo, misu! Subete kanryõ! <There we go, Miss! All done!>"

From there, the plump female clerk then began searching through the various aisles of the fashion boutique for clothes that matched Karen's exact measurements, thus leaving you and Karen alone to your own devices.

"...Well, she certainly seemed nice. And they say that chivalry is dead." You said, referencing how polite the tubby female clerk was, as Karen rebuttoned the buttons on her enlarged white work blouse, where she spoke toward you with a slight hint of a mildly annoyed tone in her voice as she bluntly remarked, "Yeah, a little too nice for my tastes, if you know what I mean, (Name)."

"Well, I hate to rub salt on the wound, Karen, but it was actually your idea to come here in the first place. After all, you DID want some clothes in a larger size, plus you weren't sure of what services they provide here." You sarcastically retorted, your arms still crossed whilst you still leaned against the wall, still looking at Karen in the process. Of course, Karen looked back at you, placing her plump hands upon her burgeoning hips as she replied, "Yes, I'm very much aware of that, sweetie. But still, it feels so relieving to find a place like this just a ways off from our apartment."

Eventually, after almost five minutes of waiting, the chubby female clerk swiftly returned to both you and Karen, now carrying an assortment of various plus-sized clothes in her plump arms, where she then spoke toward both you and Karen as she explained, "Okure ni taisuru watashi no shazai. Watashi wa korera no ishõ no ikutsu ka o anata no sokutei ni awa sete chõsei shinakereba narimasendeshita. <My apologies for the tardiness. I had to get some of these outfits tailor-made to fit with your measurements.>"

"Daijõbu. Anata wa shigoto o shite iru dakedesu. <That's okay. You're just doing your job.>" Karen replied, speaking in Japanese toward the chubby female clerk, reassuring her that it was alright to be a little late. From there, the female clerk then gestured Karen to follow her toward the Fitting Rooms, as you then followed closely behind Karen, easily noticing her burgeoning hips and voluminous butt sashay from left to right as she approached the Fitting Rooms. Suffice to say, you were undoubtedly enjoying the view of Karen's ample rear.

Once the three of you reached the Fitting Rooms, you decided to patiently wait outside the Fitting Rooms, while Karen and the chubby female clerk leisurely made their way inside one of the spacious Fitting Room stalls. From there, once they closed and locked the stall door, Karen began to calmly yet reluctantly strip herself down to her large red bra and panties. Hoping to ease some of the stress that Karen was enduring, the chubby female clerk then spoke toward her with a friendly tone as she said, "Watashi wa iu hitsuyõ ga arimasu, misu: Anata wa tashika ni watashitachi no kokyaku no hotondo yori mo segatakaidesu. Anata no himitsu wa nanidesu ka? <I must say, Miss: You are definitely taller than most of our customers. What's your secret?>"

"Ā! Ē to... Watashi wa on'nanokodatta toki, watashi wa õkibona seichõ o togeta to ierudeshou. <Oh! Um...You can say that I had a massive growth spurt when I was a girl.>" Karen flatly retorted, obviously not adjusted to having someone else besides you staring at her in only her lingerie, as she began to put on the first set of clothes given to her, which was this wonderful mahogany red business ensemble, complete with a white business blouse.

Moments later, she casually stepped out of the Fitting Room stall, where you stood back up and saw her wearing the business ensemble. Mentally, you felt like your jaw just dropped to the floor. Karen looked downright attractive! From there, upon seeing you standing there before her, Karen spoke out toward you and asked, "...Well? How, uh...How do I look, sweetie?"

"Oh Karen... You look absolutely beautiful!" You swiftly answered, which undoubtedly raised her spirits upon hearing your words of approval. In response, Karen pulled off a few sexy poses in front of you, as she spoke toward you and queried, "Really? Do you think so?"

"*chuckle* What can I say, Karen? The color red absolutely suits you, wether you're in a three-piece business suit or in lingerie!" You boldly answered, which made Karen feel rather bashful, much to her mild annoyance. Then again, you always did bring that out in her at times, which was one of the things she loved about you. Upon turning around to face a nearby full-body mirror, Karen could easily see how the three-piece red business suit fit comfortably around her rotund form, as well as accentuating her plush curves.

A smile crept up upon her plump cherubic face, easily liking how the business ensemble accentuated her substantially larger form. From there, after a brief moment of reflection, Karen then spoke aloud to herself as she said, "...Oh yeah, this is definitely a keeper!"

"Watashi wa anata ga korera no fuku ni manzoku shite iru to omotte imasu, misu? <I take it that you are satisfied with these clothes, Miss?>" The plump female clerk chirped, easily seeing that Karen was undoubtedly liking the red business suit. In response, Karen swiftly spoke toward the clerk in Japanese and retorted, "*giggle* Tebukuro no yõ ni fitto! Kono yõna ifuku wa nani ka atta no? <Fits like a glove! Got any more clothes like this?>"

"*giggle* Tashika ni, misu! <Certainly, Miss!>" The female clerk answered, where she then gestured Karen to follow her back into the Fitting Room stall once more, prepared to go through numerous different clothes with the same measurements as the three-piece red business suit.

-- One Hour Later --

Eventually, after going through numerous amounts of Plus-Size clothes, Karen was inevitably satisfied with the clothes she had bought from the "Big-Boned Ladies" fashion boutique, as both you and Karen were now heading back to the apartment, carrying several bags worth of clothes custom-tailored to fit Karen at her current size and girth. Suffice to say, this was undoubtedly a productive day for both you and Karen Starr.

Finally, you and Karen got out of the elevator and entered the spacious apartment the two of you live in. Upon entering, you and Karen simultaneously set the bags full of clothes down upon the dining table, as Karen casually waddled her way toward the couch, slowly collapsing upon the couch's cushiony hide, exhaling a relieved sigh in response as she blatantly said, "*sigh* Damn, that clerk was a bit TOO peppy for my tastes, if you ask me!"

"Aww! Come on, Karen! It wasn't all that bad." You replied, reassuring her that the trip wasn't a waste of time, as you then approached the couch and sat beside her on the furniture. In response, Karen exhaled a deep sigh, tenderly rubbing the outward curve of her plush belly, speaking toward you as she retorted, "...Yeah, maybe you're right. Then again, I'm sure YOU had a wonderful time staring at this big fat ass of mine, honey."

Obviously, you couldn't help but bite your lip a little from such a remark, which Power Girl couldn't help but chuckle some from your mild inconvenience, where she then swiftly pulled you in closer to her with a plump left arm, putting her Kryptonian strength on display, then smirked as she quipped, "*chuckle* You might be a gullible idiot, (Name). But you'll always be MY gullible idiot."

From there, she immediately pulled you up toward her face, then administered a passionate kiss upon your lips. Even though you've just woken up in this new alternate world and have been here for the past two weeks, you had to admit that Karen Starr was undoubtedly a good kisser.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Custom-Tailored Clothes

choices: Superman has come alone. It's something urgent.
Superman has come with Lois. Looks like it'll be a couples' weekend.
Superman brought the whole family. Good chance to get to know the whole family.
Actually, it isn't Superman. Someone else is at the door.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
But, just before you can really start enjoying the moment, her phone rings. Karen huffs. "Really? Always when I'm just trying to live a normal life." She looks at the name on her caller ID. "Oh..." she says rather suddenly.

You realize whoever it is, it must be important, so you scootch back while she proceeds to talk. "Um, hey, so... Oh, okay. No, no, that's totally fine. No, it's not a bad time. Well, I mean, right now was since I was kind of in the middle of something, but it's fine. So wait, is it anything important? I'm not saying you're not important, it's just...okay, well, bye. Yes, love you too."

She hangs up and looks back at you. "Sorry, that was family stuff. I guess Clark's decided to come pay us a visit."

"Clark? You mean like, the Superman?"

"Yes, the Superman. God, you can be silly sometimes."

"Did he say what it was about."

She sighs. "No, and he has a horrible habit of doing that. It's always 'I'll tell you later" with him. I swear, he can be about as annoying as human cousins sometimes." She stops, looks around the apartment and sighs again. "Guess that means we'll have to get the place ready for his visit. You know him, he can be a bit of a neat freak sometimes."

"Um, yeah," you say, noticing that the place practically looks spotless as it is. "But, uh, we don't have to start just yet, right? I mean, it's not like he's going to be here any minute."

She laughs. "No, surprisingly, he's coming over the human way. So, his flight's not until next week. That gives us some time. Now, where were we?

* * *


Over the next few days, the two of you set to cleaning up, planning some family meals, and just getting everything ready to both Karen, and what you hope is Clark's liking. Rather, you've done most of the cleaning. As Karen's pregnancy progresses, you notice that she is starting to get tired easily. Well, that and still trying to maintain her superhero status, mostly at nights, she's left pretty dog tired by the daytime. You don't mind all that much. After all, she is carrying your future children. The least you could do is be extra helpful.

Your favorite part of the day is when you cook the immense feasts Karen considers meals. Somehow, no matter what, it just impresses you how much she can eat and still stay an active hero. It's a stark difference from what you used to be. Before all of this, you probably would have never given girls her size the time of day, yet, with her, it seems that she stays stunningly beautiful, no matter how big she gets. Actually, come to think of it, you're starting to remember less and less of your previous life.

Finally, the day arrives when Superman himself is going to be in your own home. You can't help but feel giddy at the thought of that. Never in your wildest dreams did you imagine having any connection, let alone even meeting, any part of the Kryptonian family.

You've just finished getting everything put away and picked up. Karen is meanwhile finishing the large breakfast you prepared for her a couple of hours earlier. You're pretty sure it's more than just the twins increasing her appetite.

"Thanks, babe," she says, pushing away the last of the empty plates. "You've been an amazing help this week. I'm sorry I couldn't really help all that much."

You go and sit beside her on the couch, glad to be off your feet for a while. "That's okay. I know you've been hard at work too." You pat her growing belly, which now feels like a combination of firm and squishy. You suddenly feel a sharp knock against your hand. "Wow!" you say breathlessly. "They're kicking." You move your hands across the curve of her stomach, feeling a few more kicks and pummels.

She nods. "Yeah, they've been doing a lot of that for the past couple of days. It stops being so fun when they're hitting my bladder."

You feel some more. "This is just amazing. It's...it's real now. We're going to be parents."

She smiles and laughs. "You're such a goofball sometimes, but I love you for it." She kisses you. "And that's why you're going to end up being such a good father."

You kiss her back. "Well, don't sell yourself too short there. You're going to be a great mother. I hope they look a lot like you. They'd be the most beautiful girls in the world."

"Aww, that's so sweet. I just hope they don't get my appetite though. You're good, but I don't know if you could cook for all three of us like this."

You laugh. "Well, no matter what happens, I know they'll be perfect. They're our kids after all."

She smiles and shakes her head. But before she can say anymore, there's a knock at the door. She starts to heft herself up from the couch. "Well, that's got to be him."

She waddles over towards the door and answers it. You peek over her shoulder.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: A Surprise Visit

choices: Suddenly, you're interrupted by Karen and Lois.
Suddenly, Karen gets a phone call. It's work.
Suddenly, you hear the sounds of another Kaiju attacking.
Suddenly, it sounds like there's a robbery in progress.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
You see the whole family. There's Superman, disguised as Clark, Lois, and their ten-year-old son, Jon. Karen is excited to see them all.

"Glad you guys could come. It's really been too long. How are you, cousin?"

He manages a tight smile. "We've been well. You seem to have settled into life here in Tokyo just fine." He looks Karen up and down, an unsure look on his face. You're not exactly sure how he feels about her increase in weight.

Karen still beams and wraps Lois in a big hug. "And Lois, it's good to see you too! Clark didn't tell me he was bringing the whole clan."

Lois seems much more pleasant and chatty than her husband. "It really is good to see you too, Karen. We were really sad when you decided to move, but I can see that you're very happy here. You'll definitely have to show us some of the sights, provided you're up to it. Clark said the last time he talked to you, you were pregnant? That's wonderful news!"

The two of them continue to chit-chat while Karen shows them around the apartment. Clark is still keeping a pretty stern face, so you're not sure how to approach him or even begin talking to him. In the meantime, Karen's moved on to Jon.

"And Jonathan, you've gotten so tall! You're in what, fifth grade now."

"Yeah. Hey, Aunt Karen, dad says there's lots of big monsters that come to Tokyo. Is that true?"

She gives a knowing smile. "Sometimes, but those are usually taken care of in a jif. Okay, well, that's the grand tour of the place. I think we could all use some time to catch up. What have you been up to?"

So, for the next hour or so, you listen in while the whole family catches up on everything that's been going on. You rarely get a chance to talk, nor do you even know where to begin. You're kind of starstruck, to be honest. Occasionally, as Karen is telling them about her pregnancy, they ask you the occasional question, to which you either nod your head or give a yes or no answer, but that's about all you can muster.

"Well, it sounds like you two are excited and are doing everything you can to get ready," Lois finishes. "But, aren't you worried about how this affects your work?"

"It's been alright, but I am getting pretty tuckered by the end of the day. But no, no more stress than the average pregnancy."

"Well, that's good at least."

Clark finally speaks to you. "So, how have you been about all of this?"

You gulp. "Um, excited, I guess. A bit nervous too. I mean, when has parenting ever been easy?" You give a nervous laugh. "I'm happy, I really am. It's just, it's a lot to think about."

"I guess we've never asked, but what is it exactly you do?" Lois asks.

Another flood of memories come back to you, and it finally fills in some of those missing gaps you've had about how exactly you met. "I...uh...well, nothing in particular right now," you answer. "We've been considering the possibility of me becoming a stay-at-home dad. But, before all this, I used to work at my dad's law firm. Course, I always had the secret desire to be a chef. Not to brag, but I'm pretty good in the kitchen."

Karen laughs and pats her gut. "Yup, I can attest to that. He really has a gift for it. I don't know where I'd be if I didn't meet him. Anyway, thinking of food, how about I take you guys into town for a little looking around and we can go out for a nice dinner after?"

Everyone seems to agree, and pretty soon, you're all headed out to the city. Despite how crowded it can be sometimes in Tokyo, it seems that people clearly leave enough room as Karen tries to waddle past most of them. Nonetheless, it seems like everyone is having a relatively good time. Lois is enjoying some of the shopping. Jon likes taking pictures of all the neat statues and buildings he sees. And even Clark looks like he's enjoying the day.

Eventually, he pulls you aside. Now, you're worried. "We haven't gotten to talk much ever since Karen met you. We've only really spoken with each other a couple of times," he says awkwardly.

"Um, yeah?"

"Look, it's not that I don't like you. It's just...she's my cousin, and I kind of have to feel protective of her. I just want to know she's alright."

"Yeah, yeah, she's fine."

He gives you an examining look. "Really, though, how is she? I mean, there's the whole..."

"Her size?"

"Yes."

You shrug. "Well, yeah, I was kind of concerned at first. But, it hasn't really slowed her down. She's pretty okay about it. And you know, I actually like her this way. Is that a problem?"

He doesn't say anything at first. "No," he says at last, "but I just want to be sure she's okay."
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Superman brought the whole family. Good chance ...

choices: How's Superman holding out?
Power Girl's getting pretty thrashed. There has to be something you can do.
Power Girl comes up with a plan.
Things get worse. A third kaiju!
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Before you can say anything else, you hear an earth-rumbling roar. That's clearly not a good sign. Just on the horizon, you see a looming, gigantic figure emerges over the Tokyo skyline. It looks like a gigantic alligator. But, it's more than that. Its scales look incredibly tough and spiny. Some of its flesh looks like its rotting off, and its eyes are glowing. It's clearly another kaiju. Already, it starts swinging its tail and smashing anything in sight.

"Zombie alligator," Karen says as she steps up behind you. "Just what we needed today. Alright, well, I'll be right back."

"I'll help," Clark says, following behind her.

However, another rumble stops everyone in their tracks. It's coming from the other direction. You look over and see a large, slimy, lizard-like creature, surrounded by flames. It seems like everything it touches catches on fire.

The two beasts see each other for a moment before they roar and hiss at each other. The alligator creature charges at the lizard and pounds it into the ground. It recoils as its senses react to the heated skin of the lizard. But it recovers and attacks again, swinging its hard-scaled tail at it, knocking it back. The other beast isn't about to take this lying down. It hisses and throws itself at the alligator, its skin burning into the rotted flesh of the alligator. It roars in pain.

Clearly, whatever brought these two things here has been lost in their territorial battle with each other. And unfortunately, the city is caught between their fighting, destruction looking imminent.

In all the chaos, you hardly noticed Karen and Clark disappearing to transition into their superhero identities. Behind you, you hear the air whip as they both take to the sky to take on the creatures.

At first, their main objective is to separate the two fighting beasts. If they can single them out, then they have a better chance of defeating them with the minimum collateral damage as a result. That, however, is easier said than done. The two creatures are too busy snapping their jaws at each other to notice the barrage of attacks from Power Girl and Superman. The alligator, in particular, seems the least affected by it all as its hard body keeps it from feeling the blows.

Power Girl shoots a strong breath of cold air right in the lizard's eye. It finally can no longer ignore everything else going on around it. It pushes the alligator off of it and goes after Power Girl. That leaves Superman to try and keep the alligator at bay, but it's not going to be an easy task.

All you can keep your eyes on is Power Girl. After all, she's the one who's especially important to you. You've already taken cover in a nearby store, along with Lois and Jon, so all you can do is hold your breath and hope this works out. It's not like you don't trust her abilities, but with two monsters attacking, and her getting pretty far along in the pregnancy, you're not sure if her stamina can take all of that.

She keeps her distance from the creature, since it seems like it burns with touch, initially. She ducks and dodges it, trying to hit it with her cold breath to keep it from causing more flammable damage. But, she throws in a few other attacks, like her eye beams for good measure. But its skin seems pretty tough. Not much is taking effect. It leans forward and belches a river of flames out onto the street, trying to tell Power Girl to back off. She avoids it, and works quickly to save as many civilians as she can.

This provides enough of a distraction for the creature to dig its claws into the ground and burrow. Pretty soon, it's disappeared beneath the earth. That's definitely not a good sign. Power Girl tries to sense where it might be before it springs up for a surprise attack. But, a rumble in the ground is what gives her the alert. It emerges once again, roaring and spewing more flames. She's really pissed it off now. It grabs the top of a skyscraper with its tail and throws it at her. She catches it just in time, but she's got to do more than just play defense here.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Suddenly, you hear the sounds of another Kaiju ...

choices: Fortunately, Superman had arrived to lend a hand.
In response, Power Girl managed to come up with a plan.
Unfortunately, another Kaiju had arrived!
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Meanwhile, on the other end of the conflict spectrum, Superman was very much preoccupied in a tense confrontation with the massive undead alligator, which had been named "Grimmgarl" by both the Tokyo Broadcasting Network and the press, as you, Lois, and Jon watched the battle unfold on a nearby television. Apparently, judging from the information being unfolded to the three of you, Grimmgarl was first initially spotted in the Bayous of Louisiana, which explained a little why it was an alligator.

And yet, despite it's ludicrously massive size, Grimmgarl didn't seem very intelligent, possibly due to it...well, being a zombie.

At first, as Superman delivered attack after attack upon Grimmgarl, it appeared as if the enormous undead reptile didn't feel a damn thing thrown at it. However, in retaliation against the Man of Steel, Grimmgarl lunged at Superman snout first, opening it's decaying jaws wide in an attempt to devour him. Unfortunately for the undead Kaiju, Superman quickly evaded the attack, only to be violently batted away by the massive beast's scaly, decomposing tail.

In turn, this launched Superman through a building or two, where he quickly recovered enough to avoid crashing through a third building. He grunted in pain a little, where both you and Superman suddenly realized something:

Grimmgarl was somehow infused with Magic, one of the few weaknesses that can harm someone like Superman and Power Girl.

Obviously, stopping this enormous creature was extremely high on Superman's list of priorities for the time being, as he then quickly flew toward Grimmgarl. However, instead of continuing his assault upon the undead reptile, Superman, using his trademark Super Strength, began to lift up the entirety of Grimmgarl, ascending higher and faster with each passing millisecond, with Grimmgarl involuntarily along for the ride, as it struggled to free itself from the Man of Steel!

Shortly but eventually, Superman threw the undead Grimmgarl far outside of Earth's atmosphere and into the deep black abyss that was outer space. Hopefully, it would crash land on a different planet devoid of civilization, as Superman then quickly flew back to Tokyo to assist his rotund yet pregnant cousin, Power Girl.

-----

Meanwhile, as you, Lois, and Jon help a group of survivors escape to a safer area away from the ongoing battle, Power Girl continued her fight against the charcoal black, fire-breathing salamander that the press have dubbed "Urogora", based off of a massive beast from Ancient Greece, whose description was strikingly similar to that of the Kaiju that Power Girl was currently fighting against.

You watched as Power Girl used several consecutive but powerful Freeze Breath attacks upon Urogora, hoping that cooling it's intensely hot body temperature. Suffice to say, it seemed to be an uphill battle for the corpulent superheroine.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: A Man of Steel VS A Zombie Alligator

choices: Something casual: soba shop.
Something traditional: fish grilled over hot coals.
Something upscale: shabu-shabu.
Something unique: you go to a very off-the-wall restaurant.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Just as Power Girl is starting to run out of options, two lucky breaks come her way. The first is her cousin coming to her aid. At least with two fighting against one, the odds are better, you hope. Second, the Japanese government has arrived with a containment vessel for Urogora. It seems that being used to a great many large monsters attacking the country, the government has devised a system for dealing with such problems. Now Power Girl and Superman have a plan: corral the beast into the containment vessel.

Power Girl gets a second wind, literally. With a newly instilled confidence in the success of their plan, she used her freeze breath to deter Urogora from thrashing at other buildings and began directing it into the path she had in mind. Superman aided with his own heat vision. While it doesn't do much damage to the creature, it does annoy it enough to force it in another direction. Tag-teaming their powers, they are able to lead the salamander-monster on a path straight for the containment vessel. Despite its reluctance to go into an area it knows is a dead end, the creature is forced into the containment vessel, and the Japanese lock the door. It's at least heat resistant, and their plan is to put it at the bottom of the ocean, where it can slumber peacefully without causing more damage.

So, with the situation handled, Superman and Power Girl land down on the ground to a crowd of relieved citizens. They proceed to answer a few questions from waiting reporters, accept a few thanks from citizens, and reassure the crowds that these monsters have been taken care of and will not wreak havoc again.

Meanwhile, you, Lois, and Jon rejoin the crowds, getting out from your cover spots. You all wait patiently for the two Kryptonians to finish up their duties as superheroes. Pretty soon, Clark and Karen rejoin you. "Not how I planned for us to spend a family vacation," Karen said a little breathlessly. "Looks like Starrware is going to be making another donation towards helping to rebuild."

"You okay?" you ask. "You seem a little..."

"Yeah, fine," she says, clearly sounding winded. "It's just getting to be a lot of work these days."

"Well, it's no wonder," Lois adds. "Those two little ones are taking up a lot of your energy. Have you considered when you're going to be going on bedrest?"

Karen sighs. "Well, we haven't talked about it yet. But, I mean, trouble isn't going to stop just because I'm making plans for motherhood. Who's going to keep Tokyo safe?"

Lois puts a hand on her shoulder. "I know, but you do have to realize you're going to be feeling it a lot more with twins. You'll probably have to start resting sooner. I'm sure Clark, or any of his contacts would be more than happy to help out around here. After all, your kids need to come first. You want them to be healthy and everything."

"True, maybe we'll talk more about this before you guys leave," she says.

Clark, of course, returns to business as usual. "You've had several of these kaiju attacks in a short period of time. Are you sure it's only a coincidence?"

This gives you reason to ponder. You were never one for conspiracy theories before, but you do find it a bit more than unusual that so many attacks have happened in a short span of time.

Karen ponders for a moment. "You don't really think someone would honestly be setting these monsters on the city on purpose? I mean, how would they even have access to them, let alone control them. And what would be the point? If Power Girl's handled them every time, what would be the point of trying the same technique over and over again. That's like the definition of insanity."

He shrugs. "I don't know. It's just a thought. I may want to look into this more. I do have some connections with the Gotham Bat." He says this with a slight tinge of bitterness, as if he's want to contact him. "He has a background with detective work. He may be able to provide some persepctive on the matter."

Karen nods. "It can't hurt, I guess."

Her pudgy gut starts to growl with ferocity. "But, I think dinner's going to be my top priority for now," she adds with a laugh.

You agree. "It probably would help you perk up a little after all of that. So, where did you want to go?"

She thinks for a moment, pondering all the delicious options.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Fortunately, Superman had arrived to lend a hand.

choices: Clark explained some parts on how Jon was raised.
Clark said to take things one step at a time.
Actually, he said something else jnstead...
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Although she personally wanted to show her cousin and his family the more viewful areas of the city, both you and Karen eventually agreed on going to a more casual restaurant, which came in the form of a decent-sized Soba shop called "Uncle Kiryu's Soba Noodles Emporium". After all, Karen definitely deserved a bit of a break from all that fighting against Kaiju and criminals for a week or two.

Of course, knowing Karen and her established appetite, she certainly had ordered more than large handfuls of food, due to a combination of an increased appetite and being pregnant with twins. On the other hand, you, Clark, Lois, and Jon ordered an average amount of food for yourselves, whilst the four of you began to converse some, as you spoke toward Clark and asked, "...So, how are things going back in the U.S, Clark?"

"...Surprisingly well, all things considering, (Name). My family and I had just moved back into Metropolis, even though Jon was initially against moving, since he had made friends with some of the kids in Hamilton." Clark answered, where he then continued slurping up some of the Soba noodles.

However, Lois then spoke toward you and said, "Though I must admit, (Name), we didn't expect Karen here to get so..."Rubenesque" when we first arrived here in Japan."

Obviously, Lois was being delicate yet polite regarding the sensitive topic of Karen's substantially larger and bulkier physique. But of course, knowing Karen, she easily knew what Lois was referring to, as she voraciously slurped down another large bowl of Soba noodles, then spoke back toward Lois and bluntly retorted, "Yes, I get it already, Lois: I've gotten pretty fat. But hey, (Name) here has been taking great care of me throughout my pregnancy."

"-Which we are grateful for, Karen. Lois here is just merely worried about your physical health, that's all." Clark answered, successfully defusing the subtle tension between the two women, as you attempted to calm down Karen by your own hands. After all, you knew Karen enough to know that she can rather blunt, straightforward, and direct when it comes to conversation.

Eventually, shortly after both women had calm down, you spoke to Clark once more and asked, "So...out of curiosity, what's it like having a child that's Half-Kryptonian? I mean, Karen and I are a few months away from having two Half-Kryptonian twin girls, and we kinda want to know how to handle them if their powers start to emerge."

At first, Clark contemplated on how he should explain something as heavy as this to you and Karen, but eventually, after a minute of contemplation...
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Something More Casual

choices: You spend the day with Clark, and I go with Lois and Jon?
You take Lois and Jon sightseeing? I need to talk with Clark.
You go with Jon? It'll help you get used to being around kids.
You take the gang on a tour? I have work in the morning.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
"Well, it's definitely not an easy task," he says. "Powers can always be kind of hit or miss, and you're never sure when those will turn up, or if they will." He pats Jon on the head. "We honestly didn't know what would happen until his first mishap with the family cat."

"Oh..." is all you say. That isn't exactly a comforting thought. You're especially nervous because you'll be having to deal with twice that kind of fun. "Um, when did that happen exactly?" You don't like the thought of having a toddler going through the terrible two's while blasting things with heat vision or throwing things around with super strength.

Clark laughs. "Jon was in school by then. True, he was young, but it was still a time when he was old enough for us to talk about his powers. But, as new powers come up, you're going to have to be prepared for whatever consequences come with it."

Karen notices your discomfort. "It's not going to be that bad. Usually when those things happen for the first time, they're not going to be at full strength. We'll have time to talk to them and properly train them. I wouldn't worry so much."

"True, the only real challenge is just dealing with how everyone else is going to react. People can be a bit dodgy about those things, and when they're scared of your kid, then your kid gets scared of their powers. Makes our jobs as parents that much harder," he continues. "I can't tell you how many times teachers have called me in to have a 'talk' about Jon, and the whole matter could have been easily solved if everyone had just stayed calm."

Karen nods in agreement. "Yeah, I think that's the hardest part for any of us. Look, it's no offense to you, but it's just part of us being from another planet. Sure, people appreciate what we do, but they always secretly fear what we're capable of, and it can get isolating at times."

Lois adds, "True, and I think the best thing you can do is accept that these two girls aren't going to have a very human childhood, but it's their childhood nonetheless. So, you might as well make the most of it for them."

"True, I'm just not sure how well I'd do at it," you say.

Karen pats your hand. "I know you'll do just fine. You're kind of a kid at heart anyway."

Finishing up dinner, you head back to the apartment for some much-needed rest after everything that had gone on that day. Clark and his family get settled into the guest room, and you go to bed with Karen. "You're not worried about being a dad are you?" she asks.

"Kinda, why? I mean, it's normal for any future parent to worry."

"Well, yeah, but I mean, that stuff Clark said today. You know it's not really going to be that bad. I think sometimes he exaggerates just to get under your skin sometimes."

Your eyebrows raise in surprise. "Why?"

"You know him. He's kind of like an older brother to me sometimes, and so that makes you the big bad boyfriend taking his precious sister away from him. It's just a natural reaction."

You shrug it off. "Yeah, I've got a sister that I do to sometimes. I get it."

You climb into bed. She continues, "I really think we can manage most of this. Yeah, powers can get scary and everything, but it really isn't bad if you just keep your cool, like he said."

"Yeah," you agree. "So, are they like mad about you being big and all?" You kind of got those vibes throughout the day.

"I think it's just something they're not used to seeing," she says, rubbing her rounded middle. I mean, I was pretty thin before I met you. It's hard for them to understand."

You snuggle closer to her. "So, what's the plan for tomorrow?" you ask.

She rolls over as best she can to face you. "I think our best bet is to divide and conquer. Keeping the three of them entertained for their whole visit could get tricky. How about...

She rolls over as best she can to face you. "I think our best bet is to divide and conquer. Keeping the three of them entertained for their whole visit could get tricky. How about you take Lois and Jon sightseeing? I, um... I need to talk with Clark. You know, regarding all of... This." She answered, motioning a plump hand toward her blubbery belly, burgeoning hips, and thick bulbous thighs, emphasizing on her established enormity before you.

"*sigh* Yeah, I guess you make a fair point there, Karen. ...Wait a minute, you don't think he'll want you to go on an extreme diet, do you?!" You loudly whispered, becoming concerned as to if Karen will stay at her current weight. After all, despite only being in this new reality for a few short weeks, you rather enjoyed and adored Power Girl's newly established heft and girth.

Obviously, in response to you unfounded worries, Karen casually rolled her eyes, then proceeded to sit up, where she then placed herself on top of you in a knelt sitting position, her thick blubbery smooth thighs straddling your lower half with little to no effort, as she spoke into your ear with a flirty tone in her voice and retorted, "*chuckle* Fat chance, (Name)."

"I mean, sure this was bound to happen eventually with all the food you're giving me. But hey, I'm certainly not complaining about it, that's for sure." Karen explained, where she then began to blush profusely, her plump facial cheeks taking on a light red hue in response to such blushing.

From there, as she subconsciously made a few circles on the front of her profound belly, Karen then hesitantly confessed, "...Though, with all honesty, honey, I, um... I-I actually really like being this big. Was I shocked to hear you like girls at my current size? Of course I was! But... I've already started to see the appeal of being a few hundred pounds heavier. Even if it is more difficult to do stuff without using my Kryptonian abilities and not having to make up a convoluted explanation."

"So... I'm taking that as a Yes, then? That you'll be staying at your current weight?" You asked, where she then began to casually lean forward, her large doughy belly leisurely pressing against your crotch and abdomen like a heavy blanket. From there, Karen then calmly yet seductively whispered into your ear and chirped, "...Damn straight, sweetie. Now, what do you say you give me one of your homemade belly rubs?"

Moments later, the two of you began to passionately kiss one another, while you proceeded to tenderly knead and rub Karen's bulbous apron of a belly with relative ease. Such love-making lasted for an hour or two before you both succumbed to sleep.

-- The Next Day --

After getting some breakfast alongside Karen and the Kent Family at the apartment loft, you and Karen decided to go with the original plan, with you taking Lois and Jon around Tokyo for some tourist sightseeing, while Karen would have her "talk" with her cousin.

Of course, much like his father, Jon had to wear a pair faux glasses as to avoid being recognized as the new Superboy, as you drove the SUV with Lois and Jon in the passenger seats. Thankfully, traffic was fairly light during the morning hours. But as the three of you were a good distance away from the apartment high rise, you then spoke toward both Lois and Jon as you curiously asked, "...So, any places you would love to visit here while we're out and about, Lois? Jon?"

Of course, a few brief moments of silence later...

Of course, a few brief moments of silence later, Jon then spoke toward you first and answered, "...(Name), have you ever heard of a show called Mobile Suit Gundam?"

Obviously, you were easily aware of what Jonathan was talking about, giving him a firm nod via front mirror reflection then replied, "Oh yeah! I know what you're talking about, Jon. In fact, I happen to be friends with a guy who so happens to be a store manager over at Gundam Base Tokyo."

"Wait a minute?! How do I even know this!?!" Your subconscious exclaimed inside your mind, which still had remnants of your old life prior to being transported to this new reality. Obviously, even though Jon seemed rather intrigued at such a revelation, Lois looked at you with a slightly confused expression and queried, "Gundam Base...Tokyo? Never heard of a store like that before until now."

"*chuckle* That's the funny but interesting thing about Japan, Lois: The Japanese Animation Industry has a huge fan following here in the Land of the Rising Sun. And one of the biggest franchises is what Jon here just mentioned: Mobile Suit Gundam." You explained a little, as you drove the SUV onto the Freeway, which was en route to the Gundam Base Tokyo building.

Along the way, you then spoke toward Jon once more and asked, "So, Jon? Why the interest in the Gundam franchise?"

"Oh! Um... I made friends with some of the other kids over at Metropolis Junior High. Some of them are fans of that show, even though my Mom doesn't think I should be watching it until I'm 13." Jon retorted, letting you know of his mother's somewhat disapproval of watching such a show.

However, you could understand where both Jon and Lois were coming from, as you spoke toward Jon while keeping your eyes on the Freeway as you answered, "...Well, I certainly don't blame your mother for protecting you, Jon. I mean, I was around your age when I first saw Gundam Wing on TV for the first time, and I didn't understand some of the reasons behind all that fighting until I was older."

"Gundam...Wing? Never heard of it before." Jon quipped, where you then quickly replied, "Yeah, it was around before you were born, Jon. But hey, it was what got me and a few of my friends into Gundam in the first place, much like how you and your friends are watching...Which Gundam series did you and your friends watch?"

"...I think it's called "Mobile Suit Gundam: Iron-Blooded Orphans" or something similar." Jon answered, just as you saw the Gundam Base Tokyo building come into clear view on the left. "See that building over there?" You chirped, pointing to the building. "That's Gundam Base Tokyo."

From there, Jon looked out the window and saw the aforementioned building just a short distance away. And standing in front of the building, was a life-sized 64 foot tall replica statue of the Unicorn Gundam from Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn. Suffice to say, you could tell that Jon was in some semblance of awe upon laying eyes on the area just beliiw the three of you.

-- 30 Minutes Later --

Once inside, both Lois and Jon were surprised to see how vast the place was in it's entirety.

But after much exploring through the building itself, you led the group over to the designated store that your "friend" just so happened to be the store manager of.

You looked back at Lois, nodding in agreement with her words, where you then spoke and answered, "...Thank you very much, Lois. Your words definitely mean a lot as to what I'm going through."

Obviously, you could see that Lois was doing her damnedest not to sound so offensive with such a sensitive topic. Of course, in response to such a question, you...

Once you, Lois, and Jon had returned to the apartment condo, the three of you were greeted to the sight of...

...Well, you're certainly sure that Clark and Karen were doing... "something", that's for sure.

Sure, Clark was still wearing his civilian clothes (minus the glasses), but it was actually Karen who appeared different. Instead of wearing her enlarged beige turtleneck sweater and form-fitting blue sweatpants, Karen was currently wearing her Power Girl, only it was just her white one-piece leotard, with her short red cape, blue gloves and blue boots still adorned upon the obese mannequin hidden behind the bookcase.

From there, Clark looked back at you with his famed reassuring grin and replied, "Well, it began as Karen and I were discussing on the ongoing Kaiju Crisis..."

-- 30 Minutes Ago --

"...Well, I've just contacted Wonder Woman and the other members of the League. Some of them will assist you in protecting Tokyo in any future Kaiju attacks." Clark elaborated, speaking towards his substantially heftier cousin, Karen Starr (better known as "Power Girl"), who was currently devouring her second large snack, all whilst she keenly listened to her more well-known cousin.

And with a heavy gulp, she swallowed a big slice of Extra-large Akiba Pizza, as it's contents slid down her gullet and fell into her waiting stomach. From there, she looked back at Clark and queried, "...And Atlee? How is she faring in New York without me?"

Obviously, Clark could see that Karen was both curious and concerned about her ward slash sidekick, Atlee, who happened to be the latest individual to take up the superhero title "Terra". In response, Clark placed a reassuring hand upon Karen's plump left shoulder and answered, "...She seems to be doing rather well. Jay Garrick just told me that she's become an invaluable member of the JSA. And that she misses you."

"Heh! Well, that's certainly good to hear, Kal. So, got any idea who's sending all these Kaiju here?" Karen questioned, referring Clark by his Kryptonian birth name, Kal-El. After all, they both originated from the planet Krypton, not to mention they share the same abilities.

After pondering for a brief moment or two, Clark then looked back at Karen and elaborated, "...Well, from what the Gotham Bat had explained to me while you were, erm... "preoccupied", he explained to me that this might be the ploy of one of your villains, Kara. I think your situation reminds him of what happened during a certain... "event", in his career."

Of course, Karen had this look on her plump face, one akin to that of experiencing a bad gut feeling, which prompted Karen to exhale a deep sigh and she replied, "...*sigh*...I can think of a FEW people who still have a grudge on me--- AAAGH!!!!"

But as Karen was speaking, she felt this sudden surge of intense heat hitting her on the left side of her bulbous yet pregnant stomach. However, instead of feeling the intense heat against her skin, Karen felt said intense heat from INSIDE her stomach!

-- 30 Minutes Later, Now --

"...And that's what Kara and I are doing here for the past five minutes." Clark finished, explaining what had transpired in the past half hour prior to you, Lois, and Jon returning to the apartment condo. Of course, you soon spoke up toward Karen and asked, "...And I'm guessing that what the twins did have something to do with you wearing your Power Girl leotard?"

"Yeah... Turns out turtleneck sweaters are NOT flame-retardant, so I had to change into my Power Girl leotard since it's highly heat-resistant. Y'know, just in case the twins decide to play "Heat Vision Tag" with their mother." Karen shrugged, jokingly remarking about that "Heat Vision Tag" comment.

However, you couldn't help but become internally concerned, especially with the fact that all of these Kaiju attacks were most likely coordinated by one of Power Girl's enemies, where you then looked at Karen and asked, "...Any idea who would be capable of this, Karen? I mean, you've said so yourself: "You've made a good amount of enemies"."

Putting a slightly plump hand to her chin and double chin for a moment or two, Karen contemplated as to who would be capable of controlling and/or manipulating several giant monsters. But after much contemplation, Karen soon spoke back to you and the rest of the group and answered...

Putting a slightly plump hand to her chin and double chin for a moment or two, Karen contemplated as to who would be capable of controlling and/or manipulating several giant monsters. But after much contemplation, Karen soon spoke back to you and the rest of the group and answered, "...Considering that these Kaiju are basically animals the size of a small mountain, there's only one person that certainly rings a bell: Sara Descarl."

Of course, just as Karen said the name Sara Descarl, you began to experience a brief but very vivid flashback, which got you up to speed as to who the rotund Karen Starr was referring to:

Sara Descarl. Though she's better known by her villain alias, "Satana". From what your "False" memories of dating Power Girl in her secret identity have explained to you, Satana was actually the girlfriend of one Gerard Shugel, better known as "Ultra-Humanite", a highly intelligent but terminally ill man who had transferred his brain into that of a massive albino gorilla, which was aided by Satana, who had romantic affections toward him.

Of course, Gerard Shugel obviously had no solid connection to the original Ultra-Humanite.

Now as for how he became enemies with your corpulent yet pregnant girlfriend, Ultra-Humanite attempted to perform a brain transplant on Power Girl, transferring his brain into Power Girl's body. And this was before you started dating her. Fortunately, Power Girl was able to free herself and defeat Ultra-Humanite, but ultimately sent him to Blackgate Penitentiary after Ultra-Humanite became severely injured by Power Girl's Heat Vision.

However, this made Satana hellbent on exacting revenge on Power Girl, sending an army of genetically-modified anthropomorphic animals (including some experimented Thanagarian Man-Hawks) after Power Girl, which was actually a distraction to kidnap Atlee, the new Terra, and transfer Ultra-Humanite's brain into Atlee's body. It was ultimately a failure, which resulted in Satana's left arm getting cut off by Power Girl's Heat Vision.

"...Satana? As in The Ultra-Humanite's girlfriend? Didn't you cut her left arm off and tossed her crazy boyfriend in Blackgate?" You questioned, where Karen then nodded in confirmation as she explained, "...Yeah, pretty much, hon. And if I was betting on my demise, I would want to get someone just as strong and powerful on my side."

"...And where do you think she is now?" Lois questioned, obviously concerned for Karen as well, considering how dangerous Satana now was if she truly was the one controlling some of the Kaiju. Karen was now standing at the main apartment skyline window, which overlooked the city of Tokyo, her doughy arms crossed out of concern, not just for her own well-being, but also for your safety as well (And also that of Lois and Jon's if Satana launches an attack before Clark and his family leave a few days from now).

Of course, you could somehow always tell when she's upset about something, as you calmly approach from behind her and said, "...You're worried about me getting caught in the crossfire, aren't you Karen?"

"*sigh* ...To be honest? Yeah." Karen bluntly stated, a sense of worry clearly seen on her. Of course, Clark can clearly see that the two of you need some time alone to sort things out, so he motioned Lois and Jon into the other room, thus giving you and Karen some much needed personal space.

After all, this was something you and Karen needed to sort out personally.
1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.title: Satana's Return?

1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
They say "Time flies when you're preoccupied".

Well... To you and the corpulent Karen Starr, two weeks had flown by surprisingly quick.

A week after Clark and his family had arrived in Tokyo for a family get-together, they left just as they came seven days later. Suffice to say, they certainly enjoyed their time here in Japan.

But right now, you were currently spending some quality time with Karen, spending said quality time on a rather romantic date night. Although Tokyo wasn't known for housing heftier residents (Aside from the average Sumo Wrestler), you did manage to find a suitable restaurant that can certainly handle someone of Karen's size and girth.

The restaurant in question was known as "Okada-Sensei's Cuisine Shrine", and it was a well-reputable place of business, especially for those in Tokyo who have a hefty appetite. On the outside, it was designed to look like a replica of the Meiji Shrine, while the interior had a Edo Period decor style to it, complete with the waitresses all dressed up in romanticized Shrine Maiden uniforms.

Overall, Karen certainly admired the historical aesthetic the restaurant was going with.

Currently, you were wearing a three-piece formal suit, complete with red button-up vest over a white dress shirt, but with the sleeves rolled halfway up your arms.

Though Karen on the other hand, she (mildly reluctantly) was all dolled up in what appeared to be a blue and white kimono, which was custom-tailored to properly accommodate upon her rotund frame. Normally, she would've preferred to wear an evening dress, but you consistently asked if she would wear the kimono, since you got it for her as a gift for the upcoming Kamakura Festival, which was celebrated on the second and third Sundays of April.

Suffice to say, she certainly looked beautiful in such an outfit.

However, whilst Karen was consuming a good amount of food, you were contemplating about what Clark had said to you the night before he, Lois, and Jon returned to Metropolis...

-- Karen Starr's Apartment --
-- A Week & A Day Ago --

Night had fallen upon the city of Tokyo, as the skyline lit up in an almost dazzling display, Currently, you stood on the spacious balcony of your apartment condo, leaning on the railing, as you absentmindedly overlook the sprawling Japanese metropolis.

"...You alright there, (Name)?" A voice rang out from behind you, which you easily recognized as Superman, who was currently in his Clark Kent persona, glasses and all. You turned your head to look at him as he approached you, where you then spoke to him and answered, "Oh! Um..I-I'm fine, Clark. It's just that I needed to get some fresh air, y'know?"

"Yes, I understand how you feel. After all, it wasn't easy for me to reveal who I really was to Lois after some time had passed." Clark retorted, placing his hands on the balcony railing, standing beside you as the two of you gazed over the Tokyo skyline.

There was a brief moment of silence between the two of you, where Clark then abruptly ended the silence, as he spoke toward you with a calm sensible demeanor and asked, "...(Name), do you mind if I ask you something? I never got the chance to do so before you and Karen moved."

"Sure. Fire away." You casually replied, bracing yourself for whatever question the Man of Steel was about to ask you. From there, Clark then exhaled a deep breath and queried, "...(Name), be honest with me: How much do you care about my cousin, Kara Zor-El?"

Of course, you knew that when Clark was using Karen's Kryptionian name, you figured that it must be a serious question, where you turned your head to look back at Clark, exhaling a deep sigh and fiercely answered, "...Clark: I truly LOVE Karen with every fiber of my being. It doesn't matter to me if she weighs 200 pounds or half a ton, I still love her. I want to make her feel like she's the most important person in my life, whether we're out in public or in bed together."

Somehow, as if you could tell that he was using his X-Ray Vision to see if you were lying or not via your pulse and heartbeat, Clark then looked back at you with a somewhat reassured expression on his stoic face, where he then spoke toward you once more and asked, "...Are you absolutely sure of yourself, (Name)? After all, the lifestyle that Kara and I had chose could put you in life-threatening situations."

Of course, you could obviously tell that Clark was subtly referring to the lifestyles that he and Karen have chosen, as the heroes known as "Superman" and "Power Girl", which you understood all too well from some of Karen's "Worry Lectures". After all, if one of her enemies, such as Ultra-Humanite or Satana, ever found out that you were close to Power Girl, they would target you to get to her.

So, in response to what Clark had just said to you, you stood up from the railing, turned around to face him, bearing a determined look in your eyes and replied, "...I appreciate your concern, Clark. However, that won't change my mind on how I feel about Karen."

And with such a confirmation from you, Clark patted you on the shoulder in reassurance and replied, "...You're a loyal individual, (Name). I'm just glad to see that Kara has found someone who is willing to have a serious relationship with her. You know, I'm only doing this out of concern for her."

"I know. She's family, and family's important, considering what had happened to you and Karen, and what you two had to endure. I just hope I can live up to her expectations. I mean, I plan on asking her to marry me eventually." You said, thankful for Clark accepting your love for Karen, as you divulge to him on what you had in store for your future with Karen.

Of course, Clark didn't seem fazed by what you said, almost as if it reminded him of his relationship with Lois prior to Jon's birth. So, he spoke toward you and queried, "Oh? And when will you pop the question?"

"...I was thinking of asking her as soon as possible. Y'know, before the twins are born. However, the only problem is that I haven't found the perfect ring for her." You answered, elaborating on what your plans were.

"Hmm... I think I can help you with that, (Name)." Clark quipped, where he turned his head to the right, looking at Karen, Lois, and Jon, who were currently watching a movie on Karen's massive Flatscreen TV, just to make sure they were distracted. From there, Clark then dug into his pants pockets and pulled out...

1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
"Hmm... I think I can help you with that, (Name)." Clark quipped, where he turned his head to the right, looking at Karen, Lois, and Jon, who were currently watching a movie on Karen's massive Flatscreen TV, just to make sure they were distracted. From there, Clark then dug into his pants pockets and pulled out what apoeared to be a pair of finely ornamented engagement rings.

You looked at Clark at some semblance of confusion as he presented them to you, where you then spoke to him and asked, "...You're giving me a pair of engagement rings?"

"They're not just an ordinary pair of engagement rings, (Name). Take a closer look." Clark answered, where you then promptly picked up one of the two rings that Clark presented you, examining it very closely. It beared an audacious blue sheen to it, but upon examining it further, you soon recognize something adorned on it:

A visible engraving in the form of Superman's insignia.

Of course, from what Karen and your "False" memories have explained to you, the diamond S wasn't just Superman's trademark emblem, it was also Clark and Karen's family crest, The House of El.

You looked back at Clark with a sense of astonishment on your face, as You soon spoke to him and chirped, "My god... These rings are family heirlooms, aren't they?"

Clark nodded in confirmation. "You're correct, (Name). These engagement rings are one of the last remaining family heirlooms of the House of El that were recovered and preserved before Krypton's destruction. Surprisingly, marriage customs on Krypton are surprisingly similar to those on Earth." Clark explained, confirming what you had suspected.

From there, Clark continued speaking as he said, "(Name), over the past week, I have seen that you and Kara have become intimately close. And you have proven that you can handle yourself when Kara is Power Girl. I would like you to use these rings when you propose to her."

Suffice to say, you couldn't help but become practically speechless at what the Man of Steel was giving you. After all, he was giving you a family heirloom as a way to assist you in your engagement proposal to Karen. In response to what Clark had proposed to you, you instinctively blurted, "...Clark, I...I can't take these rings. I mean, don't get me wrong, I apooreciate what you're doing, but... I just can't take them. These belonged to your family lineage, and I don't want to be taking something that us so important you and Karen, considering what the two of you had went through."

"I understand your reasoning, (Name). I know you're trying to sound considerate and all, after what happened to me and Kara. But still, I'd like to believe that Krypton still lives on with our families. After all, I have Lois and Jon, while Kara has you and the soon-to-be-born twins." Clark gestured, which convinced you somewhat to at least take the rings as a gesture of good faith.

-- Present Day --

Meanwhile, back in present day, you contemplated on when you should properly propose to Jjaren with the House of El rings that Clark gave you, as you saw that Karen was nearly finished with voraciously devouring another plate of delectable cuisine, finishing up with a set of playful pats upon her downright stuffed apron belly, bearing a contentful smile upon her plump cherubic face.

1553322223322223232223222222133333333322.content:
Meanwhile, back in present day, you contemplated on when you should properly propose to Karen with the House of El rings that Clark gave you, as you saw that Karen was nearly finished with voraciously devouring another plate of delectable cuisine, finishing up with a set of playful pats upon her downright stuffed apron belly, bearing a contentful smile upon her plump cherubic face.

"Well, that was certainly tasty, but not as good as your cooking if I do say so myself, sweetie." Karen complimented, leaning back a little in her chair, which caused it to creak and groan a smidge under her substantially larger physique. Of course, knowing her, Karen had always preferred your cooking over going to a restaurant.

But then, she noticed how you appeared to be somewhat distracted, where she looked at you with a mildly concerned expression on her plump face and queried, "...Hey. Is everything...alright, (Name)? You seem to be rather... "distracted" about something."

"Oh! Um... Sorry about that, Karen. I've... got a lot on my mind, that's all." You retorted, snapping out of your daze, courtesy of Karen Starr. Obviously, Karen didn't seem all that convinced that you were worrying about something minor, as she looked at you with a rather stern expression, despite the plump rounded physique of her face. Then, she crossed her thick plump arms in response and said, "...Come on, hun. We both know you're a horrible liar, and I can tell if you're lying from examining your heartbeat. So, care to divulge?"

Of course, due to her Kryptonian abilities, Karen could easily see right through your words, where you then exhaled a sigh and ultimately confessed, "...Karen, I, um...have a confession to make--"

But suddenly, before you could even say another word, both you, Karen, and everyone in the restaurant heard a series of explosive noises, followed by the sounds of numerous people screaming and running for their lives, most of them screaming "Kaiju!! Kaiju!!" in Japanese. Both you and Karen then quickly headed out of the restaurant to investigate, which revealed to be as what the panicked masses have deduced.

"*frustrated sigh* Can't even get a damn break, Can I?! *sigh* Well, time to get to work, then." Karen muttered, obviously a tad frustrated at what was occurring before her. In response, you quickly spoke to her and replied, "Okay, I'll try and get these people to evacuate while you do your thing."

Obviously, you were also frustrated at such an impromptu moment towards preventing you from popping the question to Karen, as the rotund blonde quickly went into a nearby alleyway to change into Power Girl, while you had the people evacuate from the restaurant as quickly as possible.

-- Meanwhile... --

Meanwhile, along the Tokyo skyline, Power Girl quickly flew off towards the source of the disturbances. However, as she approached where the Kaiju would be, she was suddenly attacked from the side in a blitz attack! It came out of nowhere, but before she could even recover, the Kaiju suddenly grabbed her and pinned her against one of the nearby skyscrapers.

Sure, she could easily break out of the monster's grip, but she was then assaulted by something blunt to the side of her head, momentarily disorienting her for a brief respite, where she then heard a smug womanly voice speak to her as it said, "Hello, Power Girl. We have much catching up to do."

Looking up, Karen beared a scold on her face, as she looked up to see who had restrained her. In appearance, she was a woman with short black hair and purple and red eyes. But the most distinguishing feature was the somewhat bulky suit of leopard-printed Power Armor she currently wore.

From there, Karen easily recognized who she was confronting, as she growled, "...Satanna."

"Ah, glad to see that you remember me. Though, I must say, you're certainly more... "Rubenesque", than our previous encounter. Did you decide to become a Sumo Wrestler during your stay here? *sadistic chuckle*" Satanna quipped, obviously remarking about Karen's increased weight. But of course, Power Girl retorted back with her own savage remark and bluntly said, "...That's none of your damn business. And besides, I carry this weight MUCH better than you do, Descarl!"

But in response to such a snide remark, Satanna bashed her with a massive two-handed high-tech hammer in her grasp, which seemed to heavily disorient Karen even more. Of course, you saw what was going on as you made your way out of the building. You became extremely worried as you then realized who was attempting to bash Karen's brains in:

Sara Descarl, better known as "Satanna".

And from the looks of things, she was most likely the one who sent all those Kaiju after her in the first place! After all, she appeared to have some sort of Killer Whale Kaiju to assist her in restraining Power Girl.

http://kaijucombat.com/wiki/doku.php?id=...

Meanwhile, as Satanna bashed at her head with a high-tech hammer, she felt this negative energy being emitted against her. Of course, she soon realize what it was that Satanna was hitting her with: Red Solar Radiation.

Unlike the effects of a Yellow Sun or a Blue Sun, instead of enhancing her powers, Red Solar Radiation has the opposite effect on Kryptonians, substantially weakening them. And unfortunately for her, Power Girl was Kryptonian, and she could feel the negative effects of being exposed to Red Solar Radiation, as she could barely push against the Kaiju's massive hand to free herself.
