1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.content:
“No wonder, the plane’s all gaudy.” You replied, saying the last four words under your breath.

“It’s for stealth purposes Mr. Laser-shot. It deflects radar detection. We’ve been taking extra precautions.”

All it took for the plane to reach Dorado, Mexico was close to an hour. Once the plane touched down at Dorado’s airport, you got your passport checked out by airport personnel. A few minutes later, you exited the airport and headed to a limo that was by the shuttle parking area. You finally figured where these 3 strangers were working for when you saw the turquoise ziggurat emblem on the limousine’s door, the Mexican based energy company LumériCo. You and the three associates got in the limousine and the vehicle took off to LumériCo’s central offices in the Dorado city center.

“LumériCo’s infrastructure has already been compromised once. A Hacking group had stolen very valuable information from Lumérico and its employees, and worse falsified company documents.”

“Indeed.” The man, Angel Burciaga, answered, “A recent investigation from Volskya’s agents had revealed a connection between Talon and the hacking incident that has defamed LumériCo. Mr. Potero will be making a keynote speech denouncing Talon at the G30 summit here at Dorado, but his health has been declining and we’ve been already receiving been threats. With our forces busy locating Sombra, we needed outside help for keeping the city safe. We will be turning to you in the next few days.”

“And right now?” You asked.

“Give us some time,” Ms. Jimenez answered, “We’re making arrangements for extra support with our business partners.”

The rest of the drive was uneventful, that is until the limo was stop by a protest group of Dorado citizens at the front entrance of LumériCo's corporate offices. You looked out the window to see many people holding picket signs utterly whose contents were utterly critical of LumériCo:

“¡Dorado pertenece a la gente! <Dorado belongs to the people!>

“¡Vishkar no se puede confiar en! <!Vishkar cannot be trusted!>”

“¡Recodar los barrios de Rio de Janerio! <Remember the Favelas of Rio!>”

“¡Lumérico no puede vender a su gente! <Lumérico cannot sell out its people!>”

“¡Proyecto Armonia nos obligará a salir de nuestros hogares!” <Project Harmony will force us out of our homes!”>
The Dorado police were busy holding the demonstrating people back from blocking the traffic, allowing the limousine to enter the Dorado building’s parking garage. Once the limo was parked you got and out followed the three Lumérico officials into a corridor.

“So, your reputation took a dive?” you asked.

“…*sigh*… Si Lasershot.” Ms. Jimenez answered, her dark brown drooping down as she placed the fingertips of her left hand to face, clearly to hide her shame. “Our internal investigators have cleared Lumérico and Mr. Potero of any wrongdoing, but the citizens refuse to believe us.”

“Most people don’t want to face the shame of being in the wrong.” You replied. “I take it you want a few outside sources to clear your name?”

“Absolutely.” Ms. Jimenez answered. “As we said, we need to make arrangements with… hablando del rey de Roma. <Speak of the devil.>”

Two Indian representatives, one male and one female, approached you and LumériCo staff. The two of them were wearing white and purple uniforms, apparel commonly associated with the Vishkar Corporation. The male representative didn’t that many noticeable features, namely his hairstyle of two spikes, and a strange device mounted to his right wrist. The woman’s left arm was a white armored prosthetic, with her hair with set of bangs on her right side, and the back of her hair was organized into a bun.

“यह आपको फिर से सुश्री जिमेनेज को देखने के लिए एक खुशी है।” The Vishkar man said.

“I’m sorry but my Hindi is a bit rubbish.” You said.

“Oh, I’m sorry. I said, ‘It’s a pleasure to see you again Ms. Jiménez.’” the male Vishkar representative replied, tapped the ID tag mounted to his chest, making its Hindi script become English and letting better understand his name: Sanjay Korpal.

The ID’s Hindi script became English, letting you better understand his name, Sanjay Korpal.

“I take it you’re one of the heroes LumériCo has hired? It’s a pleasure to meet you Mr.…” Sanjay asked holding his arm out.

“Laser-Shot,” you answered, shaking Sanjay’s right hand, you than turned to the Vishkar woman asked, “And your name would be?”

“Satya Vaswani.” She answered, tapping her own ID tag.

“Señor Korpal,” Ms. Jimenez said surprised, “I wasn’t expecting you to be early.”

“Arriving early is how Vishkar shows solidarity.” Mr. Korpal replied.

“We’re planning enter into a partnership with Vishkar Corporation. LumériCo is hoping to expand outside of Mexico,” Angel explained to you, “We’ve made a partnership contract with Vishkar so that LumériCo provides clean energy for the new developments in Mexico, and in return, Vishkar will help LumériCo expand outside of Mexico, so we provide electricity to those in need anywhere in the world."

“I take it this ‘Proyecto Armonia’ a project between the two of you?” you asked, reflecting to the protest rally.

“Certainly. Proyecto Armonia will be a joint development collaboration between Vishkar and Lumérico to enhance the city of Dorado’s self-sufficiency.” Sanjay answered, “Vishkar’s urban planning will be combined with Lumérico’s clean energy systems. The population that the city of Dorado can shelter, and support will increase exponentially.”

As Sanjay explained Proyecto Armonia for you, Satya held out her prosthetic hand forward, palm side upward. Light erupted from her palm, emerging as first as a cyan column of light the length of her arm span. Then Satya used both of her hands to remold the light pillar through stretching, compressing, splitting, and distending it until the final product was a holographic quartet of nine tiered arcologies, all connected with a series of plexiglass skyways with windows on every view. Each sector was shaped after a symmetrical parallelogram and was organized by function.

“As you can see,” Mr. Korpal continued, “The first three sectors of a Proyecto Armonia arcology will be devoted to varying industries, with the heaviest at the bottom. The next three will be designated as residential zones for people of varying incomes, with lower incomes on sector 4 and wealthier citizens residing in sector 6, but we decided to house the police and security personnel in sector 5 to give them consistent mobility to respond to any threat in the buildings. Sectors 7 and 8 will be devoted to amenities: with shops, restaurants, community centers, and schools, for sector 7 and larger scale amenities like parks, zoos, hotels, and stadiums for sector 8. The highest-level, Sector 9, will designed for large scale agricultural production and is quartered for different specialties such produce and livestock. Sector 9 will be encased in a holographic dome that allows the control of both weather and atmospheric pressure. Each of our Vishkar arcologies will have power and utility decks between each sector providing air, clean drinking water, and LumériCo energy to the sectors below and above it. Moving up and down the sectors will be supplied by 12 giant elevators, 4 near the arcology’s center and 8 around the edges. These elevators also serve as Proyecto Armonia’s means of support and structure, keeping the arcologies remain stable under all conditions.”

If you had to guess from Satya’s model, which was as tall as she was if not half a foot to two higher, each building would be 180 stories tall with each of the sectors taking about 20 stories apiece. You stated, “Nice sales pitch, but a couple of people didn’t want that in their backyards.” You stated.

“We’ve expected this.” Mr. Korpal answered. “Most people are reluctant to make compromises and sacrifices when it comes to public order. Vishkar has seen similar protests in Khartoum and Rio de Janerio.”

When you looked over at Satya, you noticed like she is having some remorse over something. Once Sanjay cleared his throat and Satya’s expression reverted back to stern professionalism. By closing her artificial hand, the Proyecto Armonia model disappeared. Satya then looked to you and said, “I am looking forward to working with you to bring order.”

Sanjay immediately explained, “Vishkar is committed to seeing the G30 summit run peacefully. That's why we had Satya volunteer herself for the security detail.”
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.title: Traveling to Dorado.

choices: The hotel, where the other heroes for G30's security have checked in.
The festival, where you and Symmetra can get something to eat.
You and Sym discover a minor crime that will head to your first lead on Talon.
Writer's choice.
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.content:
The omnic, Salphador, replied, “We appreciate the appreciate the enthusiasm from our business partners at the Vishkar Corporation, but we unfortunately have no leads on Talon's plans at the moment.”

“If you guys don’t have a plan, what do you expect us to do before our first lead comes in?” You asked.

“We have made some lounging arrangements for you, Ms. Vaswani, and the rest of the security detail.” Salphador said as he handed you and Satya a pass card, “It’s a pass for one of the luxury suites at the one of Dorado’s finest hotels, The Gran Puesta Del Sol Resort, paid for by Lumérico.”

“Oh… I wanted see Mr. Portero himself.” You replied, and then noticed the uneasiness in Jimenez, Burciaga, and Salphador’s body languages, “You said his health was declining.”

“Well yes… very well.” Mr. Burciaga reluctantly agreed.

While Sanjay Korpal stayed behind, you, Satya, and three Lumérico personnel went to Mr. Portero’s office. As Angel Buriaga opened door, the office of Guillermo Portero was dark, with all the curtain blinds blocking all forms of light. Once the hall brought light to the office behind the desk sat the stressed out and fatigued CEO of Lumérico, Guillermo Portero. Mr. Portero looked utterly exhausted, and the top of his desk had documents scattered about in an utterly disorganized matter, two empty bottles of Tequila laying on their sides with a third bottle just recently opened right next to the nine tenths empty glass, and an ashtray with a quarter of a long-extinguished cigar sticking straight upward. His newly grown stubble near his chin looked inconsistently shaved. His mustache looked completely unkempt, and its ends were split apart. You noticed how baggy and red his eyes were as the Lumérico executive tried to shield them from the hall lighting with his left hand while the right hand was clutching the right part of his skull. Mr. Portero’s lips looked dry and cracked. His Lumérico lapel pin was put on crooked. You could see that Satya was wanting to fix up the executive’s clutter.

“Oh god, he’s relapsed again.” You could hear Ms. Jimenez say under his breath.

“I’m sorry,” Mr. Portero said, “I just working late and I… got off the phone with the… divorce lawyer and…”

“Uh… Sir, the first of the security detail have arrived.” Ms. Jimenez told her boss.

“…Oh! Welcome,” Mr. Portero quickly put a false bravado, “I’m glad the two of you have come help with protecting the G20…”

“G30 señor.” Salphador corrected his boss.

“G30 summit on Lumérico’s behalf!”

You saw all that you needed to know your clients' boss; the false corruption accusations had taken its toll on the Lumérico CEO and he’s turned to liquor to cope.

“Leave it to us sir.” You said, ending the conversation and headed out of the Lumérico building.

A few minutes later, outside the Lumérico building, your back-vision powers caught sight of Ms. Vaswani catching up to you.

“You finished sorting out Mr. Portero’s desk?” you asked.

“Yes. Walking off from your duty is considered is a rude behavior.” Satya said, not approving of what you just pulled.

You just shrugged and answered, “Considering our bosses at Lumérico don’t have any leads, I wouldn’t consider us ‘on duty’. From what Ms. Jimenez told me we would just be waiting for them to order us around. I prefer seeing it as finding the truth myself.”

“What?” Satya replied, somehow intrigued by your last sentence.

“'Finding the Truth' means that you should be seeking out the answers. You can’t be taking what people tell you at face value. Accepting whatever’s convenient for you will only make you susceptible to the manipulators of chaos. Not accepting evidence that goes against your worldview will only harm you in the long run and by accepting it, we can use that knowledge to fix the flaws in ourselves, our beliefs, and become stronger and adaptable.” You answered, “But enough about me, you should loosen up. Don’t you got anything more casual to wear?”

Satya gave both your philosophy and your question that some thought. For the latter, she then took her mechanical hand out, this time summoning a small cone of hard light. Placing it on the ground, the light cone transformed into a Vishkar Teleporter pad. Satya stepped in the teleporter, and half a minute later, she stepped out in a new attire: a sleeveless dark blue dress, with metallic gold accents and a cyan glow to it. Satya was also wearing a black polyester undershirt, metal heels, and black stocking that went past her knees. On her head was a white helmet that exposed the front of her head and face while letting her hair pass through. The helmet had an extension that ran across her head to the forehead with a cyan diamond at the end. Across her face was a holographic visor. A pair of cyan column earrings hanged from the helmet’s ear coverings and a metallic band across her neck.

“Symmetra, reporting.” She said.

“You call yourself that?” You asked.

“When I’m on missions, yes. And is this more casual for you Laser-Shot?”

“That’ll definitely do Sym.” You answered her, feeling the start of an exquisite partnership with her.

“Also Ms. Jimenez said you forgot your map of the city.” She answered.

Symmetra handed you a map of the city of Dorado. The Gran Puesta Del Sol Resort’s location was marked with turquoise circle near the center of southeast corner of town, overlooking the sea. Another area of interest on the map would be a G30 Cultural Harmony Festival that gets held in every city when it hosts a G30 summit, full of international entertainments, souvenir stands, and plenty of food booths of cuisines from around the globe. With that map, decided on your next move:
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.title: The Architect, and the Investigator.

choices: Some of the other heroes of G30's security detail arriving.
A nearby break-in that heads to your first leads on Talon.
Writer's choice 1
Writer's choice 2
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.content:
Looking at your smartphone, its screen showed that the time was around ten minutes to 11:00. If you made your way to the festival now, you could get lunch there with having to avoid the crowds. You told Symmetra, “Come on, let’s head to the festival.”

Symmetra was hesitant about that answer replying, “I’m not the one that enjoys festivals. There always too crowded and too noisy.”

“Yeah, I hear that.” You agreed, “But the festival is part of the G30 summit. If we arrive early enough the lines won’t be long. Besides, a large noisy crowd is what a terrorist group like Talon will usually aim for.” You explained.

“I suppose you’re correct on that Laser-Shot.”

The two of you walked on over to the festival, avoiding the crowd of demonstrators that were at the front of the Lumérico plant. At the festival entrance in Dorado's central plaza, there were a few Lumérico personnel that were working what looked to be an admittance booth. One of them asked you for a ticket for admittance into the festival.

“We’re part of the security detail.” You told the staff, taking out the passcard “That should get us in, right?”

The two staffers recognized the passcards as something that could only be issued by Lumérico’s security department.

“We see you have the voucher passcards.” One of the staffers said, “Right this way señors.”

As you predicted, the crowds of the G were relatively light, limited just around several families, although considering the large protest about Proyecto Armonia, you wonder if that was why the attendance low. Balloons of various family were tethered the plaza’s fountain and most of the booths. The booths themselves had their wares completely set up and consisted of three types. First was were the booths that used G30’s name for merchandising, mostly consisting of cheaply made, low quality, souvenir shirts, mugs, posters, and plush toys. The other two types of booths had a better idea on the G30’s promotion of global unity. The uncommon artists booth with their quality handmade goods that represented their trades, travels, and cultures. Finally, the last type was the concession stands. The food booths were manned by cooks and chefs of the highest caliber. The smells of fresh ingredients being put on the grill was enough for your salivary glands begin to slowly water. You looked at Symmetra but found a worried expression on her face and in her body language.

“Something wrong? First time at a festival?” You asked your new partner.

“There’s just…” Symmetra answered, overwhelmed, “too many choices. Lunch is much easier at the Vishkar commissary. I get what is according to my diet program: a light 150 calorie meal cube.”

You shuddered to think what a meal cube would be, but you ended up asking, “what’s a meal cube?”

Symmetra’s answer did nothing to assuage you, “It’s cube that you eat.”

If what little she said about this “meal cube”, the only conclusion you got was it would be utterly tasteless and bland. So you suggested, “Well, you’re working at Dorado for now. Since they’re paying for the whole thing, just take one of each and see what you like.”

You left Symmetra to her own devices as you searched for a food booth that could have a good lobster roll. Once you found one and paid for it with the passcard, you headed back to your table, and discovered Symmetra took your advice in a way you didn’t expect. While you meant to say one item from each booth, the Vishkar architect took it as one of each item from each booth. The table you had set up for just the two of you ended up being one half filled with food all sorts: corn dogs, french fries, mozzarella sticks, currywurst, jägerschnitzel, A large pretzel, fish tacos, a platter of nachos, quesadillas, chicken parmesan, calamari fritti, caprese salad, focaccia bread, skewers of shrimp tempura, chicken teriyaki, a bento box full of various kinds sushi, and a ramen bowl were among the many food items left that Symmetra had yet to eat. The other half was filled with empty plates and bowls of sauces, bones, and crumbs.

“Are you going to finish all that?” You asked, amused.

“Yes.” Symmetra answered.

“In that case, how are you liking it?”

“I think I … enjoy it. I never realized how much I could eat in one setting.”

“Much better than one of those meal cubes huh?”

Symmetra blushed as you gave extended belly a gentle massage.

“Well… A meal cube is better because… The Vishkar Corporation said so and….” She answered but put down her plate, that look of
regret returning to her face back when Sanjay mentioned Rio de Janerio.

“There’s something the matter with Vishkar?”

“Sometimes I think the Vishkar Corporation… might have done… something unsavory.”

There was just an awkward pause between the two of you. There was something eating at Symmetra's conscious that the rest of Symmetra's meal couldn't snap her out of, but instead...
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.title: The G-30 Cultural Harmony Festival

choices: Head to the safe house and confront Talon
Get some backup, and supper.
Hold off, Talon would be on high alert after the robbery.
Writer's choice
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.content:
Soon afterwards the festival finally was underway, but both of you were anxious as your rear-view vision powers was causing a headache due to the high crowd. Watching over the festival was uneventful, the only time the two of you were called in was to take care of a rowdy tourist who was way too drunk. Once the sun began to set over the Misión Dorado at 6:42 pm, all the booths began closing for the day, and the crowds started to slowly disperse. You gave yourself a sigh of relief.

“How was it?” You asked.

“Surprising orderly.” Symmetra answered, her stomach somehow retaining its largeness from her massive lunch.

You smiled as the two of you made your way back to the Puesta Del Sol Resort, and it took a half hour since left the festival for it to be nighttime in Dorado as you two walked across the Dorado’s beach with Symmetra's ballooned belly swaying with each of her steps. The night sky was as clear as the Gulf of Mexico the city overlooked. You could see the moon in a beautiful waning crescent and the constellation of Scorpius, the constellation of your zodiac sign, front and center in the night sky. To the right of Scorpio, you saw the constellation of Libra. Considering Symmetra was to your right as well, you made a circumstantial guess that her sign would be Libra as well. It was as if the stars were hinting at it. Unfortunately, the moment was broken with the sound of three bullets firing and the shattering of glass.

“What was that?” You asked.

“A gunshot.” Symmetra answered, keeping her calm during the sudden outburst.

“Obviously. Let’s go check out if somebody’s hurt.”

The two of you ran back to town and you saw Symmetra’s large gut didn’t impede her agility in the slightest bit. In ten minutes, and 3 blocks away was the source of the commotion. Somebody had just robbed a local hardware store named Ferretería Babor. The front window was just destroyed, and was the clerk leaning the door frame, clutching his left shoulder which was slowly leaking blood. The nature of the wound looked like the weapon came from a pulse weapon. His wife was on her phone, in a frantic conversation with the emergency services. The time showed at the store's clock was 7:25 PM, which caused you to note that the robbery took place at around 7:15. Thankfully, you knew plenty of Spanish to converse with the injured shopkeeper.

“¿Qué te ha pasado? ¿Estás herido?” <What happened to you? Are you hurt?>

“Du…ele. Ahhh. <It… hurts.>”

“No se preocupe señor, estamos aquí para ayudarlo. ¿Puedes decirme algo sobre el tirador? <Don’t worry sir, we’re here to help. Can you tell me anything about the shooter?>”

“No, él solo ... irrumpió. Espera un minuto ... ¿estás con ... la policía?? <I saw him... trying to steal… some wiring. Wait a minute... are you with... the cops? >”

“No del todo, <Not quite,>” You replied, “Acabo de tener la sensación de que el responsable de esto trabaja para alguien que mi cliente busca. <I just got the feeling whoever’s responsible for this is somebody our client is after.>”

Symmetra on the other hand was staring at the broken window and the many pieces of shattered glass were scattered around both sides of the wall that formerly held it. While Symmetra used her light to fix the window, you helped yourself inside. There weren’t any security cameras in the store, cash register was left in place, the silent alarm was going off and already notified emergency services. and only thing stolen was a trivial number of wiring bundles that were on sale. You didn’t look far for your first clue, as on the ground close to the wiring was a cheap looking white smart phone with a black plastic shell meant to protect the phone from falls and impacts. Considering your gloves didn’t have fingertips and you did not want to get your prints on a potential piece of evidence, you quickly grabbed some empty plastic bags from across the counter, slipped your hands in, and went back and picked up the phone. The first thing you noticed the something was carved into phone’s back. It looked like a bunch of lines with dots that you couldn’t make any sense of. You turned on the phone but was imminently taken a touch password screen.

“Did you find something?” Symmetra asked, finishing repair the window.

“Perp lost his phone in the struggle.” You answered, showing the phone to her. “There’s something on the back and I want to say it’s the password.”

You placed the phone on the Cashier’s bench face down, showing the glyph. Something is Symmetra’s mind just intuitively click. One second later, she leaned forward, pressing her belly against the bench and she flipped the phone screen up with her prosthetic arm. Using the same arm, Symmetra entered the phone’s password started with a vertical line, then made the shape of an S, a dollar sign.

“We’re in.” She told you.

“And how did you know figure out the password so easily?”

“It looked like a hard-light instruction for making a spiral staircase back at the architectural academy.”

“Weird... Looked like a dollar sign to me.” You replied.

The first thing you noticed was the wallpaper. The background was black, and you could see the distinctive red and white emblem of the terrorist organization Talon behind the 4 X 6 grid of applications. You decided to check the photos gallery and your fingers were able to work the phone without, thinking the perp would leave plenty of selfies. That assumption was proven correct as the first 75 percent of the photos contained a blonde American man in his late twenties with a buck toothed smile. All the social media accounts the phone was logged onto identified the suspect as Jimmy Glakes.

“This is the culprit alright.” You said, “LumériCo was right to think that Talon was after them.”

Symmetra pressed a button on her visor, and the visor began scanning Jimmy’s face, bringing up valuable information, such as a criminal record.

“He enlisted in the army to get a jail term reduced but was dishonorably discharged for war crimes. Jimmy Glakes has numerous criminal offenses in the United States: Multiple counts of armed robbery, gun trafficking, possession of controlled substances with intent to sell, and Indecent Exposure.”

“Must be nice getting info from that,” You said, “Anywho, maybe we can look at his text messages, so we can try to figure out his movements.” You said.

You accessed the phone’s text messages app, and the latest conversation Mr. Glakes was involved with somebody named “Nergüi Tanguul”, and from the context of the conversation, he looked he was one of Glakes’s superiors within Talon.

NT: Our engineers spent months spent perfecting the bomb and you happened to lose all the copper wiring?
JG: The wirin’ was all their last time I checked.
NT: You were the last person to look after the bomb and yet the bomb’s wiring is still missing, so it must have been you. Do you know how angry Doomfist will be when the bomb fails to go off in two days? He has everything at stake to make sure the G30 leaders present there are assassinated. Do everyone in involved in this mission a favor and get some replacement wiring!
JG: How am ah supposed to find wirin’ in this joint? All da signs are in Mexican.
NT: … I marked a hardware store closest to your location for you. Please, get the replacement wiring now!

The conversation ended but there was a map attached to Mr. Tanguul’s last message. The map had two locations pinned down: The store, and a place labeled “safe house”. You clicked on the button that was labeled “Safe House” and immediately got an address: Guidance Parkway, 555, Terrace Ridge. Emergency services finally arrived to take the shopkeeper to the emergency room. You left the phone at the store as you were able to mark the safe house’s location on your own map of Dorado. Knowing there talon had a devastating bomb with the world leader's name on it, you had to make your next more quickly.
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.title: The old minor crime leads to...

choices: Symmetra 2.0:  Lock on Beams and Shield Generators
Symmetra 3.0:  Projectile Sentries and Versatile Teleports
Best of Both Worlds: A hybrid of both styles.
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.content:
Following the map, you were led to Terrace Ridge on the northwest corner of the city, overlooking the old fort Castillo. Terrace Ridge was one of the poorer communities in Dorado with a much denser population to boot. Terrace Ridge looked like a slum, with poorly maintained sidewalks, deteriorated benches, and a rusted playground equipment that was in shambles, and litter flying all over the place in the night breeze, with nobody caring for the state their neighborhood was in. Businesses that set up shop in this neighborhood were on the sleazy side, mainly a few “no tell” motels, a couple bars, and a tobacco store.

“Ugh, so much filth lies on these streets.” Symmetra said, making her belly vibrate with each step.

“There’s neighborhoods with character, and then are neighborhoods in serious need of a public works renovation.” You said.

“Come to think of it, Terrace Ridge is where one of the arcologies for Proyecto Armonia would be established.”

“Would be nice for these folks, but whose backyard is it going to be in?”

Your partner’s uneasy look implied couldn’t think of answer, so she decided to change the subject at hand,

“Let’s just focus on Talon. To think a terrorist cell could establish themselves in this city.”

“More like the homeowners are so desperate for money, they put the house on the greatest get rich quick scheme, the rent sharing market, and Talon fooled…” you bluntly answered before you arrived at the safe house, an abandoned, dilapidated apartment complex, causing you to backspace on the last word you just said, “…found a perfectly empty abandoned apartment to squat in.”

To avoid suspicion, you leaned your back to the front window and let your back-vision power do the reconnaissance. You could see at three people in the living room, open kitchen hybrid. None of them looked like they were of Mexican or even Central American ethnicity, confirming your sharing market theory. The one on the couch was Russian, the one in the kitchen was Macedonian, and streaming on tablet on the partial wall/dining table was Libyan. They were in plainclothes, but you could see their uniforms, black and red with Talon’s logo on the chest, along with several assault rifles and shotguns placed on a wall mounted coatrack.

“This is Talon’s safe house alright. I can see the uniforms and a couple of firearms.” You told your partner.

You cracked your knuckles and pulled out your Tommy Laser. Symmetra got out another orb of light manifested it into her weapon, the Photon Projector. It looked like a futuristic pistol with throngs extending from the muzzle, however she put the sidearm to her hip, which was partially obstructed by her large gut, for moment, preparing for the fight with her abilities.

"Let's show them at Order overcome Chaos" She said.
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.title: Character limititation problems.

choices: A crowd has formed outside, the police, the press... and Sanjay.
Hunt down the bomb now, the sooner the better.
The two of you report back to LumériCo before it gets late.
Writer's choice 1.
Writer's choice 2.
1553322223322223232223222222323233213121.content:
Symmetra held her palm out forward, getting another teleporter pad ready. She placed the first one on the ground behind you. Then she then placed what looked like another teleporter pad straight against the wall.

“A little short for a teleporter?” you asked.

“It’s a Shield Generator.” Symmetra answered, it will give us protection.”

Once the shield generator was established and a holograph of a spherical barrier of hexagons was displayed above it, you felt your flesh being enveloped in a force field, leaving a transparent cyan sheen to your skin. You flex your arms and hands to feel how the shielding would affect your movements, which was non obstructive. Symmetra took hold of her Photon Projector out of her holster and a ball of light was forming out of the sidearm.

“Good to know. Could always use some extra durability.” You replied, putting a fresh battery into your Tommy Laser.

You counted down the timing with your free hand. When the countdown expired, Symmerta placed the second teleporter in the kitchen corner of the enemies’ hideaway, you knocked on door, getting their attention.

“Finally! Those damn fish taquitos are late!” You heard Russian Talon goon say, having no idea what he and has coconspirators were in for.

“Don’t worry,” You said, “It’s on the house!”

You kicked in the front door the moment you felt the doorknob turn. The impact staggered the Russian minion and Symmetra delivered the follow up by firing the charged up ball of light form her photon projector, blasting the Russian before he had a chance the open the door, knocking him to the floor. Before any of the other talon minions reacted, you backflipped into the teleporter entry pad, warping to straight behind them, delivering a backwards clothesline to the back of one the Macedonian’s head. You took a backwards aim with your Tommy Laser, firing a barrage of lasers which found their marks on the Libyan mook's back before he could grab a firearm. Your ambush was successful, but from your position, you could hear reinforcements coming in from upstairs.

“Reinforcements incoming!” You yelled to Symmetra.

Two more Talon soldiers were coming out of hall, having been alerted to the ruckus the moment you kicked in the door. Your partner entered the apartment complex and threw 6 orbs of light from her Symmetra's palm like pellets of a shotgun. The orbs became sentry turrets that armed themselves in less than a second. Two more opponents did make their way in, and the six sentries fired powerful slowing lasers, electrocuting and immobilizing them for you to deliver a strong flying knee attack to their chests. The next two goons were Talon assassins with blades mounted on each forearm. They were agile enough that they could power their way through the sentries and lunged forward at both of you. Symmetra was able to fend off her attacker by blocking the swipes with kicks and strikes with her cybernetic hand as her photon projector fired a powerful beam that locked to the assassin. The beam forced a current of amplified light into the Talon soldier’s body that grew in power the longer the beam locked on.

You on the other hand had to use metallic stool as an improvised shield to block the blades, which wasn’t as effective as you ended up getting a few scrapes and cuts to your personal shield. The Photon Projector’s beam forced the assassin that was battling Symmetra to pass out, and your partner quickly turned the photon projector over to your attack, having her collapse to the ground faster than the first. Symmetra quickly helped up to your feet. After you thanked Symmetra, both looked at the knocked-out Talon mooks. Symmetra summoned a pair of white plastic handcuffs from her prosthetic hand, gave one pair to you, and then the two of you started putting the cuffing the unconscious goons. As you placed the last cuffs, Symmetra caught notice of someone. There were one more talon agent, a blonde American, who trying was trying to sneak out of the safe house. Both of you knew who your next target was.

“It’s Glakes! He’s trying to escape!” She exclaimed.

“Not for long! He’s not the one to hit the ground running!” you said, tossing down a special device, a Pursuit Bomb, to the ground.

The Pursuit Bomb’s shape looked roughly like a computer mouse with a robotic scorpion mounted on it. The Pursuit Bomb's coloration was the same as your Tommy laser, white with green accents. The Pursuit Bomb took off after its target. A few seconds later, you both heard a bang and a series of thuds to indicate that Jimmy was tumbling down the stairs. At the bottom of the stairwell was the dizzy but uninjured suspect of your investigation, Jimmy Glakes.

“We’ve been looking all over you, Jimmy.” You told, lifting him by his chest.

“Ah didn’t do nothing.” Glakes lied.

“We know you robbed Ferretería Babor!” Symmetra answered back.

“Ah wasn’t near that place.”

“Where your phone was found.” Your partner bluntly added.

“Ah’d never lose mah phone. It was on mah pocket da whol time since 7:15.” Glakes replied, confused at the statement you just said, but fortunately incriminated himself by the time of the robbery.

Symmetra reached into Jimmy’s pants pocket and surprisingly there was a phone it. She took it out the phone and held it up to yours for comparison. Both of you were in for a surprise, the two were completely identical, from the make and model, to the password, even the apps and texts were the same, including the one that instructed Jimmy to rob that hardware store. The only difference was that strange glyph that on the phone’s back covering was missing, and there was a new text sent from the phone just two minutes ago sent as a warning to the other Talon agents out in the city, “Safe house is being raided!”

After you slapped the cuffs on Jimmy, your subsequent investigation in the rest of the messy rooms apartment complex just turned up a portion of the stolen wiring, more firearms, narcotics, blood money, but no bomb. There was one room in Talon’s safe house left to investigate, a master bedroom that doubled as a makeshift office. It was all neat and orderly in contrast to other rooms, the bed was neatly made, a rectangular throw was placed parallel to bed’s left and right sides, and on the nightstand was a file, and three photographs had some familiar holes in them. You just realized that this was the dossier from the flight this morning, but what was it doing here?

You looked at one of the photos and its relevant intelligence and said, "Hey, LumériCo hit the intel jackpot. It seems we found this Nergüi Tanguul person, and he's one of the members of Talon's council and their head director of Engineering and Logistics to boot."

Nergüi looked like a man in his thirties, with a notable X shaped scar that ran diagonally downward from the edges of his forehead to his cheeks. His hair was brown, had a small goatee, and a mustache in the style of, for lack of a better word, “Fu Manchu”. While LumériCo’s intelligence indicated he was a former military engineer from Mongolia, his eyes indicated otherwise for some reason. You gave Nergüi's photo to Symmetra but the Talon’s Engineering and Logistics Head Director’s face was starting to look awfully familiar to her, but she couldn’t put a name to it yet.

As for yourself, you tried to find some other clues in Nergüi’s room and all it took was a pulling the nightstand’s drawer to find the bomb’s schematics. According to the schematics, Talon’s bomb would use the research of somebody named Dr. Siebren de Kuiper. The “Spatial Rending” bomb would envelop a large area in a black hole for a short period of time. The area would be large enough to not only destroy the area designated for the G30 summit, but a few adjacent neighborhoods as well. The expected death toll in a city like Dorado would be likely be in the thousands

“Okay, this is pretty unnerving. Looks like in three 3 days, Talon is going to wipe out the G30 conference with use their special black hole bomb."

Symmetra took heed, and tried to contact Sanjay, pressing a button into her visor.

“This is Satya Vaswani, I would like to make an emergency call to supervisor Sanjay.”

“I’m sorry but Sanjay’s whereabouts is classified to under qualified Vishkar personnel.” An automated voiced immediately replied

“What!? But Sanjay is my supervisor…” Symmetra replied, confused.

“I’m sorry Ms. Vaswani you do not have clearance to speak to him.” The voice once again reasserted.

The automated voice then terminated Symmetra's call, and soon after, you could see fear in Symmetra eyes for the first time. There was plenty of issue about this investigation frustratingly that didn’t make any sense.

“I’m starting to get the feeling this whole bust was staged.” You said, “If Jimmy didn’t lose his phone, then the one we found must have been planted by someone. Someone who would have known you be able to figure it out.”

“Are you suggesting…?”

“Would someone like Glakes be admitted into Vishkar?”

Symmetra paused for a moment, resting her left hand on her big bloated stomach, and then answered, “Of course… not.”

“Exactly. That phone we found at the hardware store was… planted there for us to find…”

“Because the phone lead us to the location of the safe house?” Symmetra replied, catching on to what you were implying.

“Precisely.” You confirmed.

“Do you think it was LumériCo?”

“...No,” you answered, “if that was the case, we would have been just the middlemen and Lumérico would just be wasting money hiring us. I don't know how, but this mole is playing everyone.”

Symmetra could help but agree.

"Ugh. My head." You thought to yourself, as you soon slowly felt your migraine receding in aggression, giving you some much needed clarity, noting how much sunlight was shining through the window.

"Wait...I don't remember having a bedroom window! Or...do I?" You contemplated, quickly noticing how off everything felt.

After all, last time you checked, you lived in a one-bedroom apartment in Queens, New York. But now...it appeared as if you were in some sort of...oversized RV?

Instead of your familiar scene of a one-person bed with a bedroom TV and other necessities, you now sat in an undoubtedly large two-person king-sized bed, complete with an assortment of clothes strewn about. However, you soon became aware of something rather surprising:

Instinctively, you quickly covered your ears to protect your hearing, which proved as a momentary respite, to which you looked towards the wide door leading out of the bedroom as you thought, "...What the hell is going on?!"

Knowing that you weren't going to find answers by simply lying in an unfamiliar bed, you quickly unfurled the bedsheets from your person, to which you attempted to find any clothes that'll fit you, which came in the form of a pair of mahogany sweatpants. Quickly, you hastily pulled up the sweatpants over your legs and pulled the pants strings to fasten it around your lower half. From there, you carefully traversed your way out out the bedroom, to which left you entering a large yet homely main area of the mobile home, which looked to have a slight futuristic European aesthetic to it, as you tread through the area, passing by a photo of you alongside some strikingly familiar faces...

Much to your currently stressed hearing, you calmly (albeit sluggishly) tracked the source of all that mechanized racket, which seemed to inevitably lead you outside, where you shielded your eyes a little from the intense change in brightness. Once your eyes had fully adjusted to the sunlit day, you soon took note of the sprawling grassy plains, rolling hills, and the snowy European mountaintops in the distance, along with a small yet quaint countryside town just a mile or two away from here.

But then, the violent shearing sounds soon came to an abrupt halt, as you slowly turned around, only to now bear witness to...

And yet, surprisingly enough, she didn't seem to show the slightest hint of fatigue from hefting around that much girth, minus the sweat on her brow from tinkering with the machinery, as Reinhardt tested his Crusader Armor by flexing his hands and arms in a mere test of articulation, to which he then exuberantly hopped up onto his metallic feet uncharacteristically for someone at his age whilst he cheered, "Ha Ha!! Wunderbar, Brigitte! I feel like I'm in my prime again!!"

"Yep. That's DEFINITELY Reinhardt! Nobody I know gets as excited as him." You mentally joked, to which your thoughts were soon abruptly halted when Reinhardt took notice of you, now bearing a rather jovial grin on his bearded face as he exclaimed, "Ah! Look who's finally awake!"

Upon hearing him, you somehow guessed that he was referring to you, just as Reinhardt walked up to you, which easily made you feel small compared to the muscle-bound German in Crusader Armor, as he firmly patted you on the back with a metal hand as he quipped, "How are you feeling, my friend?"

"Uh...Fine, I guess? Sorry, I had a rough time sleeping." You hesitantly answered, trying to make up a good enough excuse to convince the two Europeans that this wasn't out of place, despite your initial shock upon waking up in what you now assume to be the world of Overwatch. Fortunately, it worked, as Reinhardt gave you a hearty slap on the back whilst he jested, "*chuckle* Wunderbar, my friend! Now, go get yourself some roden (grub). Ve got a big day ahead of us!"

Figuring you'd best take his advice, you calmly walked toward the nearby patio table set up outside adjacent to the RV, which was undoubtedly packed with some foodstuffs as part of a complete breakfast. Some of which you figured was for Brigitte, considering her current size at the moment. From there, Reinhardt soon motioned to the obese Brigitte and quipped, "Same goes for you as well, child!"

"I'm almost done with upgrading my armor, gudfader(godfather). Just need to do one more calibration." She chirped, her fattened body jostling ever so slightly with each bit of movement. However, Reinhardt soon pulled her a bit from her position whilst he retorted, "I know you do, Meine Liebste (my dear). But I promised your Mutter (mother) that you're getting enough to eat. Mach dir keine Sorgen (Don't worry), your "calibrations" vill still be here vhen you return."

Of course, as if right on cue, Brigitte's stomach soon began to audibly growl for sustenance, which caused a bit of a profound blush to appear on her fuller face. "*sigh* ...I guess you're right, gudfader (godfather)." She admitted, much to her stomach's insistent pleas. And with that, Brigitte soon lumbered over to the patio table alongside you, sitting down on a stool that could barely contain her large rear end.

Once there, she soon looked upon you with a rather affectionate expression on her fuller face, to which she then proceeded to wrap you in a surprisingly soft embrace. Although, despite not exactly being into fatter women, being hugged by an obese Brigitte felt quite...plush. In a good way, of course.

"...Did you sleep well last night, sötnos (sweetie)?" She caringly asked, to which took you initially by surprise at how you could understand her when she spoke in her native Swedish dialect. And yet, what stood out in your mind was what she called you by:

"Sweetie". As in like someone who's in a romantic relationship. A romantic relationship with Brigitte!

It felt like hours when you had to adjust your mental faculties upon hearing such a realization. And yet, as your eyes moved to distract your mind a bit to compensate for your shock, you could easily see a good view of Brigitte's signature Crusader Armor. But upon a better inspection, you can clearly see that...
1553322223322223232223222222323233213422.title: Armor Repairs & Relationship Revelations!

choices: "(Name), you're gonna have to transform!"
"(Name), Get in! You're driving us there."
Actually, she said something else instead...
1553322223322223232223222222323233213422.content:
But whilst the rotund Brigitte began to devour her large breakfast with an almost gluttonous gusto and fervor, you could clearly see the metallic ensemble that was her own set of Crusader Armor, which seemingly wasn't built with a helmet in mind like Reinhardt's was. And much to your surprise...It was actually completely finished, in both mechanical design and paint application, sporting a distinct color palette of bright construction yellow-orange, stainless steel grey, and dark leathery brown.

https://images.app.goo.gl/oPajNQyq5Rrdmq...

However, upon closer inspection, it appeared that the armor was MUCH larger in size due to Brigitte's now corpulent form, especially in the abdominal region, which seemed to have several segmented armored plates over the less insulated areas of the suit of armor. Suffice to say, Brigitte's signature armor looked stretched out.

Though, much like Reinhardt, Brigitte's armor was equipped with a Barrier Shield, but it wasn't as expansive as her godfather's, only able to shield either herself or to protect a key teammate like Mercy or other healers. However, Brigitte compensates this with a custom-built Rocket Flail, which had a much greater range than Reinhardt's signature Rocket Hammer, due to the Rocket Flail being equipped with a 35 foot long chain attached to the Flail's head, which could be launched at damaging speeds and retracted with quick velocity.

Overall, it was pretty much one-to-one with everything you knew about Brigitte as a playable character. Yet, one recurring thought came to you time and again as you blankly stared at the gorging Brigitte:

"...Why was she so fat?" You kept thinking, still attempting to wrap your confused mind as to how and why this happened. However, that train of thought came to an abrupt halt when the rotund brunette momentarily looked up at you, swallowing a whole waffle in the process then asked, "...Do I got something on me?"

"Oh! Um...no. I'm just...thinking about stuff, that's all." You quickly retorted, attempting to conjure a convincing retort to your current demeanor, to which Brigitte soon gave you an understanding smirk, placing a chubby hand upon her wide adipose-coated hips and replied, "Åh, jag ser vad som händer (Oh, I see what's going on)! ...You're worried about mig (me) when Winston gave the recall order, aren't you, sötnos (sweetie)?"

"Recall order? Wait... Is she...talking about what happened in Honor and Glory?" You thought, your mind quickly putting the puzzle pieces together as to 'When' in the Overwatch series you currently found yourself in, since you remember before waking up in this world, you were watching the BlizzCon 2019 convention on YouTube when Blizzard Entertainment publicly revealed Overwatch 2, as your thoughts continued, "And...if this is just after Winston gave out that recall order to everyone from Overwatch, then that means..."

But before your thoughts came to the inevitable conclusion as to the situation you were now in, you soon felt a large metal hand grasp your shoulder, which promptly made you look behind you to see Reinhardt, now with his Crusader helmet off, thus revealing his entire head and face. What surprised you was it's appearance, as his chalk white hair was now currently tied up in a short ponytail, along with a full-on Santa Claus-esque beard and mustache. And yet, Reinhardt remained as full of energy as ever, where he casually jested, "Come now, friend! Eat up! You'll need your strength for today!"

Figuring there was no use arguing with the massive man in Crusader Armor, you started digging into your stack of Belgian waffles with a fork and knife, whilst your thoughts finally pieced together where in the Overwatch timeline you found yourself in, as you contemplated, "...Brigitte has already completed her Crusader Armor. Reinhardt's hair and beard have grown, yet he's still using the Crusader Armor he wore when he first debuted in Overwatch. If I had to wager a guess, that means...the events of Zero Hour haven't happened yet!"

From what you knowingly remember of the Zero Hour cinematic trailer, Null Sector, a terrorist extremist group hellbent on achieving Omnic rights through violent means, attacked the city of Paris in force. The reunited Overwatch members Winston, Tracer, and Mei were the first to arrive, followed by Genji, Reinhardt and Brigitte, Echo, and Mercy. Together, they were even able to take down a Null Sector Titan, a massive building-sized bipedal Omnic decked out with an arsenal of ballistic and energy weapons.

Suffice to say, it was a rather climactic battle.

And yet, one question soon emerged within your thoughts:

"...How do you fit in all of this?"

However, before you could even theorize an answer, the portable TV soon came alive, as it showed the city of Paris under siege by numerous Null Sector Nullifiers and several Titans, as a French female news reporter documented the harrowing event, saying only the following:

"Nous sommes ici dans les rues du centre-ville de Paris (We're here live on the streets of downtown Paris)!"

"Comme vous pouvez le voir clairement derrière moi, la ville est assiégée par use armée d'Omnics (As you can clearly see behind me, the city is under siege by an army of Omnics)!"

"Ils attaquent sans arrêt, alors que les civils fuient les rues et leurs maisons (They're attacking nonstop, as civilians are fleeing the streets and their homes)!"

But then, before the news reporter could continue, a Titan Omnicfired upon her and the cameraman with an energy weapon from it's chest, as the screen went to black as a result. From there, you soon looked back at both Reinhardt and Brigitte, who now bore a pair of serious expressions, to which the obese brunette swiftly gulped down what she was currently devouring, the n quickly waddled/run over towards her Crusader Armor whilst she exclaimed, "Reinhardt: Get inside the RV! We're heading to Paris!"

"Du hast es (You got it)!" Reinhardt replied, putting his Crusader helmet back on as he rushed inside the RV. Moments later, Brigitte re-emerged, now fully clad in her Crusader Armor, which made her appear almost 250 pounds heavier due to the bulk of the armor. From there, she holstered her Rocket Flail upon her right hip whilst she fastened the Barrier Shield device on her left gauntlet, as she calmly sashayed towards the RV driver's cab, spoke toward you and continued...
1553322223322223232223222222323233213422.title: A Time & A Place

choices: Meanwhile, Reinhardt & Brigitte reunited with Winston, Tracer, & Mei in Paris.
Soon, you reached Paris, as you began to assault Null Sector's forces.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222323233213422.content:
"(Name): If Null Sector has that many Titan-class Omnics, then we're gonna need you to let out your other half." Brigitte firmly stated, to which left you internally confused as to what the hell she was ranting about. Your mind reeling a little in confusion as you mentally questioned, "...What the hell is she talking about?"

"She's talking about Us, you moron." A voice growled inside your head, which caught you completely off-guard, as you quickly turned your head left to right in a frantic state, yet Brigitte behaved as if this was a normal occurrence, as she then asked, "Do you think you can do it?"

"*sigh* I...I-I'll try. Just go! I'll catch up with you." You instinctively retorted, to which the rotund Brigitte complied with a single nod. From there, the RV sped from zero to fifty in a few seconds, heading straight for Paris, thus leaving you to deal with this conundrum that you've gotten yourself into.

"*sigh* ...What the hell was that all about?" You said to yourself, rubbing the back of your head in the process, just as that other voice in your head sprang up again as it growled, "What the hell do you think you're doing?"

"Seriously, what are you?! Just a figment of my confusion?" You scoffed, where you then unexpectedly felt your body being violently flung back with tremendous force, landing on your back in the process! But then, you suddenly felt this painful pounding sensation in your head, causing you to instinctively grasp your scalp in pain, gasping a breath whilst you groaned, "Wh-What the flying hell is going on here!?!"

In response, you soon felt yourself being flung again,this time towards a natural nearby pond, as you gazed at your reflection, but...it was not truly YOUR reflection.

Staring back at you, there stood what looked to be some sort of monstrous humanoid creature, bearing a deathly gray pigment to his skin, with extremely shortened hair on the scalp, as well as missing the signs of a human nose, with facial features akin to a brute archetype. What stood out the most were the creature's hulking muscular physique, the black chitin-like skin on the arms and hands, and the blood red eyes.

https://images.app.goo.gl/nEbzL7f1a7Nxd8...

Suffice to say, it felt like you were looking at a literal monster, still in shock upon realizing that this could be your reflection, as you hesitantly spoke, "Wh-What...Wh-What's happened t-to me?"

But suddenly, you felt as if your hand was possessed, as it forced you to look closer at your monstrous reflection as it sneered and grunted, "Look into my eyes, (Name). The way I see it, We can do whatever We want!"

Realizing what your dark reflection wanted due to an eerily familiar situation a had certain green-skinned Marvel character had, you tried shrugging off the mental temptations as you screamed, "No. No! I WON'T LET YOU OUT!!"

"...Do you want her to die?" It inquisitively questioned, cocking a caveman-esque brow as it mentally forced you to look at it. At first, you continued to resist. However, you couldn't help but wonder who this abominable...thing was referring to, as you slowly looked at it and asked, "...What?"

"The girl, dumbass! Do you want her to die?" It asked, this time with a more firm tone to it's grungy voice, asking you a mere question. Initially, you weren't sure about the topic. However, these dark gloomy thoughts of Brigitte being killed in horrific fashion by Null Sector apoeared in your mind's eye, her screams of pain and agony echoing through the recesses of your conscious being. Ultimately, you inevitably knew who the creature was referencing, as you bowed your head in an almost defeated state and lowly muttered, "...No. I...I want her to live."

"...I can help her. We...can help her. All you have to do...is let. Me. Out." It explained, which sent a cold death-like shiver across your body, as if allowing something horrendous to outright possess you. At first, you wanted to persevere and continue resisting such temptations. Yet, in the end though, somehow...deep down, the creature was right.

But then, another emotion began to boil within you: Not fear...but rage. Vengeful, unbiased rage. Your brow curled and furrowed into an enraged scowl. You weren't going to let those damned Omnics lay a single claw on Brigitte. Not today. Not tomorrow! NOT EVER!!

But as your mind was clouded by these violently enraged thoughts, your body underwent a startling metamorphosis! At first, your eyes changed into the creature's. Then, you began to grow and lengthen in size and body mass. From there, as your pants began to rip and tear from the transformation into a set of ripped makeshift shorts, your arms and hands began to become coated into the glistening chitin-esque skin, which stopped when it reached your shoulders!

But when it was all said and done, your transformation was complete, as you then stood upright with a thunderous stomp, where you then unleashed a howling roar and screamed,

"GRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGHHH!!!!!!"

Instinctively, you soon headed toward Paris as well, performing a powerful locomotive jump, and then another, and another, along with doing a vicious seventy-five mile an hour sprint! All that mattered now...was Brigitte. Nothing more. Nothing less.
1553322223322223232223222222323233213422.title: Letting Out The Monster

1553322223322223232223222222323233213422.content:
Meanwhile, Brigitte and Reinhardt rushed into Paris, speeding through the streets of the French metropolis, running overall several Null Sector Nullifiers with their RV, with Brigitte putting her driving skills to the test! And as they made it to where Winston, Tracer, and Mei were located, Brigitte made the vehicle perform a 180, thus allowing Reinhardt to lead the assault as he lunged through the RV roof, Rocket Hammer in hand, and let out a warcry as he yelled, "Hammer...BOOM!!"

And with a tremendous force, he slammed the hammer down against a bunched-up group of Nullifiers, while Brigitte quickly dismounted from the vehicle, Rocket Flail in hand, as she decimated several Nullifiers with a good chain swing. Once they were down, she blew a hair out of her face, pulling off a stoic heroic pose alongside her godfather.

"Yes!! The calvary's here!" Tracer cheered, emboldened by the reinforcements, where she then Blinked into the fight, as Winston suddenly looked upwards to see a familiar robotic individual soaring through the air whilst blasting away several Nullifiers coming from an intersection. The machine looked at Winston, a cheerful smile adorned it's blue face as it cheered, "Hello Winston!"

"Echo!" Winston shouted, becoming pleasantly surprised to see an old friend. And last but not least, like an angelic figure from the heavens, Mercy descended down towards the injured Mei, putting an arm on her wounded shoulder and reassured, "Let's get you back in the fight."

Mei stared in amazement to see the great Dr. Angela Ziegler in the flesh. However, such a hopeful turn of events suddenly took a dangerous turn, as one of the Null Sector Titans walked toward them, letting out an inhumanly mechanical roar, as it was charging up the energy weapon in it's chest.

Instinctively, both Brigitte and Reinhardt locked themselves in a defensive position whilst the corpulent brunette exclaimed, "Interlock shields!" But as they felt the energy beam make impact with their combined Barrier Shield, all of the present Overwatch soon heard a monstrously beastly roar as it howled:

"HYDE SMASH!!!!!"

From there, they quickly looked up towards the source of the roar, only to see you in your current form, lunging towards the Titan from the air, black hands curled into a set of fists, ready to smash the titanic machine to kingdom come! To most of them, they were flabbergasted, but Reinhardt and Brigitte smiled upon seeing you come to the rescue in the nick of time! The Titan was momentarily stunned from such a powerful attack by it's smaller challenger, with it's primary directive changed to the immediate threat at hand!

"What is that...thing?!" Winston yelled, about as surprised as everyone minus the two individuals in Crusader Armor. Of course, Brigitte looked back at them, a reassured smile upon her fuller face and simply retorted, "...My Boyfriend!"

In response, Tracer and Winston looked at one another in confusion and simultaneously said, "...Boyfriend?"

"HYDE HATE TITAN!!! YOU NO HURT BRIGITTE!!!!"

You roared, as you rushed at the Titan, as you quickly grabbed a nearby car and tossed it at the Titan's left leg, then blitzed it with a powerful ground smash, sending a destructive shockwave against the mechanical behemoth! In retaliation, it fired several missiles at you, to which you quickly sprinted at 75 miles an hour to avoid them, quickly catch one of the missiles mid-jump, as you then launched yourself at the Omnic with relentless fury, slamming the missile right into the Titan's head, damaging it's optic sensors in the process!

But then, a second Titan appeared whilst you were fighting the other one, to which Brigitte and Reinhardt did the same move as before, as the Titan opened fire on the group!

"How are we going to stop it?" Mercy asked, to which Winston looked back towards Mei, realizing what could work against the Titan: Mei's Cryo-pack. In response, he quickly retorted, "Mei, your backpack!"

Mei looked back at Winston, gasping upon realizing his plan and swiftly replied, "That could work!"

From there, Mei quickly took off her Cryo-pack, putting it on the ground to tinker with it so it could be used as a bomb, but she needed a detonator for the payload as she stated, "Tracer: Pulse Bomb!"

"Here you go!" Tracer replied, quickly handing her one of the Brit's Pulse Bombs, whilst you kept pounding at the Titan, but then momentarily looked at Brigitte and Reinhardt to see them struggling against the other Titan! Instinctively, you let out another haymaker, then proceeded to tear off the Titan's massive energy cannon on it's right arm, then tossed it at the other Omnic with such destructive force and inertia whilst you roared,

"LEAVE THEM ALONE!!!! HYDE SMASH YOU!!!!!"

The force from the thrown debris sent the Titan reeling some, as it attempted to reinsert it's mechanized bearings! "Woohoo!! Come on, (Name)! Hit it with everything you got!" Brigitte yelled, cheering you on as you fought, her belly momentarily jiggling from such abrupt movement!

From there, Winston looked at Tracer and exclaimed, "Go long!" "Right!" She chirped, Blinking forward as Winston threw the makeshift bomb at Tracer like a football, to which Tracer grabbed it midair, heading towards the first Titan. However, as the Titan attempted to grab Tracer in it's hand, Genji leapt in from the side, cutting through the Titan's limb in one clean swing as he yelled, "Ryūjin no kae wo kurae!!"

Tracer passed through the opening left by Genji, as she landed into the hole left by Genji from earlier! From there, she gently placed the bomb down inside the Titan, then quickly used her Recall ability to get out of the machine's insides, just in time for the bomb to go off without a hitch!

A blast of cryogenic energy ruptured throughout the Titan, as it was soon rendered completely frozen solid! Frozen in place, it soon began to crumble into millions of frozen shards, causing a flurry of tiny ice shards to disperse all over as the machine was destroyed on a molecular level!

Meanwhile, as the dust settled, you finally demolished the other Titan with destructive ease, where you stood upon it's lifeless form, then triumphantly roared,

"HYDE STRONGEST THERE IS!!!!! GRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGHH!!!!!!!!"

Suffice to say, it was a tremendous victory for the group. And as you jumped off the dead Omnic you can see Brigitte and Reinhardt interacting with their reunited friends, with Brigitte having her fuller facial cheeks grasped by Tracer, as the cheery Brit quipped about how much Brigitte had grown.

Of course, as Tracer introduced Mei to everyone, Reinhardt of course had to make an ice-related pun like "Ice to meet you!", much to Brigitte's mere embarrassment. And as you soon approached Brigitte and the others...

1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
World of Warcraft. Out of the many massive multiplayer online role-playing games (or MMORPG for short) that you have played for the past decade, World of Warcraft was always the one franchise you've kept coming back to for years. From it's encapsulating yet complex stories to the overabundance of lore within the world of Azeroth, World of Warcraft was certainly a worthwhile series, despite the monthly subscription.

You finished up another play session as a female Worgen Paladin at level 105, stretching your arms outward out of yawning exhaustion, especially since the sun had already set some time ago. Shortly after logging off from your WoW account, you shut down your computer and sluggishly made your way back to your bed, collapsing upon the mattress almost immediately.

However, little did you realize at that point, that things were about to change in some unexpected ways...

======
-- 8 Hours Later... --
======

You groggily stir from your slumber, as if you were experiencing a hangover minus the alcohol. And yet... Something felt off. First off, you remember passing out on your front side, as you now noticed that your lower half was covered by several sets of luscious silken cobalt blue bedsheets.

"...What the hell?" You whispered, still a tad confused as to what had happened. You placed a hand against your forehead, calmly rubbing it in confusion. And yet, despite just waking from slumber, you soon noticed that your bedroom appeared...different, as if it had undergone exuberant amounts of renovation.

"Uther. Dear...Uther. I...I'm so...sorry..." A voice rang out in a muttering hushed tone, which certainly surprised you a substantial amount, almost making you jump out of bed in surprise. However, you soon regained your composure, as you then realize that you weren't the only individual inside the now estranged bedroom, as you can clearly see something large looming underneath the silken bedsheets, outlined by the moonlit sky gleaming through what appeared to be stained glass windows.

<The song "Tristram" from Diablo 2 kicks in>

Your curiosity began to take hold, recognizing the voice to be pronouncely female in sound. Carefully, you slowly reached out toward the massive lump beside you, desiring to know who it was you were sleeping with, only for this unknown individual to unknowingly reveal herself before you instead.

In appearance, she was certainly beautiful, despite appearing to be weighing a little over 500 to 600 pounds in size. "...Who is she?" You thought to yourself, as your eyes slowly ascended her rotund form, ending at the mysterious woman's head. Judging from her appearance alone, she was without a doubt one hundred percent Human, as she beared a rounded out but heart-shaped face, complete with plump facial cheeks, luscious full lips, and the subtle hints of a double chin.

At first, you thought it was just an ordinary woman...but then you took notice of her lengthy hair. It was a rather peculiar set of hair. Most of it was colored a stark marble white, save for a noticeable streak of golden blonde running the middle left side of her frontal lobe, as the streak of blonde hair extended from her lengthy bangs to the tail's end of her voluminous mane.

At first, you didn't initially recognize who lumbered beside you. That is, until you looked ahead of the strange woman and noticed a distinguished object: An ornate yet intricate staff, which held what appeared to be a bright cobalt blue crystal as thick as a human head and as long as a man's vertebrae, as it bore a finely sharpened point at the tip of the staff. The crystal itself was firmly held within this ornately designed clasp, like a set of golden fingertips clasping a bauble. From there, the clasp was attached to a long but ornately carved staff pole, as a small figurehead was attached to the other end of the staff.

However, from gazing upon the staff did your mind soon come to the realization of who you were sleeping with, as you thought, "...That staff...It..I-It's the Staff of Antonidas! And...If that's the Staff of Antonidas, th-then that means..." Upon easily recognizing the staff and it's importance, your eyes soon looked back towards the slumbering woman before you, your thoughts soon connecting the pieces simultaneously, your brow raised in shock as you whispered, "...I-I was sleeping with Jaina Proudmoore!"

In response, you were completely shocked to now realize that the slumbering woman before you was none other than the famed and fan-favorite Jaina Proudmoore, the notorious Daughter of the Sea, a powerful Archmage, the Lord Admiral of Kul Tiras, and many other titles. Out of the numerous important characters within the Alliance faction, Jaina Proudmoore was always considered your most favorite character of the bunch. Sure, you like Varian Wrynn and his son, Anduin, and some of the other Alliance leaders, but it was Jaina Proudmoore that always caught your attention, despite the awful occurrences she has experienced in her life, whether it was witnessing her beloved Prince Arthas turn to the dark side and becoming the dreaded Lich King, or even the heinous bombing of Theramore.

Suffice to say, Jaina Proudmoore was the very reason you always chose the Alliance over the Horde every time you boot up World of Warcraft, which made you realize you have a major crush on her. And judging from the contrasting colors of her hair, this meant you were undoubtedly in bed with a post-Theramore bombing Jaina Proudmoore, as the bombing of Theramore was what caused her hair to change so drastically.

And yet, as you felt your inner Jaina fan beginning to scream internally like a schoolgirl, reality soon pulled you back to the surface, as you soon returned to noticing Jaina's substantially larger physique jutting out from underneath the cobalt silken bedsheets.

"That's...weird. I don't remember Jaina Proudmoore being fat, let alone THIS fat." You thought to yourself, as you further examined the now rotund Archmage. Below her now chubby but still smooth head, face, and neck, you could clearly comprehend Jaina's newfound enormity. On her torso, her generous breasts had ballooned considerably, jumping from a D-Cup to a gargantuan Double H-Cup, as they were censored by the bedsheets, with only her bustline exposed. Her arms, once lithe, now bore a noticeable thickness and softness on them, complete with somewhat chubby hands and digits.

Looking past her enlarged bosom, Jaina now sported a substantially noticeable paunch of a belly, as it slowly inflated and deflated with each unconscious breath from the sleeping Archmage, as said paunch was easily noticeable underneath the silk-laden covers. But as you gazed further down Jaina's form, you could obviously tell that her lower half was just as bulky, complete with round, bulbous buttcheeks, a pair of burgeoning hips and tubby waistline, and equally meaty thighs, calves, and mildly plump feet.

Overall, the once slim and lithe Jaina Proudmoore had somehow ballooned up to a whopping 500 to possibly 600 pounds, as she subconsciously shifted her hefty self into a more comfortable sleeping position. Of course, you soon noticed that her hair seemed to be undone, and not in a intricate ponytail braid, as seen in the new Battle For Azeroth expansion that came out some time ago.

"...She's gotta at least weigh over five hundred pounds if she looks like this." You whispered, hoping that you don't stir her from her slumber. After all, as much as you felt like this was a dream come true for you to be sleeping with the real Jaina Proudmoore, you couldn't help but feel like there was more going on here than you think.

In contemplation, you had two choices laid out before you. One: You could sneak out of the bedroom and investigate some. Who knows? You might've somehow been magically transported to Azeroth for all you know. But then came the second option: If you are now indeed in the World of Warcraft universe, then something in the back of your mind was screaming at you to find a mirror.

In the end though...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: One Substantial Sorceress

choices: You were still a male Human. Thank goodness.
You were now a female Worgen. Uh oh...
You were now a female Worgen, only you're now as fat as Jaina!
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
Like a gnawing scratching feeling in the recesses of your subconscious, the logic of investigating this place soon faltered against the raw instinct of needing to find a mirror, as a bead of sweat trickled down your forehead, as your thoughts raced whilst you placed your hands against the sides of your head and muttered, "...I need to find a mirror."

From there, you quickly but carefully unfurled the bedsheets from your person, then dismounted yourself from the bed, as you looked back and soon realize how massive the bed was, now appearing to be large and sturdy enough to bare more than two people, decorated with golden laced masonry on the bedrests.

However, such comprehension would have to be on hold, as you soon head toward a nearby door that hopefully led to a bathroom, where you would hopefully find a mirror to see your reflection. You looked back at the slumbering Jaina twice or thrice to make sure she was still sound asleep.

After a minute or two of tip-toeing your way across the room, you soon reached the wooden door, turning the bronze doorknob to open it, which revealed a large but ornate bathroom, certainly one fitting of Jaina Proudmoore's social status. Your eyes deliberately scanned the entirety of the bathroom, taking in each intricate detail of the hygienic dwellings.

Far off to the left, there was a downright massive shower stall off in one corner, as the shower walls displayed these custom-made stained glass shower panels, as the stained glass formed a mural in the form of a silver anchor overlooking a shimmering blue sea, adorned by a cobalt sapphire backdrop.

Scanning your eyes to the left, you soon noticed a pair of fantasy-themed vanity stalls adjacent to each other, which had numerous brews and makeup tools upon the vanity tables. Looking further more still, it was there you soon noticed an ornate toilet of sorts. That us, if World of Warcraft had modern day plumbing in it's universe.

And finally, you then took notice of a large yet homely sink and mirror setup, jutting out from the wall on the right. "*sigh* Thank goodness..." You murmured, relieved to see an actual mirror to use. From there, despite the slowly dimming darkness due to these supposedly magical candles lighting the room a tad, you calmly approached the sink and mirror, slowly but surely making out your reflection in the mirror.

Eventually, after progressing your way toward the mirror, you soon wiped the sand from your eyes for clearer resolution to your vision and sight. But then, upon laying your eyes at your reflection before you, you soon saw that...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: Instinct Over Logic
