1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
Eventually, after progressing your way toward the mirror, you soon wiped the sand from your eyes for clearer resolution to your vision and sight. But then, upon laying your eyes at your reflection before you, you soon saw that...

"Oh shit!!" You audibly exclaimed, quickly stumbling back in shock, swiftly closing your mouth in the process due to the sudden loud noise from your maw. Hesitantly, you slowly stood back up onto your feet, as you again approached the mirror. In it's reflection, you saw a bulging paunch of a belly covered in silver gray fur, where a pair of equally bulbous breasts rested upon the curve of said gut.

Looking downward, you gazed upon your hands, which were now slightly longer, covered in light brown fur, and adorned with black lupine claw-like fingernails. "These...Th-These are the hands of a Worgen. I-If these are MY hands, th-then that means..." You mentally stuttered, your shock affecting your speech some, as you slowly bent down to look at your face in the mirror.

Or rather...to be more specific, your snout.

What you saw before you was not human nor male, but a rather corpulent female Worgen. In appearance, your head and snout were covered in a light brown coat of short fur, save for the silver gray stripe of fur connected to your lapine nose. Your brown Worgen ears poked out from your lengthy mane of dirty blonde waist length hair. However, besides such distinct facial features of a Worgen, your cheeks were certainly chubbier than the average female Worgen, along with a noticeable curve of a double chin, as well as a plumper neck.

Gazing downwards at your reflection, your massive mammaries, which were coated in a tuft of silver gray hair at the bottom half of such mammaries, were easily a J-Cup or a little bigger than that, since you remember Worgens being considerably larger than Humans, as you appeared to be standing at a sizeable 7 and a half to possibly 8 feet tall in height.

Speaking of size, you definitely were downright obese compared to regular Worgens, as you now bore a considerable paunch of a belly, which was accompanied by a light muffintop and a pair of wide fertile hips, which seemed to be around 4 and a half feet in diameter.

Turning yourself around a little, you soon took notice of your equally rotund buttcheeks, as the silver gray fur appeared to form the shape of a heart on your bulbous fur-covered behind, as your light brown Worgen tail sat atop such an indiscreet derriere. Looking down toward the floor, you soon realized that your digitgrade lupine legs weren't spared from such a weight gain, as you could easily feel your now fatter thighs touching a rubbing against one another. However, your calves bore some rather impressive musculature, which would explain why you weren't suddenly collapsing onto the floor this very moment.

Overall, you soon came to grips with this revelation, as you were now an obese female Worgen. And yet, as you closely examined the new you in the mirror, you couldn't help but feel like something about your lupine appearance seemed so familiar, as you pulled up your upper lip with an index finger to inspect your sharp lupine teeth. "...Why does this appearance looks so familiar?" You mentally questioned yourself, examining yourself further a bit more.

But soon, upon gandering at your eyes, where the left eye was a bright violet whilst the right eye was a shimmering yellow, your mind soon realized why your appearance seemed very familiar.

After all, this was the appearance of YOUR female Worgen Paladin! Or at least, when she didn't weigh over a quarter ton. You were an avid role player, since you spent what seemed like hours creating the backstory for your character. It was there you suddenly remembered your Worgen Paladin's name:

Rayja Silverclaw

In her backstory, you wrote up that she was from a long family lineage of Paladins, starting with her great-grandfather, to her grandfather, then her father, and now her. However, she became a Worgen when she attempted to help defend the people of Gilneas, only to be afflicted with lycanthropy after a fierce battle alongside Genn Greymane.

You vividly remember role-playing as Rayja for countless hours on end. Hell, you even remember writing a long fan fiction romance story of Rayja falling in love with Jaina Proudmoore, your favorite character in World of Warcraft!

And yet, despite your internal joy at what feels like a waking dream, you couldn't help but ask how did this all happen, as you subconsciously yet gently traced the open palm of your paw-like hand upon your billowing paunch of a belly.
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: Wide, Waddling Worgen

choices: Morning had arrived, as you awoke from the past night.
Morning had arrived, as your stomach soon growled for sustenance.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
But then, your Worgen ears soon pricked upwards, as you heard the audibly loud clicking noises of a doorknob being violently twisted in a hurry. From there, the door quickly swung open, as Jaina surprisingly rushed in, Staff of Antonidas in hand, as if she was ready for a fight.

"Rayja?! You alright? I heard you scream." She exclaimed, as if checking to see if there were any potential intruders. Once she saw that the only ones were you and her, she positioned the Staff of Antonidas like a walking staff, as you sheepishly retorted, "Oh! Um...sorry about that, Jaina. I kinda scared myself a little."

Upon hearing yourself for the first time, you noticed that, despite being in your Worgen form, you actually had a rather soothing feminine voice, which was unexpected, considering that when a Worgen talks, their voice has these growls accompanying their speech patterns.

Anyway, upon hearing your response, Jaina exhaled a sigh of relief, placing a plump left hand upon her wide hips, where she then let out a brief but light chuckle and jested, "*chuckle* Is that all? The "All-mighty and Heroic Worgen Paladin Rayja Silverclaw " scared of her own reflection?"

Of course, you obviously couldn't help but blush profusely in response to such unwitting embarrassment, which made the fur around your facial cheeks turn a crimson hue. However, Jaina soon approached you in reassurance, as you can now clearly see the size difference between you and her, clearly making you the bigger woman in the room.

From there, after leaning the magical staff against the nearby wall, Jaina placed both of her hands upon your own paw-like appendages, which seemed to be effective in comforting you, where she tilted her head to look up at you, but with a bit more regretful tone, and said, "...Sorry about the jest, sweetie. I know it's been hard for us ever since what happened at Kul Tiras."

"...Sweetie?" You thought, confused from hearing such a word coming from the rotund Archmage. "She wouldn't call me that, unless..." You continued, only for your thoughts to be interrupted by Jaina, who looked a little suspicious as she raised and eyebrow and queried, "...Uh, Rayja? Are you feeling alright? You seem a little...off."

"Oh, me? *chuckle* My apologies, Jaina. I'm just...deeply concerned for you." You quickly replied, where you then placed a chubby paw-like hand upon Jaina's waist, clearly seeing that the corpulent Archmage is wearing nothing but a pair of sky blue laced bra and panties, as you attempted to concoct a persuasive excuse.

"...In fact, I heard you mumbling in your sleep when I stir from slumber. You were mentioning someone named...Uther?" You calmly retorted, as you noticed how Jaina now bore this look of regret and heartache upon her somewhat rounder face, which made you instinctively concerned for Jaina.

From there, Jaina soon exhaled a deep sigh in response to your previous statement, as you subconsciously pulled Jaina close to you in a loving embrace, which caused your bellies to touch and squish against one another, despite the height difference between you two. Then, you tenderly spoke to Jaina with a loving and concerned tone as you asked, "...Do you...want to talk about it?"

In response, you felt Jaina give a firm but tender nod, which you felt as her head rubbed against your right breast. Shortly after letting out another deep sigh, Jaina soon began to speak, but with a somber tone, as she then explained, "...His name...was Uther Lightbringer. He is...WAS...a dear friend to me. He *sob*...was murdered...by the one I once loved, Arthas. Menethil."

"...The Prince of Lordaeron. *sigh* I understand how you feel, my love. I was there amidst both Alliance and Horde during the Battle of Angrathar the Wrathgate, and I too lost friends against the Scourge and the Lich King." You replied, still holding Jaina in a loving embrace, bearing a compassionate and understanding demeanor, as the powerful Archmage soon began to show a brief semblance of frailty, where she began to shed a few tears of sorrow.

After all, nothing tragic that Rayja Silverclaw had experienced could never hold a candle to the insurmountable tragedies that Jaina Proudmoore had endured. But as Jaina's tears began to stain and wet your fur, you soon speak once more in a calm and loving demeanor as you continued, "...I know nothing I've endured would never hold a candlelight to the insurmountable sorrows you've experienced, Jaina. But, should you ever need a shoulder to weep on, I shall be that shoulder, my lovely Daughter of the Sea."

Upon hearing your kind words, Jaina soon regained her composure, wiping away the tears from her eyes as she did so. From there, she looked back up at you, a small reassured grin adorned upon her rounded face, as she then retorted, "*sniffle* Thank you, Rayja. It...It means a great deal to hear such kind words from you."

"Anytime, my love. Now..." You quipped, where you suddenly hoisted Jaina up into your thick arms, which illicit a surprised "Oooh!" from Jaina, her eyes widened from such a sudden act, as you then continued, "...What do you say we return to our quarters and have a little fun?"

"*giggle* I think...that would be wonderful." Jaina answered, bearing a cheeky yet flirtatious grin upon her face, as you calmly carried her out of the spacious bathroom and back into the lavish bedroom, ready and will for some fun in bed.
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: In Comes Jaina Proudmoore

1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
They say the "truth is stranger than mere fiction". And suffice to say, the past night certainly felt like a mere fantasy.

But as you slept alongside Jaina after some passionate love-making, sleep overcame you both. But whilst the rotund Archmage slept like a babe, your "dreams" took on a more vivid experience.

In your subconscious, to began to dream of a mighty battle, between you and your fellow Alliance members along with some notable members of the Horde, and the wretched undead servants of the Lich King. You led the charge, two-handed gilded Warhammer grasped within your claws. You wound up your stance, preparing to swing a mighty blow against the deathly hordes.

Of course, they fell so easily against the combined might of your trained prowess as a warrior, as well as the holy powers granted to you as a Paladin, despite your bestial appearance. Though fortunately, your Worgen physiology certainly contributed to your overall might, as you bashed a wide swath through the ghoulish creatures.

The target of such a battle? It was none other than the Lich Necromancer and devoted follower of the Lich King, Kel'Thuzad. According to Commander Eligor Dawnbringer, Kel'Thuzad was the most loyal of the Lich King's subjects, and if he was struck down for good, it would deal a crushing blow to the Lich King's undead forces, as they would have one less powerful commander in their abominable ranks.

Of course, after smiting a good number of the undead forces, you confronted the Lich Necromancer himself, who raised his skeletal arms outwards, as if to tempt you to strike him down. However, the heroic Rayja Silverclaw was no fool, as you charged up your powers of the Light, and unleashed a torrent of mystical holy energies at the supposedly immortal Lich, temporarily knocking him off-balance. Quickly, you readied yourself to strike the unholy abomination, as you charged at Kel'Thuzad, lunged at him, swinging your mighty Warhammer upon his skeletal form. But as the head of the hammer was about to make contact with the Lich's skull...

--- *GASP!!* ---

You suddenly jolted up from the luxurious bed in a mild sheen of sweat, rapidly inhaling and exhaling to calm yourself. However, you soon took notice of the sunlight brightening the room, indicating that it was already morning. "Morning already, huh?" You thought, only to take notice of your current environs, then of your own person. "*sigh* ...So, I wasn't really dreaming all of this, after all. But still..." You thought to yourself, now coming to terms that what you experienced that night wasn't a dream, as you placed a plump paw-like hand upon the outermost curve of your paunch of a belly and continued, "...How did this happen, anyway?"

But then, before you could contemplate on this impossible conundrum, your stomach had other ideas, as it began to audibly growl in impatience, demanding for sustenance to be sated. Shortly after shooting an annoyed glare at your hunger pangs, you gazed to your left and quickly became aware of Jaina's absence, as her side of the bed was rather vacant in appearance.

"Hm. She must already be up and about by now." You mentally noted, as you then decided to arise from the bed as well, since now seemed a good time as any for a substantial breakfast. However, you soon noticed a nearby full-body mirror before you, which was adorned on the wall with ornate trimmings. Of course, from gazing at your reflection, you soon noticed something you ignored before:

You were completely naked, save for the thin coat of fur throughout your lupine form.

Obviously, you instantly blushed from such an embarrassing revelation, as you tried to look at the positives here and thought, "*sigh* Well...at least I probably won't have to worry about getting bigger undergarments in the future." Your mind had so many questions as to what has happened to you, and how you were magically transported into the World of Warcraft universe as your female Worgen Paladin character.

However, such a search for answers would have to wait, as you Doon heard the recognizable voice of Jaina Proudmoore, who seemed to be outside of the lavishly ornate private quarters, as she spoke up and audibly asked, "Rayja? Is that you I'm hearing lumbering about in our quarters?"

"Uh yeah it's me, Jaina! I just got up. Why? Is everything alright?" You exclaimed, replying back towards the rotund Archmage, wondering if everything was fine on her end. But before you decided to exit the bedroom, you soon heard Jaina once more as she swiftly retorted, "No, no! Everything is quite peaceful over here. No need to be grabbing for your Warhammer, my love."

"Warhammer?" You thought, as you soon turned your head to the right to take notice of what you assumed to be your Paladin Warhammer. In appearance, it looked exactly like the warhammer that your character wields in World of Warcraft. In fact, you fondly remember which materials were used in it's creation:

A lengthy wooden hilt carved from rich Mahogany, wrapped in intertwining leather and decorated with silken blue cloth with stark gold rune etchings on the cloth.

A pommel adorned at the lower end of the hilt, which was made from a fusion of gold and bronze, shaped into the form of an intricately detailed head of a Dire Wolf.

And to top it off, the warhammer's head was forged from a large chunk of extremely rare adamantine, as the head of the warhammer was forged in the same size as a man's torso, spine and pelvis included. It was held in place on the upper end of the hilt by gilded gold bindings, with Paladin runes carved into the sides of the hammerhead. The runes translated said:

"Where There's Misery And Despair, There Is Hope,"

"Where There Is Darkness, There Shall Be Light,"

"From Kalimdor To Northrend, A Paladin's Calling Is Never A Burden, But A Sacred Duty,"

"For Who Shall Stand Against Evil, But A Paladin?"

Upon reading this as the warhammer leaned against the nearby wall, you knew these etchings were undoubtedly a type of adage that Paladins use, where you soon remember the name you've given for the warhammer:

Sin-Burner

It was strange and alien to you, but...it was as if you could sense the warhammer's holistic essence and power radiating from the weapon, as if it bore a welcoming embrace.

However, as you gently reached out for the warhammer's hilt, Jaina's voice rang in your Worgen ears once more, as she spoke once more and exclaimed, "Rayja!? Are you coming to eat breakfast?" Of course, Jaina's voice snapped you out of such a distraction, as you violently shook your head thrice and quickly yet unconsciously answered, "I'm coming, I'm coming, Jaina! Just getting myself freshened up!"

"Heh! Well, you better hurry, honey! Your breakfast is gonna get cold~" Jaina replied, as if she sound like she once did before the bombing of Theramore, which seemed a little surprising considering. But who knows? Maybe the events that happened in your fanfic story might be canon in this version of Warcraft you've awaken in.

And with that, shortly after looking back at the warhammer for a brief moment, you soon head into the adjacent bathroom to freshen yourself for the day. First, you immersed yourself in the stained glass shower, rinsing your fur as said fur mildly absorbed the water like a sponge, whilst you washed and rinsed your voluminous mane of dirty blonde hair with a bottle of what you assumed to be homebrew shampoo.

Once you finished with washing yourself, your lupine sense of smell easily caught the mucky scent of wet fur. "Bleh! Now I know how it feels to smell like a wet dog. Eck!" You muttered to yourself, where you soon began to dry yourself off with a downright massive towel, though you had a hunch that drying yourself is going to be more difficult as a Worgen with all this fur.

Despite such difficulties, you were able to dry yourself off, as you then instinctively put your waist length hair into a beautiful half-braided ponytail. From there, now that you were properly groomed, you soon exited from the bathroom, as you then approached a massive cabinet, which held numerous articles of clothing, such as intricately woven dresses and gowns, along with formal clothes meant to be worn under a set of armor.

Going through your choices available, you eventually decided to pick...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: Not A Mere Fantasy

choices: Guided you to a seat at the table for breakfast.
Gently scratched your Worgen ears, which seemed to relax you more.
Actually, Jaina did something else instead...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
You tediously looked left to right at the various articles of clothing hung within the cabinet, still deciding on what to wear for the day. However, after a brief minute or two, you soon took notice of an intriguing piece of clothing, which came in the form of a beautifully woven purple gown.

In appearance, it was a downright massive dress, easily big enough for you to decently wear without feeling like it'll rip in multiple places with just mere step. It shimmered in the small gleams of sunlight, where it bore these intricate golden trimmings and cleanly woven patterns adorned upon the fabric. But in the back, there was a large opening in the back area, which seemed to accommodate for a lack of a hole for your tail, as the open back area was held together with intertwining strings to hold the dress in place, akin to a corset. And to top it off, it bore these loose but flowing sleeves in place of straps around the shoulder area.

Upon examining it in your paw-like hands, you couldn't help but display a cheeky fanged grin upon your mildly chubby lupine snout whilst you thought, "*giggle* Oh Jaina will certainly lose it if she saw me wearing this."

"Rayja! You still in there?" Jaina exclaimed, obviously wondering if you're still coming or not, as you quickly responded, "Just a minute~! I'm almost done getting dressed!" And with that, you soon decided to go with wearing the purple gown in your hands, as you soon tossed the towel aside, preparing to don the beautifully woven dress.

First, you inserted your legs through the opening in the dress, where you carefully pulled the gown upwards, to avoid making any accidental rips and tears in the fabric. From there, as you calmly put each arm through the dress arm sleeves, you put your Worgen tail through the bottommost opening in the string patterns in the back area of the gown.

And with that, you casually approached the full-body mirror to examine yourself, clearly seeing how the dress, despite it's beautiful weaves and patterns, easily flaunt about your fatty bulges with little effort, much to your hesitation, as you exhaled a mildly irritated breath from your lupine nostrils and thought, "...Well, it's certainly better than lumbering around as naked as a wolf."

Obviously not wanting to keep the bulbous Archmage waiting any longer, you decided to head out of the personal quarters, as you clearly felt how your thick bulky thighs casually rubbed against one another in your stride, thus creating a minute waddle in your step.

"Now I know how women feel when it comes to being conscious about their weight." You mentally thought, as you strided down the wide hallway, noting how easily you were adapting to your complete change of species and gender. However, your acute wolven sense of smell suddenly kicked in, as you began to detect these delectable mixture of edible aromas. It seemed so familiar, yet completely new.

Following your lupine nose, you calmly strutted your way towards the source of the numerous scents, feeling how your hefty Worgen buttocks lightly bounced and rippled with each striding step you made on your digitgrade lupine legs. A few moments later, you soon entered a vastly spacious open interior, which had a complete fantasy theme and design to it.

Rugs and carpets from all across Azeroth strewn about the interior, as well as some mystical and mechanically technological equipment spread into a few parts of the interior. Refocusing on the various scents, you soon looked upon what could only be described as a vast yet ornate kitchen area.

Before you, there was a large wooden dining table, easily big enough to seat a family of 20 people, complete with wide chairs made of iron and adorned with lush cushioned seating. Upon the table laid a eye-catching yet veritable feast, with various delicacies and edibles strewn about upon the finely carved and furnished furniture.

And finally, ahead of the table full if foodstuffs, There stood the rotund Archmage, Jaina Proudmoore, who was now fully dressed in her signature garments from the Battle For Azeroth expansion, complete with that trademark braided hairstyle she adorned herself with, as it seemed she was brewing something with several potions in hand.

https://images.app.goo.gl/rZp1y5aqm9bHZM...

However, it was there you soon heard the fattened yet still beautiful Archmage calmly singing a haunting yet enchanting tune as she hummed,

"Beware, beware the Daughter of the Sea. "
"Beware, I heard him cry."

"His words carried upon the ocean breeze,"
"As he sank beneath the tide."

"Those blood-soaked shores of Kalimdor,"
"Where sailors fought and died."

"The Admiral fell at Theramore,"
"Because she left his side."

Upon hearing the lyrics the plus-sized Archmage was singing, you instantly recognize what song Jaina was singing her soul out for; It was without a sliver of doubt the iconic "Daughter of the Seas" After all, you ARE a big fan of Jaina Proudmoore, so this haunting melody was easily recognizable. And besides, the lyrics itself told the entire story of Jaina Proudmoore, as it detailed about her role in the demise of her own father, Lord Admiral Daelin Proudmoore, who was killed on Theramore Isle, along with the ensuing aftermath following the events of Warcraft 3: The Frozen Throne, the sequel expansion to the main Warcraft 3 game.

Overall, it was a rather tragic melody, especially for Jaina Proudmoore, as you could easily hear the depressed undertones hidden beneath her singing whilst she continued,

"Why this? Why this, oh Daughter of the Sea?"
"Why this? Did you forget your seaside days?"

"Always the pride of our nation's eyes,"
"How could she go astray~?"

Now seeing that Jaina still bore a bit of heavy baggage, you instinctively approached Jaina from behind, where you then wrapped your thick furry arms around her from behind, unwittingly pressing your clothed paunch against her dressed behind.

Of course, upon feeling you physically, Jaina soon to cease singing the haunting melody, tilting her head to gently rub it against your bulky left arm, feeling the soft light brown fur on your forelimb, which seemed to calm her down substantially, now bearing a noticeable upward curve of her lips, her enchanting eyes closed in reminiscence.

"...Feeling alright, my love?" You quipped, speaking with a loving tone in your soothing feminine voice, as Jaina soon traced an open palm along the outer side of your thick left arm, feeling how soft and tender your fur was through her fingertips, then proceeded to respond with a confirmative nod and replied, "...I will live, Rayja. Just as long as you're here by my side~"

Although you've been in this reality for not even a day, you can certainly feel this deeply romantic connection between you and Jaina, as she turned herself around and the two of you proceeded to give each other a brief but passionate kiss on the lips. Or, lip to snout, as it were.

From there, Jaina soon noticed the dress you now wore, displaying a mildly smug smirk, placing her hands upon her wide burgeoning hips and chirped, "Well... I see that a certain Worgen Paladin I know has decided to dress herself like a lady for today. *giggle* It certainly suits you, sweetie."

"Heh heh, well you're lady-like guile was bound to rub off onto me sooner or later, Jaina." You retorted, easily bearing a somewhat light blush upon your plump furry cheeks, as you briefly rubbed the back of your lupine head out of brief embarrassment. From there, as she calmly yet lovingly held your paw-like hands, Jaina...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: Woven Violet Silk

choices: Go visit her mother, letting the events of Tides of Vengeance play out.
Wait a little to visit her mother, causing changes in the timeline.
But then, before you could decide, something was happening outside....
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
Like a domesticated hound on a leash, Jaina lovingly yet gently guided you along back toward the table, which was still decorated with numerous delectable cuisines. She had you calmly sit down upon the wide iron chair you had encountered before, while she then sat beside you in an adjacent seat, still displaying a doting curve upon her rosy lips.

Although, you couldn't help but feel like things were a little...out of place in a way, as Jaina soon grabbed at the meaty leg of a roasted bird, and cleanly tore the leg off from the cooked avian. From there, Jaina uncharacteristically presented the bird leg in front of you and cheekily quipped, "Come on, Jaina. It's your favorite~"

As if you were being tempted by gluttony, you unconsciously sniffed at the finely roasted bird leg, your mouth quickly salivating at it's succulent aroma. But then, as if by unrelenting hunger, you carefully took the bird leg from Jaina's grasp, and then, in a contrasting manner, viciously devoured the succulent meat from the bird leg like some wild beast, growling a little as you chewed on the delicious cooked flesh, which seemed ironic, considering you were now essentially the World of Warcraft equivalent of a werewolf.

Momentarily, you looked back at Jaina, who was stifling her laughter from your currently beastly behavior. And of course, you blushed profusely from such an act coming from you. After all, a Paladin shouldn't fully give in to such carnal temptation, as you turned your lupine head in some minor shame and lowly muttered, "...Sorry."

"*giggle* It's alright, my love. No need to be so high-strung." Jaina retorted, casually yet lightly patting the outermost curve of your paunch of a belly, which easily jutted out underneath the fabric of your purple dress. And yet, at the same time, it felt rather soothing, like a dog having her belly rubbed by her loving master, as you began to blush more, yet your now wagging tail told a different tale.

Strangely, it felt like some weird yet romantic form of foreplay, with you in the role of a pet, with Jaina being your "mistress", as your hunger soon took hold and you began to rip and tear at the aforementioned roasted bird, tearing cooked flesh and sinew from bone, your lupine tongue savoring the succulent taste from each piece of cooked meat that entered your maw.

Meanwhile, whilst you were preoccupied with devouring pieces of a roasted avian, Jaina began to eat breakfast as well, neatly biting into a freshly ripe and plump piece of fruit, then cleanly cutting a slice of chocolate cake, a complete opposite to one another when it came to proper dining etiquette for the time being.

==================
-- One Hour Later... ---
==================


When it was all said and done, the two of you had finished your morning feasting for today, as you and Jaina leisurely leaned back against your individual seats to allow your stomachs to more easily digest the food you've both consumed. Although she was as stuffed as you were, you certainly had the bigger stomach due to your Worgen physiology. The violet silken fabric covering your paunch of a midriff looked to be straining under the noticeable increase in belly bulge, almost threatening to split down the middle at the seams, which seemed to be fortunate enough to hold together for now.

"*exhale*...I must admit; You've certainly outdone yourself, Jaina." You commented, letting your stomach digest all of the cooked meat now churning in your stomach acids. In response to your compliment, Jaina placed a mildly plump hand upon your paw-like hand, holding it in her grasp as she stated, "I appreciate the compliment, my dear. After all, I know a few excellent Hunters who can seek out prey worthy of your taste buds."

"*chuckle* Well, they're certainly prestigious, that's for sure, hehe!" You jest, feeling to be in a rather jovial mood right now just after eating a hearty meal. However, despite your praises, you soon noticed that something seemed to be bothering the stuffed Archmage, as she now bore this contemplative yet mildly mournful expression on her rounded face.

Of course, like a hound caring about it's master, you soon took heed of Jaina's fouled mood, lightly squeezing her hand with your own paw-like appendage, as you then spoke toward her, bearing a deeply concerned and sympathetic tone in your voice, and asked, "...What seems to be troubling you?"

"*deep sigh*...Mother wants me to visit her and Tandred at Lord Admiral's Rest, my family's royal crypt. I... I am unsure if I should go or not, Rayja." Jaina explained, which undoubtedly revealed a great deal as to the time period of the Warcraft universe you were currently in.

But whilst you keenly and compassionately listened to Jaina's rambling, your thoughts began to connect the pieces as you mentally elaborated, "Well... This certainly clears up a lot as to where and when I am at in World of Warcraft. Judging from what Jaina has said, she must have already reconciled with her mother, Katherine Proudmoore, as well as the people of Kul Tiras after what happened in Frozen Throne. Then...that must mean that Jaina's now Lord Admiral of Kul Tiras, and the major events surrounding Jaina during the Tides of Vengeance update hadn't happened yet, which means I must probably living with her in Boralus, Kul Tiras' capital city, most likely in Proudmoore Keep."

However, as much as you were both relieved and completely thrilled at this abundant revelation, your thoughts soon refocused themselves upon the rotund Lord Admiral, who gazed upon you with her radiant sapphire blue eyes, as if seeking you for wisdom. She spoke toward you with a pleadful look in her sapphire gaze, showing her frailty once more as she asked, "...What should I do, Rayja?"

Upon hearing such a pleading question from the mighty Jaina Proudmoore, you could clearly see, as plain as the sunlit horizon, that you had to make an extremely important and intensely critical decision. On one side, you could tell Jaina to go visit her mother and Tandred at Lord Admiral's Rest, thus safely playing out the events that had occurred in Tides of Vengeance.

But on the other hand... You could advise her not to visit her mother and Tandred, thus risking altering ramifications in certain events in Tides of Vengeance and possibly any unforetold events yet to come. In the end though, you knew you had to make a very difficult decision that could change things.

Eventually, after some brief contemplation, you exhaled a deep sigh, then said she should...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: Quality Time & Personal Matters

choices: Focused around healing others with the Holy Light (Holy).
Focused on tanking all forms of damage (Protection).
Focused on exerting large amounts of damage on the enemy (Retribution).
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
Weighing such high profile choices before you, a momentary but prolific thought crept it's at to the forefront of your subconscious:

Jaina, with all the experiences she's endured throughout the Warcraft universe...was a somewhat damaged individual.

From watching her beloved Prince Arthas treading down a darkened path and eventually becoming the dreaded Lich King, to betraying her father Daelin for the betterment of peace between the Alliance and the Horde, gaining the ire and hate of her people in Kul Tiras, to the infamous bombing of Theramore and the countless lives lost in the magically-induced explosion. Overall, in your own words before your current disposition, "Jaina has gone through a lot of shit".

And the once optimistic Jaina Proudmoore has indeed endured a lot of tragedy in her life.

And yet, in your deepest thoughts, due to your high amounts of favoritism towards Jaina, you felt obligated -- No, dutiful! -- to be by her side through thick and thin, no matter who or what stood in your way. From there, you then spoke toward Jaina and reassuringly answered, "...In all honesty, my beloved Archmage... I think you should pay your mother a visit. After all, in my opinion, it is sometimes best to re-mend such withered bonds between your family and your people."

"And besides..." You continued, where you then leaned forward and administered a tender peck on her lips and elaborated, "...I think you've been feeling guilty for far too long, and a reconciliation is long overdue."

Upon hearing your kind advising words, Jaina's eyes briefly turned to the right before returning to gaze upon you, where she soon queried, "...Even if it meant falling in love with another woman?"

"...Wait, what?" Your internal thoughts exclaimed, as you soon realized that Rayja Silverclaw, YOU, were currently in a romantic relationship with the rotund Archmage, which was both shocking yet not. After swiftly refocusing your thoughts, you instinctively but slowly turned yourself to face Jaina, placing your other paw-like hand upon her mildly plump hand, showing her great reassurance as you subconsciously answered, "...Even that, my Lady. Not a day has passed that I've regretted confessing my love towards you back at Orgrimmar. And if they don't approve, then damn them all."

And with that bold confirmation, despite her still full stomach, Jaina swiftly wrapped her arms around your plump neck and somewhat rounder shoulders, as she then spoke with a tender voice and said, "...Thank you, my love. This... This means a great deal to me."

"...It is my earthly pleasure, my Lady. I would rather see you smile once more." You replied, wrapping your thicker furry arms around Jaina in response to her loving embrace. In a way, it felt as if you felt more at peace with Jaina by your side, as the loving embrace between you and the now rounder Daughter of the Sea felt like it had lasted for an hour.

However, as much as you despised ending such a romantic interaction between you and your favorite Warcraft character, you knew that it would be best that the two of you leave to rendezvous with Katherine and Tandred Proudmoore, as you gazed back upon Jaina, who currently had her head snuggling against your larger bosom, with you easily taking notice of how large your fur-covered mammaries were compared to Jaina's head.

"...Rayja, can I request something from you?" Jaina queried, as you tenderly stroke her head with your left paw-like hand, like a doting mother comforting her child. In response, you curved the lips on your lupine snout to form a caring smile and replied, "...Of course, sweetie."

"...I... I would like you to accompany me when I visit my mother and brother. Would you be willing to do so?" She asked, obviously not wanting to be alone when she reunites with her blood relatives. After all, when it comes to massive affairs, such as commanding an army or participating in combat with her magic, that's the Jaina Proudmoore you knew and love. But...when it came to such intimately personal affairs, you could easily see the cracks and chinks in the woman's mental armor.

So of course you were intending on accompanying the rotund Archmage when she visits her mother and brother at Lord Admiral's Rest, as you hugged Jaina a little tighter in response and confirmation, where you then answered, "...You don't need to request such a thing like this to me, my Lady. You know where my true loyalties lie. With you."

In response to your passionate confirmation, she swiftly hugged you tighter as well, before letting go as she replied, "...I know. But I wanted to." From there, she slowly stood up from the chair, while you did the same. You looked back at Jaina, mildly cradling the undercarriage of your stuffed paunch with one paw-like hand, as you then spoke toward her and asked, "So...When do you want to leave for your family's cemetery?"

"...I think it would be best we leave as soon as possible. They might already be at Lord Admiral's Rest by now." Jaina answered, making a speculative answer of Katherine and Tandred's current whereabouts. However, despite your utter willingness to escort the rotund Archmage through her family's cemetery, your still digesting stomach would have none of it, gurgling in protest whilst you stood up on your thickened digitgrade lupine legs, causing you to give an unamused glare at your churning stomach.

"*sigh* Well... As much as my stomach is complaining right now, I agree with you. Just...let me see if I can get out of this dress and into a more proper set of attire." You retorted, emphasizing on your digesting stomach's bitching and moaning before Jaina, who easily understood your minute dilemma and answered, "*giggle* Of course, my love. I shall wait for you in the meantime."

And with that, as you watched as Jaina calmly walked away from you, her obviously fatter behind rippling and bouncing subtly under the hems and cloth of her dress skirt, you soon refocused your efforts on returning to the master bedroom, as you somehow remembered seeing a full suit of plated Paladin armor placed upon a robust mannequin.

"*sigh* ...Might as well hustle this fat furry ass of mine back into the bedroom. Though, I'm starting to have doubts if I can even fit into that set of armor at my current weight." You contemplated, as you lumbered your way back inside the private quarters of you and Jaina. But fortunately, it seemed to be getting a little easier to be carrying around such heft, which still made you wander how you and Jaina got so fat to begin with.

However, such an adipose-related topic would have to be put on hold, as you inevitably returned to the personal quarters that was reserved for you and the corpulent Archmage. And there, standing opposite of your warhammer, Sin-Burner, stood an ornately designed yet adeptly functional suit of heavy Paladin armor. Remembering how your character played as a Paladin, you soon remembered that the skills of Rayja Silverclaw you knew and created were...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: Consistent Continuity

choices: From there, you soon returned to Jaina to see if she was ready as well.
But then, you soon heard Jaina's voice, calling out to you.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
Normally, when a player chooses the Paladin Class, they had three specialization skill trees to choose from, which would dictate their playstyle from that point on after reaching level 10.

There was the Holy specialization, which primarily meant one would serve as a healer in a dungeon party, meaning one would focus on healing And reviving any fallen allies.

Then, there was the Protection specialization, which meant being the "Tank" of the group. To be a Tank in a game such as World of Warcraft, one must be willing to be the focal point of every enemy, absorbing the damage they dealt unto oneself, thus preventing any allies from being attacked themselves.

And finally, there was the Retribution specialization, which was primarily and solely focused on unleashing insurmountable damage upon one's enemies, with numerous abilities tied to dishing out attacks on either a single enemy, or multiple enemies at once.

<The song "14 Years In The Kreisau Circle" from the Wolfenstein: The New Order soundtrack begins playing>

But as you casually reached for your warhammer, Sin-Burner, it felt as if the synapses and nerves in your brain were suddenly alight with sheer muscle memory and instinctual prowess, like repressed memories suddenly resurfacing all at once. In response to such a psychological whiplash, you upended your warhammer, twirling the hilt within your clawed fingers, then proceeded to do some test swings of the blunt weapon with surprising amounts of finesse with great ease.

And with that, as you heaved Sin-Burner upwards, you let the upper threshold of the daunting warhammer rest upon your right shoulder, where you gazed upon the ensemble that you assumed to be your Paladin armor. "Hmph! Of course the armor would have those big pauldrons on them." You mentally remarked, noting how ornately detailed yet seemingly excessive the armor appeared.

The armor itself was forged from the lightweight adamantine alloys only found in certain parts of the world, as it had these bronze trimmings to it's decor. On the opposite left pauldron, it was scuttled in the form of a Dire Wolf's head, with it's metallic snout in a snarling position, sharp metal fangs bare, a completely aggressive contrast to the usual animal symbols that were synonymous with the holistic nature of a Paladin, usually taking a form of either an angelic eagle or the noble Lion.

"*sigh* Well, I better not keep my lovely Jaina waiting." You cheekily thought, obviously feeling rather giddy that you're legitimately hooked up with the real Jaina Proudmoore, as you soon began to strip the suit of plated armor in individual segments. However, as you calmly yet gently stripped the intricately designed gown from your rotund furry form, you somehow felt as if your whole body was completely turned on to autopilot.

In turn, as you began to unconsciously equip yourself with a short-sleeved gambeson shirt and a pair of loose but form-fitting light-armored pants, your consciousness unknowingly drifted into the fathomless recesses of your mind. And yet, you were not truly unconscious, as your aware consciousness floated through the ceaseless voidful depths of your mind, where you began to experience these highly exuberant visions -- No, not visions. More like... memories.

It felt like hours, maybe even days, as you vividly experience the memories of Rayja Silverclaw, whether it was in the form of the notorious hard-fought battle against the Lich known as Kel'Thuzad, to the fallout of the bombing of Theramore and witnessing Jaina inflamed rage against the Horde for the dishonorable atrocity, to the reignited war between the Alliance and the Horde (courtesy of the Banshee Queen, Sylvanas Windrunner) at the Battle of Lordaeron alongside Jaina, and...well, just about almost every concurring event and questline in between.

You were unsure of how many of these memories you -- No! Not you, but Rayja Silverclaw -- had watched and participated in, for it seemed as if there was too many to count. In a way, it was as if the spirit of Rayja Silverclaw was pouring all of her experiences she had accumulated whilst you played as her, all of her wisdom, her fighting prowess, and more... into you.

However, by the time these vivid memories had relented, you soon found yourself fully equipped in the wolf-centric Paladin armor. And you must admit: it fits rather comfortably, as you noticed a royal purple silken cloak adorned on your back, with the hood easily away from your Worgen head, as it lopsided against the intricate gilded pattern of the cloak. However, you soon noticed a distinct insignia upon the cloak's fabric:

The silver illustration of a wolf's head, with a crescent moon and claw marks intertwining with one another behind the wolf's head.

Suffice to say, in the words of Will Smith, "You made this look good."
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.title: Retribution In Skill & Honor

choices: Tandred accompanied Katherine to Daelin's tomb.
Genn Greymane was present as well, alongside Tandred.
Actually, it was one of the primary maids of Proudmoore Keep.
1553322223322223232223222222323233222112.content:
Once you fully donned yourself in the Worgen-sized Paladin armor, you took the liberty of making sure every strap and belt was properly and comfortably secure on your person. And with that, as well as a brief self-examination in a nearby mirror, you felt content with the equipped garments, where you soon lumbered toward the door, grabbing the lengthy hilt of the warhammer midway, swinging it until the weapon was slung along your shoulder like carrying a knapsack.

Upon traversing the doorframe, you cautiously turned yourself to the side for easier passage, then turning back to a forward-facing position, as you heard the subtle clinking and clacking of metal plate and chainmail slowly shifting to and fro with each step forward you made toward Jaina.

And whilst you approached ever closer back towards the rotund Archmage, your acute Worgen hearing easily picked up Jaina's mournful humming, alongside the scuttling of several items in the process, you soon came upon Jaina, who had just finished up in packing some necessities in case of a potential assault on Boralus during the visit to Lord Admiral's Rest.

"...I'm listening now...Father." Jaina mournfully whispered, where you instinctively approached her from behind to reassure her once more, gently grasping her with semi-gauntlet-covered hands. From there, you calmly whispered into Jaina's ear and hushed, "Jaina...You don't have to go if you don't want to."

"I know...I know. ...But this is something I must do." She slowly retorted, which prompted you to end the affectionate embrace, as the rotund Proudmoore soon grabbed for the Staff of Antonidas, exhaling a deep breath to sooth her hesitant nerves before turning around to face you and firmly complied, "...Let's go."

===Boralus===
==Kul Tiras==

Roughhewn wooden planks lining intertwining various walkways, terraces, and stairs.

Sea-weathered rooftops and awnings adorned on the rooftop of every building.

And amber-lit windows and walkway lanterns lending a honeyed tone to the atmosphere.

This was what many could describe when it came to walking the very streets of Boralus, the largest harbor city of the island kingdom of Kul Tiras, serving as the nation's capital city and governing seat of House Proudmoore.

It was there that House Proudmoore called Proudmoore Keep their home.

Found to the far west of the city, bordering the areas of Upton Borough, Unity Square, and Proudmoore Academy to the south and west, it wasn't just the home of House Proudmoore, but also known as a fortress.

And yet, it's denizens were somewhat recovering after the harrowing events that led to a siege of Boralus by Priscilla Ashvane and her pirate allies, as well as the return of the famed Kul Tiras Fleet and a long-lost relative, Tandred Proudmoore.

As you and Jaina waddled down the lavish naval-themed halls of Proudmoore Keep, you noted how both the Elite Guards and servants of the castle worked in tandem with one another to repair the castle grounds to it's previous glory prior to Lady Ashvane's vain siege on Boralus.

However, the mere morbid thought of that bloated arrogant socialite was enough to make your blood boil, along with rousing the bestial side of your Worgen self, inciting a lupine self-snarl, showing your sharp fanged teeth for all to bare.

"...Something the matter, Rayja?" Jaina asked, noting the physical behavior of your Worgen snout, causing you to calm down somewhat, emitting a blush on your behalf. Quickly, you confessed, "*sigh* ...My apologies, My Lady. Just thinking back to a damnable Priscilla. To be frank, that woman makes my blood boil."

"Huh. And here I thought Paladins were above grudges." Jaina curiously retorted, stirring up a conversation as a modest distraction from today's errands, to which you calmly interjected, "--Only when they're not threatening to harm or execute those we care about. If she ever shows that stupid face of hers again, I won't hesitate to bare my fangs around her throat."

"I know how you feel, my love." She acknowledged, to which she soon momentarily stopped her locomotion, turning around to face you, where she then placed a chubby gauntlet hand upon the outermost curve of your apron paunch of a fur-covered belly, which was suitably covered over by a layer of chainmail, segmented plate armor, and a tabard bearing the crest of House Proudmoore for all to see.

Of course, you couldn't help but blush just a tad deeper by this affectionate action by Jaina's hand, to which the newly-christened Lord Admiral soon continued, "...But don't worry. Ashvane can run while she's still free, but we'll eventually get our chance to pay her back."

"But for now, let us meet up with my mother and Tandred." Jaina answered, to which an upward curve of your lupine lips appeared on your furry face and snout, nodding in agreement as you complied, "Then let us not keep them waiting."

And with that, the two of you continued down the elaborate halls of Proudmoore Keep, taking several turns whilst you followed closely behind Jaina, akin to a personal bodyguard. Eventually, after much traversal, the two of you soon entered the outdoor family crypt of House Proudmoore, Lord Admiral's Rest.

Situated in the gardens on the side of Proudmoore Keep, it was where many Lord Admirals were laid to rest, along with members of the Proudmoore family. Due to their occupations as sailors, sometimes the graves were presumably empty, devoid of their respective corpses, most likely due to a body never being found amongst the cold, dark depths of Azeroth's oceans.

Originally, Tandred was initially thought to be dead, his body lost beneath the waves, so Katherine Proudmoore, Jaina's mother, had a crypt commissioned to be built to honor the supposedly fallen child of Daelin Proudmoore. And yet, after the events that led to Jaina becoming the new Lord Admiral, the crypt was now a reminder of how relieved Jaina and Katherine were that Tandred still drew breath.

Once you and Jaina approached the main area of Lord Admiral's Rest, which bore a large monolith-esque crypt of the late Daelin Proudmoore, you soon discovered that Katherine Proudmoore was already present there, but she was not alone...

155332222332222323222322222232323322221.content:
Hmm... So, you have chosen the elegant yet ruthless Sylvanas Windrunner then, huh?

...Well, why not. After all, Sylvanas is one of the most easily recognizable characters from the Warcraft series.

Now, for those who need a refresher on who she is or those who are curious about who Sylvanas is, here is a summary of her backstory:

Lady Sylvanas Windrunner, also known by the titles of "The Dark Lady" and most famously as "The Banshee Queen", is the Warchief of the Horde and the supreme ruler of the undead masses known as "The Forsaken", which happens to be one of the most powerful factions of undead in Azeroth. In life, Sylvanas was the ranger-general of Silvermoon, whose leadership acumen and martial prowess were without equal.

During the events of Warcraft 3, she bravely defended the city of Quel'Thalas from a Scourge invasion, led by the Death Knight and wielder of the runeblade Frostmourne, Arthas Menethil. Ultimately, however, Sylvanas fell in battle. But rather than honor the ranger-general with a quick death, Arthas ruthlessly ripped out her soul and transformed it into a banshee: a cunning and vengeful agent of the Lich King empowered by hate.

When the Lich King's control over his minions weakened, Sylvanas broke away from her tyrannical master's control and reclaimed her body. Vowing to avenge her death, Sylvanas gathered other renegade undead and set out to wage war against the Scourge. Thus it was that the Forsaken came to be, with Sylvanas as their queen, and under her command, the Forsaken joined the Horde and later helped bring about the Lich King's downfall in the frozen wastes of Northrend. Afterwards, she seeks out a higher purpose for a people who have already died once.

Well then, now that we got to understand Sylvanas a bit more, the more important question remains...

...How big would you like Sylvanas to be?

155332222332222323222322222232323323112.content:
Ah, Mobile Suit Gundam. The very series that started it all.

Now then, in order to avoid confusion, we'll separate the ladies of Gundam into two categories, based on their chosen factions: The Earth Federation, and The Principality of Zeon.

Real Name: Kycilia Zabi

Gender: Female

Military Rank: Rear Admiral

Age: 27

Hair Color: Red

Eye Color: Maroon

Bio: Kycilia Zabi was born as the only daughter of Degwin Sodo Zabi.

With a cunning intelligence, Kycilia was quick to adapt to the changing technology of the One Year War and was equally proficient in gathering intelligence for use against the Federation. She was in charge of the Principality's Mobile Suit Forces, as well as being responsible for their use against the Federation.In addition, she was responsible for the creation of numerous elite Mobile Suits, including Char Aznable's (while aware of his true identity as Casval), the 300th Independent Corps (also referred to as "Char's Newtype Corps), the hand-picked Chimera Corps, and the Midnight Fenrir covert ops team.

However, due to lack of information, Kycilia is portrayed ambiguously during the main series and the various side stories surrounding the One Year War, with her motives often open to question and debate. She is shown to be fiercely loyal to the people of Zeon and to the men under her command. Yet many of her actions, however, can also be interpreted as those of a charismatic but utterly merciless manipulator of the highest order, preparing for a military coup.

155332222332222323222322222232323323113.content:
Hmm, so you decided you weren't satisfied with the first two choices? That's fine.

Now then , as for what these two series have to offer, here's a synopsis for Mobile Suit Gundam: The 8th MS Team...

Universal Century 0079: The Jungles of Southeast Asia.

During the One Year War, the Earth Federation and the Principality of Zeon are fighting a brutal guerilla war for control of the area and it's resources. Zeon's best hope for victory in the region rests with an experimental mobile armor, the Apsalus and it's pilot, Aina Sahalin.

Meanwhile, the Earth Federal Army, which has been fighting the Zeon in the region, receive reinforcements in the fiorm of Ensign Shiro Amada, newly named commander of the 8th Mobile Suit Team.

Aina and Shiro have met each other from a mutual rescue in space, but when Shiro discovers that Aina is in fact the pilot of the Zeon mobile armor, he us arrested for treason.

The Federation offers Shiro one chance at redemption: He must take the 8th MS Team deep into Zeon held territory to find Zeon's hidden base.

With Zeon backed into a corner, and the Federation dependent on Shiro and his team for victory, the star crossed lovers must decide where their true allegiances lie: With each other? Or with their respective sides?

Now as for Mobile Suit Gundam Thunderbolt...

During the One Year War of U.C. 0079, the Earth Federation and Principality of Zeon engage in a fierce battle at the infamous Thunderbolt Sector, a shoal zone in the former Colony Side 4 "Moore". After successfully infiltrating Zeon's sniper field, ace Federation pilot and jazz enthusiast Io Fleming is given control of the latest Gundam prototype, the FA-78 Full Armor Gundam.

Eight months after the end of the One Year War, the Federation is embroiled in post-war turmoil. A new faction has emerged: The South Seas Alliance, who has come into possession of the Psycho Zaku. In a mission to secure or destroy it, Ensign Io Fleming has been selected to pilot the latest Federation prototype: The Atlas Gundam.

Meanwhile, remnants of the Principality of Zeon continue their fight for independence. Daryl Lorenz, the former pilot of the Psycho Zaku, has gone to Earth to join the Zeon remnants, where he has been tasked with obtaining information on the Psycho Zaku. In the three-sided struggle, the new battlefield is the Australian continent, still scarred from the events of the One Year War.

Now then, which shall you choose?
155332222332222323222322222232323323113.title: The One Year War's End

1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.content:
Alright, so you're not satisfied with the previous choices, hmm?

Well, here is the synopsis for Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory...

Universal Century 0083: Zeon intelligence has identified a prototype Gundam designed for nuclear attack under development by Anaheim Electronics. A former Zeon ace and a small band of Principality soldiers are dispatched to Earth to capture the Gundam as part of Operation Stardust. When the Zeon successfully make off with the prototype, the Earth Federation assigns the mobile suit carrier, Albion, to locate and recover the missing unit. When the stolen Gundam fires at the space fortress Konpei Island, the Federation Space Force suffers a catastrophic loss. As the Federation regroup, they learn that the Zeon have captured a space colony, Side 7, ostensibly with the objective of colliding it with the moon. When the colony's course is unexpectedly changed toward Earth, the true objective of Operation Stardust is revealed.

But as for Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam...

It is U.C. 0087, seven years after the end of the One Year War. After the events of Operation Stardust, the Earth Federation establishes an elite counter-insurgency division called the Titans to hunt down the remaining pockets of Zeon remnants. The Titans become overzealous in their mission, start resorting to brutal methods to achieve their goals, and become nothing more than ruthless tyrants with an ambition to rule the Earth Sphere. Two anti-Titans resistance groups, the Anti-Earth Union Group (AEUG) and their earth-bound counterparts Katana (led by Hayato Kobayashi), form to unite the various existing small forces in the struggle against the Titans. Their members consist of renegade soldiers of the Earth Federal forces, former soldiers of the Principality of Zeon, and militia from space colonies. Most notable is Bright Noa, who returns as captain of the assault cruiser Argama, the flagship of the AEUG space fleet, and Quattro Bajeena, who is really the legendary ace pilot Char Aznable, "The Red Comet".

Now then, which shall you choose?

Alright, so you're not satisfied with the previous choices, hmm?

Anyway, onto the next series, Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ...

As the continuation of Zeta Gundam, this series once again follows the story of the Anti-Earth Union Group (AEUG) battleship Argama after Kamille Bidan defeats Paptimus Scirocco. To fight off the Axis Zeon, now called the Neo Zeon, Captain Bright Noa recruits a group of teenage junk collectors led by the loudmouthed but powerful Judau Ashta, to pilot the Argama's mobile suits. Now sporting a line up of the behemoth MSZ-010 Double Zeta Gundam and the returning MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam, RX-178 Gundam Mk-II and Gundam-like MSN-00100 Hyaku Shiki, the group is nicknamed the Gundam Team. As such this became the first of a number of Gundam series where a team of AGundam mobile suits fight alongside each other regularly. The climax takes place at Side 3 in the Battle of Axis.

Now, as for Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack...

Making its theatrical debut on March 12th, 1988, Char's Counterattack is the final culmination of the original saga begun in Mobile Suit Gundam and continued through Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam and Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ, marking the final conflict of the fourteen-year rivalry between Char Aznable and Amuro Ray, and the end of the Earth Federation/Zeon conflicts.

1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.content:
Hmm... Still not satisfied, huh?

...Alrighty then, the next set of series are Mobile Suit Gundam: Unicorn, Mobile Suit Gundam F91, and Mobile Suit Victory Gundam.

And the first one is Mobile Suit Gundam: Unicorn...

U.C. 0096. Three years after Char's Rebellion, Banagher Links, a boy living at the manufacturing colony Industrial 7, meets a mysterious girl who calls herself Audrey Burne. Audrey claims that she is trying to stop the Vist Foundation rom handing over Laplace's Box to the Neo Zeon remnants known as the Sleeves, an act which could spark another war, and Banagher decides to help her.

But soon, the colony becomes a battlefield, as fighting breaks out between the Sleeves and the Earth Federation Forces, who have also come to stop the handover. As Banagher runs through the battlefield in search of Audrey, he has a fateful encounter with a white mobile suit, the Unicorn Gundam, which is the key to Laplace's Box.

What is Laplace's Box? What secret does it contain? The hundred-year curse of the Universal Century is about to be resolved.

Now, as for Mobile Suit Gundam F91...

The year is U.C. 0123. To accommodate the growing population, the Earth Federation has built new space colonies. However, the Crossbone Vanguard decides to seize these colonies to help establish it's extraterrestrial empire. Now, reluctant hero Seabook Arno and his Gundam F91 must lead a fierce struggle for suvival.

And finally, we have Mobile Suit Victory Gundam...

The year is U.C 0153. Twenty years have passed since the Crossbone Vanguard's assault on the Earth Federation. Beaten down and greatly weakened by the events that transpired, the Earth Federation soon comes under attack by the BESPA forces of the spaceborne Zanscare Empire.

Only the League Militaire stands in their way, along with the League's newest secret weapon: The Victory Gundam, which they use against the invading BESPA forces. Who will ultimately survive?

Now then, my friends. Which series will you choose?

1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.content:
The sounds of Beam Rifle. The destruction of advanced mechanized units. That's what it was like in the universe of Mobile Suit Gundam. You were a humongous fan of the long-running franchise, whether it was from watching the numerous anime series,to the video games, to some of the model kits you've built and collected for the remainder of your childhood.

As you had just finished up a match in the video game, Gundam Battle Operation 2, you decided to call it in for the night after a long day's work of grinding to unlock the Jegan as a playable Mobile Suit. But as you laid yourself down upon your bed and succumbed to slumber, that would be the last time you saw your apartment, not knowing of what fate had in store for you.

== 8 Hours Later... ==

You slowly start to woke up to a feeling of...weightlessness? "Strange. I don't remember my bed being this soft." You thought to yourself, as your eyes were readjusting to the increased brightness within your room. However, as your gaze eventually gained clarity, you soon came to a startling realization:

You ARE floating!

Your eyes widened with surprise, as you noted that you were hovering a few inches off of an industrial-style bunk bed. "Okay, that's totally not my bed!" You thought to yourself, as you began to examine your surroundings. It was there you realized that you were no longer in your room, let alone your apartment, as you rubbed the top of your head in confusion and loudly whispered, "...Jesus. What the hell is going on here?"

You attempted to dismount yourself from the bunk bed, noticing that feeling of weightlessness once more. "...Is it just me...or does it feel like I'm in zero gravity?" You muttered to yourself, trying your best to maintain your center of gravity in all this weightlessness.

However, as soon as you felt your feet touch the cold metallic floor, you soon heard a rather cold yet feminine voice murmur behind you that muttered, "...Gundam...Is...My ene...my..." Instinctively, you quickly turned towards the source of the voice, where you noticed a bottom bunk below "your" bunk bed, revealing a rather large young woman.

In appearance, the woman had fiery orange yet silk smooth hair, which reached down a few inches below her shoulder blades, with the end of such a mane put into a loose yet lithe ponytail. However, when it came to the rest of her body, it was downright corpulent, complete with a pair of smooth fuller cheeks, a plump double chin, and a thick neck. Your eyes gazed downward across her enormity underneath the functional bedsheets.

Harboring a good estimated guess, judging from how much the bedsheets rose, the woman must to at least weigh around the 500 to 600 pound Mark. But still, even though she appeared to be rather attractive despite all that heft, you couldn't help but ponder upon her spoken words: "Gundam was her enemy."

"...No, that can't be right. The Gundam is pure fiction! And yet..." You thought, looking back at her with curiosity and confusion whilst your thoughts continued, "...Why does she look so...familiar?"

Your thoughts soon took a backseat, as you soon began to grow curious about your current environs. So, to sate this curiosity, you slowly made your way toward what you hoped was the exit. However, as you made your way toward the metallic industrial door, you felt as if you were taking large leaps in your stride, where you thought that you were going to bump into the door, only for it to automatically slide open upon close proximity, causing you to land outside of the bunkroom area with a soft thud.

"Ow! What's wrong with this place?! Is it in outer space or something?" You angrily thought, grasping the back of your head in mild frustration, as you slowly got up on your feet, which felt like you didn't weigh a single pound. However, you soon got a clear view of a somewhat vast open industrial area of sorts, with catwalks, industrial machinery, and various forms of equipment neatly organized about the place.

"Weird. This place looks like some sort of...hangar?" You contemplated, holding onto the metal railing as both support and to keep yourself grounded from floating off uncontrollably. But then, somethings caught your attention, as your gaze turned towards...
1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.title: Of Mobile Suits & Massive Ladies

choices: You soon noticed Zinnerman, captain of the Garencieres, approach you.
Marida Cruz, now somewhat awake, approaching you with a certain look in her eyes
The sound of an alarm erupted throughout the ship.
1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.content:
At first, upon looking the outright massive pair of mechanized behemoths, you weren't initially sure what they were. However, upon further inspection, your eyes widened in great shock and surprise, as you internally thought, "...What the?! Th-That's a Jegan!"

And your assumption was undoubtedly correct. The first machine before you was indeed a Mobile Suit. More specifically, an RGM-89 Jegan, an Earth Federation mass-produced Mobile Suit first used during the movie, Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack. However, there was some distinct differences between a regular Jegan and the one parked before you.

First off, the colors were completely different from the usual Jegan color set. Instead of a prominent pale cyan with blue lighting on the head of the Mobile Suit, the Jegan was mostly colored a dark olive-drab green, with clean-cut splotches of chalk yellow on certain areas of the machine, such as the shoulders, feet, and the forehead crest, while the lighting of the Mobile Suit, usually a bright green-blue hue, now had a flaming orange hue, while the Jegan shield was a collage of gun-metal gray, olive-drab green, and chalk yellow, with the two racks of missiles jutting out from the sides of the shield, as per it's manufactured design.

However, you soon noticed that the arms and shoulder pauldrons weren't that of a Jegan. Instead, judging from the design and angular curvature, the shoulders and arms were from a different Mobile Suit. More specifically, from the newer RGM-96X Jesta. On the shoulder pauldrons, two different insignia were adorned on each pauldron. On the left facing pauldron, a bronze shield outline with two parallel diagonal lines running through the center, while on the right pauldron, the unmistakable golden yellow emblem of Neo Zeon from MSG: Unicorn, used by the forces of Full Frontal.

Attached to the right side of the Jegan's booster backpack, was a massive sheathed two-handed blade, most likely made for slicing up Federation ships with one or two swings when aimed at a critical area. And finally, it was holding in it's left hand what appeared to be a Hyper Bazooka, which had a olive-drab green box magazine and barrel tip, with the magazine bearing the golden yellow Neo Zeon emblem upon it.

Overall, judging from it's wholesome design and some of the emblems obviously showing it's true allegiance, it must've been a stolen Federation Mobile Suit, repaired and repurposed to fight for Neo Zeon. "...Gotta admit; This looks like a custom Mobile Suit. A pretty good one, too." You thought, admitting that the machine before you looked quite impressive, considering it wasn't originally a Zeon M.S.

From there, you soon noticed a set of words lined along the length of the custom Jegan's right facing leg. Looking at it more closely, you could easily make out what they said:

"JEGAN - Z"

"Jegan - Z, huh? Has a nice ring to it." You thought, admitting it does sound like a better name than Zeon Jegan, that's for sure.

However, you soon became aware of what appeared to be a second Mobile Suit positioned behind the Jegan - Z, which appeared to be much larger than the machine in front of it. And strangely enough, it seemed even more familiar to you than the Jegan - Z, as you got a little closer to the larger machine. In appearance, it looked like it was in a green metallic cocoon, judging from the four massive wing-like folds adorned upon the machine.

You could easily tell that it was a Mobile Suit, just like the Jegan - Z. However, you soon instinctively jump back in shock upon quickly realizing that the Mobile Suit was. Your eyes widened with surprise, as your thoughts raced whilst you mentally exclaimed, "My god... Th-That's the Kshatriya!! And if th-that's the Kshatriya, then I'm onboard the Sleeves ship Garencieres. And if these are actual working Mobile Suits, th-then that means..."

In response to your shocking self-revelations, you quickly pressed your hands against the sides of your head on instinct, with you knowing the true answer to this conundrum, as you mentally scream, "...I'M IN MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM UNICORN!!"

Suffice to say, you were utterly flabbergasted by this revelation, leaning against the nearby wall, as you slowly slump down onto the metal walkway due to the low gravity inside the freighter ship. From there, you instinctively attempted to snap yourself out of such a glorifying yet speechless stupor, with you refocusing your thoughts as you mentally noted, "Snap out of it, (Name)! Calm down, calm down. *sigh* Okay, there's gotta be an explanation to this situation I'm in. An yet..."

Your thoughts soon turned to where the rotund, orange-haired woman was sleeping, as you came to terms with who that person might actually be, as you continued, "...If that's the Kshatriya below me, then...that mountain of a woman has to be Marida Cruz!"

In any other fantasy of yours, this would be a dream come true. However, you were still confused as to why she looked so obese in this situation you've awoke in. Overall, those questions had to wait for now, as...
1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.title: The Kshatriya & The Jegan Z

choices: You soon noticed that Marida was already quite awake.
You & Zinnerman heard Flaste on the main comms, asking for the Captain.
Actually, you both heard the sounds of an alarm going off...
1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.content:
"...Couldn't get much sleep, huh?" A voice rang out, which had an air of stoicism and some hints of jaded cynicism. You could easily tell that it was a man's voice, as you turned your head towards the source of the voice, only for you to find out that it belonged to none other than the captain of the Garencieres, Lieutenant Suberoa Zinnerman.

He looked like he leapt straight out of the anime series, as he was wearing his trademark outfit, which consisted of dark brown fur-collared open overcoat, doing little to hide the fact he had a beergut underneath a green zip-up shirt, along with a pair of black pants and loose work boots. Overall, his appearance was strikingly uncanny.

Instinctively, as a way not to show your uncharacteristic stress in this new universe you've awoken in, you huffed out a sigh, crossing your arms upon the metal railing and retorted, "*sigh* I guess. To be honest, I'm not entirely sure how this'll end once we do get Laplace's Box, Captain."

Fortunately, it seemed to work, since you just noticed that the Kshatriya still had all four shoulder binders, which meant you've awoken before the very first episode of Gundam Unicorn. Either that, or you were at the very beginning of the show's events, just before Marida engaged a squad of three Federation Jegans with the Kshatriya in the vastness of space.

However, you were soon brought back to reality, as Zinnerman stopped to stand alongside you, whilst you stared blankly at the parked Kshatriya, where he then spoke toward you, his grizzled hands in his overcoat pockets as he stated, "...I suppose that's fair, but we're gonna damn well try."

"*sigh* ...How's Marida?" He flatly asked, staring at the custom Mobile Suit as well, in which you instinctively replied, "She's still sleeping like a stone. Not that I don't mind, of course."

But still, it felt rather...strange, to be talking with the captain of the Garencieres, who also happens to be a father figure to Marida in the series. However, you knew you had to play along, otherwise the could ugly real fast. But who knows? It sounds like you're an established member of Zinnerman's crew, as he bore a content smirk, nodding in understanding and replied, "That's good to hear, I guess. Still don't fully understand why you wanted to have her weigh as much as me and Alec, but...*heh* can't argue with results."

Upon hearing this, the gears in your head soon wound up, which made you come to a realization: You're most likely the definitive cause for Marida Cruz's newfound enormity. And yet, much to your internal surprise, you seemed...okay with this? Sure, you had a mild fantasy involving seeing plus-sized women, but it wasn't something to write home about. However, you looked back at Zinnerman with a cocked eyebrow of curiosity and queried, "...Results?"

"...Marida seems to be more...free-spirited, as of late. When we're not on sortie, it's as if she has more...passion, you could say. More gusto, like a gunnery sergeant on shore leave. Especially...when she's with you, Ensign." Zinnerman elaborated, which subtly revealed another possible revelation to you: You're possibly in a strong romantic relationship with Marida Cruz.

And yet, he also revealed something else worth noting; You're an Ensign, which meant that you're a rank lower than Marida, who so happens to bear the rank of Lieutenant Junior Grade, while Zinnerman was a Lieutenant (even though his crew call him "Captain" due to being the leader of the Garencieres).

And yet, you couldn't help but mentally smile at this. After all, you somewhat considered Marida Cruz as your personal "waifu", even though she's now as real as the Mobile Suits you're gazing upon. And yet, you were still confused as to how you even got here in the first place, but right now...you didn't care for the time being.

However, whilst you and Zinnerman were staring off into the limited horizon...
1553322223322223232223222222323233231133.title: A Captain's Wisdom
